title: UI Designer
description:
Are you ready to take our players on an incredible journey? Do you aspire to create the world’s best mobile games? We are seeking UI talent to help us level up and ensure our games are as inclusive and engaging as possible. You’ll drive our team forward to deliver unforgettable experiences that delight players across the world
  
Your role within our Kingdom
  
As a talented UI Designer, you’ll work closely with UX and game designers, user researchers, developers, game artists and technical artists. Collaborating with other specialists in your feature team, UI lead and producers, you will work on the effective and optimised user interface systems and new player-centric features for Candy Crush. You are following your passion for interaction and communication design and strive to learn more about it applying these design principles in practice.
  
As a member of the Candy team you’ll participate in a cross-location collaboration. We believe your communication and organisation skills will help you to champion our cooperation on features and information exchange among the teams.
  
Skills to create Thrills
  
You have experience in UI design
  
  

You have a well-developed sense of visual aesthetics
  
  

You understand the need of assets optimisation and keen on technical constraints
  
  

You can apply interaction and communication design to your work
  
  

You are a proactive and reliable team player
  
  

You have good communication and organizational skills
  
  

You are willing to expand your professional knowledge
  
  

Bonus Points
  
Experience in UI design for games, mobile games as a plus
  
Experience in UI implementation with game engines
  
Skills in animation, motion design and/or special effects
  
Interested in typography and iconography
  
Experience working with design specs
  
Experience working in an agile project environment
  
  

A portfolio demonstrating all aspects of your skill, including any relevant personal projects, is required.

title: Service Designer for automotive company
description:
On behalf of our client, we are now seeking a Service Designer to enhance and develop digital fleet management tools. In this role, you will focus on improving platforms that provide valuable insights into machine status, productivity, and health for both electric and diesel-powered machines. If you have a strong background in digital service design and are passionate about creating customer-centric solutions, this is an exciting opportunity for you!
  
  

**ABOUT THE ROLE:**  

As a Service Designer, you will play a key role in shaping user experiences for fleet management tools by translating customer needs into actionable service improvements. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to bridge the gap between user requirements, business goals, and technical feasibility. Your work will involve conducting customer research, visualizing service journeys, and facilitating creative workshops to drive alignment and innovation.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Design and refine digital services that enhance customer experience and operational efficiency.
  
Conduct research to understand customer needs, translating insights into actionable strategies.
  
Develop service journeys, blueprints, and visual touchpoints to communicate design concepts effectively.
  
Collaborate with stakeholders across various functions, ensuring alignment between technology, business, and user experience.
  
Facilitate workshops—both digital and in-person—to drive ideation and co-creation.
  
Establish methodologies for measuring and improving customer journeys and service performance.
  
  

**WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR:**  

A relevant educational background in service design, UX, or a related field, supported by a portfolio showcasing previous work.
  
A minimum of 2 years of experience working with the design and development of digital services in a corporate environment, including expertise in customer research, persona development, service journey mapping, and blueprinting.
  
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate data into strategic improvements.
  
Excellent verbal and visual communication skills, capable of presenting complex ideas to stakeholders at all levels.
  
Ability to collaborate across teams, influence decision-making, and drive alignment toward customer-centric goals.
  
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.n.
  
  

**ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:**  

**Employment type:** Full-time, long-term
  
**Start date:** As soon as possible or as per agreement
  
**Location:** Göteborg
  
**Contact person:** Gustav Widman, gustav.widman@friday.se
  
**Salary:** Fixed monthly
  
Apply by clicking the link below. Be prompt with your application, as we continuously review candidates, and the position may be filled before the application deadline.
  
  

**ABOUT FRIDAY:**  

By partnering with our clients and candidates, we aim to find the best match for both. We achieve this by truly understanding our clients' and candidates' needs. We ensure that requirements and skill sets align, but, most importantly, we focus on harmonizing values and corporate culture, which both candidates and clients find ideal.
  
  

Our passion is to help people find their dream job in the IT & Tech field. This ambition is a significant part of the reason why Friday was founded, with the goal of finding workplaces that give you the "Friday feeling" every day.
  
  

We primarily focus on young engineers who are at the beginning of their careers or soon to graduate from university in the IT and Technology field. We believe that people reach their fullest potential when they look forward to going to work each day. "Friday – every day," how does that sound?

title: Senior Fullstackdeveloper (React & TypeScript) Stockholm heltid
description:
Modernera är ett modernt rekryteringsföretag. www.modernera.se
  
På uppdrag av en kund söker vi nu en senior fullstackdeveloper med fokus på React och TypeScript. Vår kund är ett snabbt växande konsultbolag där teamanda, kreativitet och nyfikenhet står i centrum. De arbetar i framkant av både teknik och design och vill nu förstärka sitt team med en erfaren utvecklare som älskar att bryta ny mark.
  
  

**Du kommer att:**  

* Arbeta i spännande nyutvecklingsprojekt där du får stor möjlighet att påverka både teknikval och processer.
* Implementera lösningar med React, TypeScript och Next.js.
* Bidra till arkitektur och backend, gärna med dokumentdatabaser (Document DB) och relaterade tekniker.
* Eventuellt arbeta med IoT, CAN Bus, CouchDB/PouchDB och Azure-tjänster (meriterande).
* Arbeta i ett agilt och DevOps-inriktat team, där du deltar i hela utvecklingsprocessen från idé till lansering.


**Du har:**  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av fullstack- eller frontendutveckling med React och TypeScript.
* God förståelse för Next.js och kringliggande ekosystem.
* Erfarenhet av backend-tekniker, t.ex. Document DB eller relaterade databaser.
* Vana av GIT, agila arbetsmetoder och DevOps.
* Intresse för design och UX som en naturlig del av utvecklingsarbetet.
* Förmåga att lyssna in kundbehov, hitta lösningar och leverera med hög kvalitet.


**Du är:**  

* Prestigelös, nyfiken och trivs med att arbeta i ett team där ni delar kunskap och testar nya idéer.
* En problemlösare som gärna tar egna initiativ och snabbt kan anpassa dig till nya utmaningar.
* Intresserad av att ligga i teknikens framkant och vill ständigt utvecklas tillsammans med dina kollegor.


**Du får:**  

* En kreativ och stöttande arbetsmiljö med utrymme för kompetensutveckling och personlig tillväxt.
* Möjlighet att delta i intraprenöriella projekt och utforska nya tekniker.
* Kontor i centrala Stockholm.
* Fast lön med goda utvecklingsmöjligheter, flexibla arbetstider och generöst friskvårdsbidrag.
* Mobiltelefon, arbetsdator, tjänstepension, sjukförsäkring och andra förmåner.


Du kommer att bli anställd hos vår kund på heltid. Anställningen inleds med en provanställning på sex månader, som därefter övergår i en tillsvidareanställning. Tillträde: enligt överenskommelse.
  
Ansökan
  
Skicka ditt CV och personligt brev till info@modernera.se. Ange ”Senior Fullstackdeveloper (React & TypeScript) Stockholm heltid” i ämnesraden.

title: UX till Bolagsverket
description:
Detta uppdrag utförs både i nära samarbete med övriga team och på egen hand, med en stark betoning på kontinuerlig dialog och samverkan. Genom korta feedback-loopar och regelbunden kommunikation med Kunden och dennes verksamhet blir du en aktiv del av hela utvecklingsprocessen.
  
  

**I vårt agila team kommer du dagligen att arbeta med att:**  

**– Skapa användarcentrerade digitala upplevelser:** Utveckla intuitiva och engagerande tjänster som både optimerar Kundens interna processer och tillgodoser externa kunders behov.
  
**– Samarbeta operativt:** Stödja Kundens team i det dagliga arbetet för att främja ett gemensamt arbetssätt där lösningar utvecklas tillsammans, snarare än att enbart överlämnas.
  
**– Föra konstruktiv dialog:** Arbeta nära UX-designledningen för att säkerställa att designstrategier och användarupplevelser kontinuerligt förbättras.
  
**– Driva kontinuerlig utveckling:** Utforska och implementera nya sätt att samarbeta, effektivisera processer och säkerställa hög kvalitet genom hela projektets livscykel.
  
För att säkerställa långsiktig framgång i utvecklingsarbetet är det centralt att du bidrar till att bygga en kultur präglad av kvalitet och automatisering, där agila metoder står i fokus. Inom ramen för uppdraget ingår även att dokumentera arbetsprocesser och överföra kunskap till relevanta medarbetare hos Kunden.
  
Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter
  
**– Förstå och analysera användarnas behov:** Genom intervjuer, enkäter och användartester identifiera användarnas mål och beteenden, vilket utgör grunden för en användarcentrerad design.
  
**– Utforma användarflöden och strukturer:** Planera och strukturera produktens sidor och funktioner för att säkerställa en logisk och intuitiv navigering.
  
**– Skapa wireframes och prototyper:** Visualisera gränssnittet genom att ta fram både enkla wireframes och klickbara prototyper, vilket möjliggör tidiga tester och justeringar innan vidare utveckling.
  
**– Genomföra användartester:** Testa designkoncept med riktiga användare för att identifiera förbättringsområden och optimera den slutgiltiga upplevelsen.
  
**– Säkerställa tillgänglighet:** Arbeta aktivt med att integrera tillgänglighetsprinciper i designen samt stödja teamet i utveckling, testning och granskning av tjänstens tillgänglighet.
  
Övriga arbetsuppgifter
  
– Bidra till teamets arbete med kravhantering och testning, exempelvis genom att tillämpa beteendedriven utveckling (BDD).
  
– Ge tekniskt stöd i frågor rörande design och tillgänglighet med hjälp av verktyg och teknologier såsom HTML, CSS, JavaScript och Vue.
  
– Fungera som en sparringpartner i frågor kring Kundens designsystem och komponentbibliotek.
  
Arbetssätt
  
– Arbeta agilt, iterativt och värdeskapande med SAFe som agilt ramverk.
  
– Verka i ett agilt team där eget ansvar är centralt.
  
– Delta aktivt i tidiga faser med designsprintar för att snabbt kunna verifiera och validera koncept i en tvärfunktionell miljö.
  
Teknik och Verktyg
  
Figma, Jira, Confluence, Vue
  
Uppdragstid och Plats
  
Uppdraget löper från 1 april 2025 till och med 31 mars 2026, med möjlighet till förlängning fram till 31 mars 2027. Omfattningen är 100 % heltid, med möjlighet att minska till 80 % om så önskas. Upp till 60 % av arbetet kan utföras på distans, medan övrig närvaro sker på plats i Sundsvall.
  
Om Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Lead Designer
description:
**About us**


Coffee Stain Studios is the largest team under the Coffee Stain brand, where our journey began back in 2010. We've recently launched **Satisfactory 1.0**, after a highly successful Early Access period with over 6 million copies sold.


Micromanaging is not our style, so everyone needs to take responsibility over their own work. We want everyone to feel like they’re contributing to the end product and thrive towards always becoming better at what they do.


**About the Role**


As Lead Designer, you'll split your time between hands-on development—working in-engine to implement features, refine content, and resolve issues—and supporting and mentoring the design team to help them grow and succeed.


You will work closely with Leads, Producers, and designers to ensure that the game design is fun, engaging, and aligns with the overall vision of the project. Whether you are designing features, coaching your team, or collaborating with other departments, your work will have a direct impact on the game.


**As a Lead Designer, you will**

* Lead and inspire a team of designers, providing guidance and support for their creative and professional growth.
* Collaborate with the Game Director to ensure the design aligns with the project’s vision and goals through continuous feedback and quality assurance.
* Engage directly in game design, contributing to the creation and refinement of features, content, and player experiences.
* Collaborate with other departments (art, programming) to ensure a cohesive and engaging game experience.
* Manage the team’s workload and resource planning in collaboration with Producers and other Leads.
* Develop and maintain documentation for design processes and game mechanics.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Team Leadership and Mentorship: Support your team members by providing feedback, conducting 1-on-1s, and fostering a healthy work environment.
* Creative and Technical Input: Develop and review game mechanics, level design, UI/UX and narrative to create a compelling player experience.
* Quality Assurance: Provide feedback, conduct reviews, and guide the team to ensure the design is playable, balanced, fun, and meets established quality standards.
* Communication and Coordination: Act as a bridge between the design team and other departments, keeping everyone aligned on progress and needs.
* Strategic Support for Workflows and Creativity: Work with the team to refine workflows, improve tools, and use resources effectively to keep things running smoothly and creatively.

**We’re looking for someone who has:**

* A minimum of 5 years experience in designing for PC and/or console games, including at least 2 years in a Lead Designer or similar leadership role.
* A solid understanding of game design processes, from concept to launch.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-disciplinary teams.
* A keen eye for detail and a drive for creating memorable gameplay experiences.
* Experience contributing hands-on to projects and delivering high-quality content.

**Bonus Points**


* Experience working in Unreal Engine.
* Experience working on live games or Early Access models
* Experience with level design, particularly in open-world and non-linear environments.
* Having spent a few hours playing Satisfactory, or experience with similar games and genres.

**Practical info**


The position is permanent, full-time, 40 hours per week on-site.


You will spend the majority of your worktime at our office on Hertig Johans gata in Skövde, but it´s okay to work from home from time to time.


At our office we have a casual workplace environment including bicycle parking, our own amazing in-office gym, game and chill-out zones. There are also plenty in-office hangouts and parties.


You’ll be working with a friendly team that consists of both Swedish and International people. We get plenty of self-development opportunities – tutorials, creative time, participation in various industry conferences and events.


Our office is constantly supplied with breakfasts, snacks, fruits, tea and coffee to keep your energy up.


Coffee Stain Studios is part of a family of several studios, creating a network of over a hundred talented game creators. We talk, throw parties, and support each other professionally. We like the combination of being a relatively small team in our studio combined with the gain belonging to a big, warm community, being able to share invaluable knowledge and experiences with our colleagues.


**Perks of being a Coffee Stainer**

We offer competitive salaries with excellent benefits. We try to follow the Collective Agreement as close as we can, which means payments to your pension fund and insurances. We also believe that a healthy body leads to a healthy mind, so everybody gets time off to work out. In Sweden there is a well-being allowance called Friskvårdsbidrag that covers extra things like gym subscriptions, swimming, massage etc. There is also an option to book massage sessions at the office.


As an employee you will also have creative time every other week which lets your inner passion blossom. You will also have influence over your own work and taking initiative is encouraged. This goes for the projects we work on as well as life at the office in general.


On top of all that you get to work with an awesome team in an amazing and very spacious office!


You can take a closer look at some of our fabulous crew on our YouTube channel: Coffee Stain YouTube Channel


We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Content Creator
description:
**JOB OPPORTUNITY AT MELYON! : CONTENT CREATOR** 




  





 Melyon, a Swedish skincare brand founded in Stockholm in 2020 by Roger Dupé. With roots in West Africa, the Scandinavian lifestyle brand combines the best from nature and science, to create safe and ethical products with proven results. The skincare line is made with people of color in mind, focusing on conditions commonly found among darker skin tones while still being suitable for most skin types. 
 



 As we transition from startup to scale-up, we are in search of Content Creator to drive expansion efforts and growth in new and existing markets
 



  





 You'll be integral in shaping and communicating our prestigious brand identity within the luxury cosmetics sector. Collaborating closely with our Marketing & Growth team, your primary focus will involve developing our brand, refining our marketing strategy, and enhancing our visual identity. 
 



  





**What will your key responsibilities be?** 




 -        Graphic Design: Create captivating and tailored advertisements for platforms such as Meta, Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube. This entails designing visually stunning ads optimized for maximum engagement and conversion.
 



 -        Photo/Film Production: Oversee the entire process from conceptualization to production of photo and video content. Plan and execute photo shoots and filming sessions that effectively capture our brand essence and convey our message.
 



 -        Editing: Skillfully edit and refine image and video content with meticulous attention to detail, ensuring both visual appeal and technical excellence.
 



 -        Technology and Innovation: Harness digital technology and AI to enhance and streamline content production processes. Stay abreast of the latest trends and tools in digital marketing and content creation.
 



  





**What will you need to be successful?** 




  





**Desired requirements:** 




 -        Professional Experience: Demonstrated expertise in graphic design, photography, and videography, with a proven track record of managing projects from conception to completion.
 



 -        Technical Proficiency: Mastery of advanced editing tools such as Adobe Photoshop, Indesign, and Premiere Pro.
 



 -        Creative and Strategic Aptitude: Blend of strong creative flair and strategic acumen to design content that captivates and converts effectively.
 



 -        Language Skills: Excellent proficiency in both Swedish and English languages, crucial for seamless collaboration within our international team.
 



 -        Forward-Thinking and Innovative: Passion for exploring how digital technology and AI can revolutionize content creation and marketing strategies.
 



  





 As we embark on an ambitious international expansion phase, we're seeking a creative and visionary Content Creator who shares our passion for diversity, inclusion, lifestyle, and skincare. Your role will be pivotal in shaping and elevating our brand presence globally, resonating with our target audience through compelling content. Expertise in photography and videography, coupled with a knack for creating groundbreaking content and effective ads, is highly valued at Melyon.
 



  





 We prioritize creativity, collaboration, and continual improvement, both in our products and our work processes. 
 



  





 We aspire to drive positive change in our industry with a firm commitment to diversity and inclusion. Here, you'll play a significant role and have the opportunity to shape our future trajectory. 
 



  





**What Melyon Offers?** 




 -        Embrace a culture defined by ambition, joy, and unwavering teamwork!
 




 -        This is a full-time position with an immediate start. 
 




 -        This is a 6 to 12-month project role with potential for extension. The position offers remote work with the option to utilize co-working spaces in Stockholm.
 



  





**If you are a dynamic professional with a passion for beauty, an entrepreneurial spirit, and the drive to make a significant impact, we invite you to join us on this exciting journey!** 




  






 To apply and join the Team
 
**,** 
 submit your CV and cover letter to Work@melyon.se.
 



  





 We eagerly await your application!

title: Performance Creative Designer
description:
**Join us in marketing world-class creativity apps used by millions of people.** 




  





**Appostrophe** 
  is a mobile app development company creating easy-to-use design tools that unlock people's creativity. Our portfolio consists of top-listed apps such as SCRL, Text Art, and Add Text that are used and loved by millions of people worldwide.
 



 We’re a focused and ambitious team in central Stockholm, built on collaboration and transparency. We’re looking for a Performance Creative Designer who shares our passion for design, storytelling, and empowering creators to help shape the future of SCRL.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 As a 
 **Performance Creative Designer,** 
  you will produce marketing assets that drive results, blending creativity with data-driven insights. You’ll be part of the in-house creative team and drive SCRL’s growth by producing high-performing digital ads.
 



  





**What You Will Do** 



* Design visually compelling Meta and TikTok ads that meet performance goals.
* Work in close collaboration with creative and performance marketing specialists.
* Blend user-generated content with motion design to craft high-performing ads that resonate with diverse audiences.
* Actively participate in A/B testing initiatives and build data-driven hypotheses, iterating on creatives for continuous improvement.
* Explore emerging and trending social media formats to keep our ad creatives fresh and competitive.
* Produce both English-speaking and localized ad variations that resonate culturally with specific audiences.



  





**You Should Have** 



* 2+ years of relevant experience as a motion design and video editor, with a focus on social media and performance marketing (particularly in creating Meta ads).
* Advanced proficiency in design tools like Figma and Adobe Creative Suite (especially After Effects).
* An understanding of core digital marketing principles and metrics and a strong interest in developing hypotheses for creative A/B tests.
* Clear and effective communication skills for presenting concepts and solutions to internal stakeholders.
* Ability to work at a high pace without compromising quality.
* Attention to detail and a drive for excellence.
* Experience in the agency or working with the apps is a plus.



  





**What We Offer** 



* Opportunity to drive the company’s global growth through impactful design.
* Work with talented colleagues at our central Stockholm office.
* Competitive salary.



  





**Ready to Join Us?** 




 We believe creativity should be accessible to everyone, and we’re excited for you to help bring this vision to life.
 



 Ready to shape the future of creativity? Apply now!

title: Frontend/UX Designer med passion för användarupplevelse
description:
Har du en passion för design och innovation? Har du arbetat med agila team för att snabbt identifiera, utveckla och leverera lösningar?
   

  

 Vi söker en kreativ och driven Frontend/UX Designer som brinner för att skapa användarupplevelser. Som konsult hos oss på Sogeti kommer du att arbeta hos kund för att förstå deras behov och skapa skräddarsydda lösningar som överträffar deras förväntningar.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av frontend-utveckling.
* Stor kunskap inom React eller Angular.
* Gedigen förståelse för RESTful APIs och GraphQL.
* Erfarenhet av versionshantering med Git.
* Kunskap inom tillgänglighet och WCAG – du vet hur man bygger inkluderande digitala användarvänliga upplevelser.
* Erfarenhet av CI/CD och att arbeta i moderna utvecklingsmiljöer.
* Har en UX-certifiering (exempelvis CPACC).
* Goda kunskaper i designverktyg som Figma, Sketch eller Adobe XD.
* Talar och skriver svenska flytande


**Vi Tror Även Att Du Är**
* En problemlösare med ett öga för detaljer och en stark känsla för estetik.
* Kommunikativ och kan arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med kundprojekt och kan anpassa designlösningar efter kundens behov och mål.
* Har förmågan att bygga starka relationer med kunder och team.


 Som en del av Sogeti erbjuder vi dig en trygg anställning där vi prioriterar våra medarbetare och balans i livet. Vi värdesätter en positiv arbetsmiljö och strävar efter att skapa en atmosfär där du kan trivas och utvecklas.
   

  

**Nyfiken på fler anledningar till att jobba hos oss? Kika in här:**
* Ditt Sogeti - Lär känna din framtida arbetsgivare!
* Dina förmåner - Få koll på vad vi erbjuder våra medarbetare!
* Medarbetarnöjdhet - Hur betygsätter våra egna sogetiare livet hos oss?


**Skicka in din ansökan med CV och portfolio redan idag!**
 Vi hanterar alla ansökningar löpande!
   

  

 Hoppas vi ses!
   

  

 /Team Manager, Emma Hägg
   

  

- 

 ,

title: iOS Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking audio innovation. We are home to Marshall, Natal Drums, Urbanears and adidas headphones.
   

  

 For over sixty years, we’ve amplified the sound of the world’s most talented artists. We’ve brought their music to crowds and solo listeners everywhere. We give sound a design that resonates with ears and eyes, as well as at a deeper cultural level. No matter the scene or music genre, we aim to excite, intrigue and surprise.
   

  

 Bridging iconic rock ‘n’ roll heritage with cutting-edge innovation and culture-driven brand-building, our group activities span professional music equipment, consumer electronics, live events, a record label, and more.
   

  

 We empower around 800 highly talented people across 8 global locations. Our products are sold in over 90 markets worldwide, totalling a combined annual turnover of USD 360 million.
   

  

***Right now,***
 we need to strengthen our Application Development team with an iOS developer that will be working with our cross-functional teams. The world of audio is changing. Smart speakers and True Wireless headphones are turning audio into a high-tech industry. In the last few years, our products have gone from simple wired devices to connected and complex IoT devices. We are now focusing on evolving our mobile app and the added value it can provide to our users.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Maintain and develop iOS mobile apps for the Marshall Brand.
* Contribute to the design and implemention of a scalable solution for our new iOS platform.
* Collaborate closely with our UX and firmware teams in developing and implementing our new features and functions.
* Support and participate in the testing and evaluation of the app's integration with the firmware.
* Drive knowledge-sharing sessions to promote new ideas and innovation.
* Define processes and frameworks for our newly established team.
* Prototyping new ideas to make them come true, both individually and across teams.


**Who We’re Looking For**
 We are looking for an experienced iOS developer with a collaborative mindset who cooperates well internally and externally. To succeed in this role, you need to be a committed driver with a problem-solving approach, focused on building quality products to create great user experiences together with the UX and design team. We believe you have a great passion for new technologies, new trends, and software development. You get excited by the idea of creating an amazing app experience that resonates with people not only on a functional level but also on an emotional level.
   

  

**You Probably Have The Following Experiences & Skills**
* 5+ years experience in iOS app development
* Experience working with Swift, Swift UI and Swift package manager.
* Proficient in modern iOS design patterns (for ex. MVVM, dependency injection)
* Strong understanding of the Combine framework
* Familiarity interacting with Firebase and Clean Architecture
* Good understanding of the developer testing infrastructure (Unit testing, UI tests, Jenkins, etc.)


 It's beneficial if you understand the Bluetooth stack, communication over GATT and AVKit; and WiFi stack.
   

  

 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, and it will in the end lead to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 If you have a passion for App development and want to work for a growing company with a start-up mindset, this job is a perfect match for you. Please send us your resume as soon as possible as we are reviewing candidates continuously.
   

  

*We look forward to reviewing your application!*

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
**Digital Marketing Manager till Yllw – Var med och bygg Europas snabbast växande projektlednings- och inredningsföretag!** 




  





 Vill du vara med och skapa något stort? Yllw är Europas snabbast växande projektlednings- och inredningsföretag, och vi söker nu en Digital Marketing Manager som får en nyckelroll i vår fortsatta tillväxtresa. I denna roll får du ansvaret att utveckla, genomföra och optimera Yllw:s digitala marknadsföringsstrategi – med målet att stärka vår digitala närvaro och bygga vårt varumärke.
 



  





 Det här är en unik möjlighet att vara med och implementera en digital marknadsföringsstrategi från grunden och verkligen göra skillnad i ett bolag på stark frammarsch. Är du redo att ta Yllw:s digitala närvaro till nästa nivå? Då vill vi höra från dig!
 



  
 



**Om rollen** 




 Som Digital Marketing Manager på Yllw kommer du bygga upp vår funktion för digital marknadsföring. Det innebär att du kommer driva alla våra marknadskanaler, utveckla våra processer, implementera verktyg och säkerställa att vi arbetar datadrivet och resultatorienterat i alla våra digitala kanaler.
 



 Du kommer att jobba mycket med content marketing och hantera och optimera kampanjer inom områden som sociala medier, sökmotoroptimering (SEO) och sökordsannonsering (SEM). Genom att analysera data och insikter säkerställer du att vårt innehåll driver trafik och ger ökat engagemang.
 



  





 Dina övergripande ansvarsområden:
 


1. Innehållsstrategi & marknadsföring
2. Planering & publicering
3. Innehållsskapande & produktion
4. Optimering & analys
5. Innovation & trendspaning



  





**Vem vi söker** 




 Vi letar efter en driven, kreativ och datadriven marknadsförare med en stark operativ förmåga som även kan höja blicken och tänka strategiskt. Du älskar att skapa innehåll som konverterar, engagerar och bygger varumärken.
 



  





 Kompetenser & kvalifikationer:
 


* Stark skriftlig kommunikatör med erfarenhet av att skapa engagerande och målgruppsanpassat skrivet innehåll.
* Förmåga att designa visuellt tilltalande marknadsmaterial och arbeta med grafiska verktyg som Figma och Photoshop.
* Kreativ förmåga – du skapar innehåll som är estetiskt tilltalande och sticker ut bland konkurrenter.
* Van att publicera innehåll på hemsidor, via e-post, i sociala medier och andra kanaler med hjälp av relevanta verktyg som CMS, Marketing Automation-system, planerings - & schemaläggningsverktyg.
* Förståelse för hur innehållsmarknadsföring påverkas av SEO och UX.
* Erfarenhet av Performance Marketing och förmåga att analysera och optimera kampanjer.
* Förmåga att analysera data i verktyg som Google Analytics och omsätta insikter till handling.
* Strukturerad och van att arbeta mot deadlines.



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 Hos Yllw får du möjligheten att vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa, där du bygger upp och utvecklar vår digitala marknadsföring från grunden. Här får du stort mandat att påverka – du driver och formar vår digitala strategi och har friheten att testa nya idéer och metoder. Vi tror på innovation och nytänkande, och vi vågar utmana branschen för att alltid ligga steget före. Dessutom blir du en del av en stark och engagerad företagskultur, där vi brinner för det vi gör och arbetar tillsammans för att skapa verklig förändring.
 



  
 



**Rapporterar till:** 




 Chief Operating Officer
 



  
 



 Mål för rollen:
 



 ✔ Driva in nya kunder till Yllw genom digitala marknadskanaler
 



 ✔ Öka Yllw:s varumärkeskännedom hos den relevanta målgruppen.
 



 ✔ Optimera alla digitala kanaler för att engagera och attrahera befintliga och potentiella kunder
 



  
 



 Ansök idag! Vi rekryterar löpande.
 



 📍 Placering: Östermalm, Stockholm
 



 📩 Kontaktperson: Victor Sundholm, Chief Operating Officer
 



 📧 Mail: victor.sundholm@yllw.com
 



  
 



 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
 








***Om Yllw***




*Yllw är Europas snabbast växande företag inom projektledning och inredning, med specialisering på kontor, hotell, restauranger och offentlig sektor. Yllw är en del av NO-GA Group, marknadsledare inom designmöbler i Skandinavien i över ett sekel.* 




  





*Som en pionjär inom cirkulära affärsmodeller och hållbara lösningar anpassade för inredningsbranschen, hjälper Yllw företag och organisationer att flytta, etablera eller expandera sin verksamhet sömlöst – utan affärsstörningar, med full kostnadskontroll och med ett starkt engagemang för miljömässig hållbarhet.* 




  





*Yllw:s unika affärsmodell kombinerar lokalt entreprenörskap och decentralisering med styrkan hos en marknadsledare. Yllw har framgångsrikt genomfört sin proof-of-concept-fas, visat marknadsledande lönsamhet och är nu redo för en kraftig tillväxt de kommande åren. Vi söker nu en person som vill vara en del av Yllw:s spännande tillväxtresa och forma branschens framtid!*

title: Mobile iOS Developer
description:
The Digital and Access Solutions (DAS) business segment within the EMEIA Division is looking for an iOS Developer to join the Electronic Access Control (EAC) product unit. If you are passionate about mobile app development and have a track record of building successful iOS applications, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 Join our team based in Stockholm, Sweden and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Mobile IOS Developer**
 As an iOS Developer you will develop mobile applications for our different Electronic Access Control systems. You would develop applications for configuration and operations of our wireless locks and systems. You will join a cross functional agile software team with mobile and cloud developers, QAs and a UX designer. You will work closely with our firmware team regarding communication with the devices. On top of this you will cooperate with product management on the app requirements.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and release new features.
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
* Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least three years' experience of mobile iOS app development, preferably with Swift.
* Experience with RESTful APIs and integration with cloud services.
* Experience with Swift UI and good understanding of iOS release cycle.
* Strong command of written and spoken English.


 Ideally, you have experience working with several of the following – development of mobile applications for connected IoT devices, BLE communication, Swift UI, APIs for offline storage, threading and performance tuning, security technologies such as TLS, Keychain, MFA, OAuth and PKI, iOS development, cross platform languages such as React native (expo), Kotlin multi-platform or Flutter, SAFe agile methodology. I addition, you share our belief in lean and agile values, with an open mind set, cross-functional teams, where many competences are working together for successful projects.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Mona Yusefi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at mona.yusefi@assaabloy.com
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Senior Fullstackutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Arbetet inkluderar en förstudie med utredning av teknisk plattform, följt av utveckling, implementering samt förberedelser för framtida förvaltning.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Vi söker en senior utvecklare med lead- och arkitekt-erfarenhet
* Du bör ha en bred teknisk bakgrund och vana att arbeta i agila team.
* Vi värdesätter särskilt erfarenhet av att leda tekniska beslut och driva projekt framåt.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av användarcentrerad utveckling och förståelse för slutanvändarens behov
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta agilt, gärna med Scrum eller Kanban
* Erfarenhet av Next.js, Node.js, TypeScript och Elasticsearch, PostGreSQL och Redis
* Erfarenhet av arbete med QA-verktyg, inklusive automatiserade tester och kontinuerlig integration (CI)
* Erfarenhet av att jobba med DevOps och moderna verktyg för kontinuerlig leverans (CD)
* Erfarenhet av containerhantering och orkestrering, gärna med Kubernetes
* Erfarenhet av API-design
* Dokumenterad relevant högskole- eller universitetsutbildning inom exempelvis datavetenskap, systemutveckling eller liknande
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med streamingtjänster
* Erfarenhet av att bygga inloggningslösningar tex Keycloak eller liknande
* Erfarenhet av att driva arbetsprocesser i digitala team
* Erfarenhet av test-driven utveckling (TDD) eller beteendedriven utveckling (BDD)
* Erfarenhet av att bygga kedjan för Continuous Integration och Continuous Delivery (CI/CD)
* Erfarenhet av arbete med tillgänglighet enligt WCAG
* Erfarenhet av nära samarbete med UX-designers och produktägare.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 20-02-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: HR-administratör till Gullers Grupp
description:
***Vill du ta en central roll och påverka HR-arbetet i en ny tjänst på Sveriges ledande byrå för samhällsaktörer? Gullers Grupp söker nu en HR-administratör till en platt organisation där en inkluderande och engagerad kultur präglar arbetsmiljön. Här får du möjlighet att forma och utveckla HR-processerna i en dynamisk och växande organisation!***
**Om tjänsten**
 Den här tjänsten är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Bravura och du anställs direkt hos Gullers Grupp.
   

  

**Om företaget**
 Gullers Grupp är Sveriges ledande byrå för samhällsaktörer med kunder inom både offentlig och privat sektor. Gullers Grupp erbjuder ett brett utbud av tjänster inom hela kommunikationsområdet och arbetar strategiskt och kreativt för att stärka kunders varumärken, skapa dialog och driva samhällsutveckling. Med över 200 konsulter på sju orter präglas arbetsmiljön av samarbete, kunskapsutbyte och en bredd av expertis – från statsvetare och journalister till UX-designers och kommunikationsstrateger. Kulturen kännetecknas av engagemang, nytänkande och en stark gemenskap, där medarbetare ges möjlighet att utvecklas och påverka både sitt arbete och företagets riktning.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som HR-administratör har du en central och administrativ roll med många kontaktytor där du stöttar organisationen i olika typer av HR-ärenden. Du arbetar nära redovisningsansvarig och övriga HR-ansvariga för att säkerställa att personaladministration hanteras smidigt och medverkar till utvecklingen av rutiner och processer. Arbetsuppgifterna innefattar bland annat administration kring avtalshantering, onboarding och offboarding, uppdatering av HR-policys samt stöd i arbetsrättsliga frågor. Du hanterar även administrativa delar kopplade till löneunderlag, sjukskrivningar, tidrapportering och semesterplanering.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för att HR-systemet används effektivt och hålls uppdaterat, samtidigt som du samlar in och rapporterar relevant HR-data för att stödja organisationens behov. Rollen innebär också att bistå med material i upphandlingar, säkerställa efterlevnad av kollektivavtal och arbeta med nya lagkrav som påverkar organisationen. Gullers Grupp är en platt organisation med korta beslutsvägar, vilket innebär att du får en bred roll med mycket samarbete och daglig interaktion med både medarbetare och externa parter.
   

  

* Administrera HR-ärenden som avtal, onboarding, offboarding och arbetsrättsliga frågor
* Koordinera sjukskrivningar, löneunderlag, tidrapportering och semesterplanering
* Optimera och vidareutveckla HR-systemet (Hailey HR) för att stödja effektiva arbetsflöden
* Stötta och säkerställa att HR-processer efterlevs i enlighet med lagar, kollektivavtal och interna riktlinjer, i nära samarbete med kollegor


**Utbildning, erfarenhet och personliga egenskaper**
* Avslutad eftergymnasial utbildning inom Personal- och Arbetslivsfrågor/Human Resources alternativt motsvarande erfarenhet
* Minst ett års erfarenhet inom HR-administration
* Talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska samt goda kunskaper i engelska
* Kunskap i HR och ATS-system
* Tidigare erfarenhet av arbete inom konsultverksamhet är meriterande


 Vi tror att du som söker har hög integritet och är en ansvarstagande och handlingskraftig person som kan arbeta självständigt. I den här rollen är det viktigt att du är trygg i att ta ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter samt att du snabbt kan anpassa dig till nya situationer. Vidare är du serviceminded och har en god förmåga att skapa och underhålla relationer till andra människor. Självklart är du också noggrann och detaljorienterad där du tar för vana att upprätthålla tydlig struktur i ditt arbete.
   

  

**Övrig information**
**Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Centrala Stockholm
   

  

**Lön:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Vi använder en kompetensbaserad metodik i alla rekryteringsprocesser för att säkerställa fördomsfria urval. Vi jobbar också med löpande urval, vilket innebär att vi tar ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har ansökt. Om du blir aktuell för tjänsten kommer vi att kontakta dig för en första telefonintervju. Oavsett om du går vidare i processen eller inte så kommer du att få återkoppling på din ansökan.
   

  

 Har du frågor om tjänsten eller kring din ansökan är du välkommen att kontakta vår support genom att maila till info@bravura.se eller ringa till nummer 010-171 47 10 så hjälper vi dig. Ange vilken tjänst det gäller.
   

  

 Vi rekommenderar att du skickar in din ansökan omgående då vi gör ett löpande urval.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Android Developer
description:
Marshall Group is the audio, tech, and design powerhouse uniting musicians and music lovers through genre-breaking innovation. Our flagship brand, Marshall, is uniquely positioned with over 60 years of rock ‘n’ roll attitude on stage, at home, and on the go. Our iconic products are brought to life by a dedicated team of 800 passionate employees and sold in over 90 markets worldwide.
   

  

**Right now,** 
 we need to strengthen our Software team with a Android developer that will be working with our cross-functional teams. The world of audio is changing. Smart speakers and True Wireless headphones are turning audio into a high-tech industry. In the last few years, our products have gone from simple wired devices to connected and complex IoT devices. We are now focusing on evolving our mobile app and the added value it can provide to our users.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Maintain and develop Android mobile apps for the Marshall brands
* Collaborate closely with our UX and Design team to discuss new features and functions.
* Support and participate in testing activities and evaluation of the app.
* Participate in knowledge-sharing sessions to promote new ideas and innovation.
* Teamwork with the other developers to help us brainstorm solutions and make our apps even better for our users.
* Prototyping new ideas to make them come true, both individually and across teams.


**Who we’re looking for:**
 You are an Android developer with a collaborative mindset who cooperates well internally and externally. To succeed in this role, you need to be committed to collaborative problem-solving, and build quality products to create great user experiences together with the UX and design team. We believe you have a great passion for new technologies, trends, and software development. You get excited by the idea of creating an amazing app experience that resonates with people not only on a functional level but also on an emotional level.
   

  

**You probably have the following experiences & skills:**
* + 2 years of proven professional Android app development experience.
* Experience working with Kotlin.
* Proficient in modern android design patterns (for ex. MVVM, dependency injection) and Jetpack components.
* Familiarity with coroutines and Compose, Dagger Hilt and Clean Architecture.
* Good understanding of Firebase & REST etc.
* Hence strong written and spoken English skills are essential.
* Experience with Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) is a plus.


**Our pledge:**
 We thrive to foster an inclusive workplace and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, disability, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age or marital status. We firmly believe that Marshall thrives when our employees do, leading to better experiences for our consumers.
   

  

 We encourage applications from all over the world. To enable transitioning from another country for a role at Marshall, we offer re-location support. This support is tailored for each role but always includes visa/work permit application, local authority registration, and home finding service. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions.
   

  

**Does this sound like you?**
 We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: Senior Hardware Engineering Manager
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
   

  

 As a
 **Senior Hardware Engineering Manager** 
 , you will join a team that serves as the engineering lead for the Speech Generating Devices and Accessories product area. You will oversee a cross-functional team of engineers and guide them to deliver excellent hardware products that align with Tobii Dynavox’s product strategy. Your team will be responsible for developing innovative, reliable solutions that empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. This role blends strategic leadership, technical expertise, and operational excellence to ensure that the products meet customer needs, comply with industry regulations, and are ready for scalable production
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Lead the engineering team in designing, developing, testing, and maintaining speech-generating devices and accessories, ensuring technical excellence and scalability.
* Act as the engineering lead for the product area, collaborating with Product Management, UX Design, and Program Management to define and execute the strategy
* Oversee and approve technical decisions, resource allocations, project plans, and timelines to ensure high-quality product delivery on time and within budget.
* Ensure compliance with industry standards such as ISO 13485, managing risk and delivering reliable medical devices.
* Manage the hardware development lifecycle from concept through production and post-launch maintenance.
* Foster a collaborative team culture, mentor team members, and promote continuous learning, innovation, and technical excellence.
* Approve key project deliverables, budget expenditures, vendor selections, and hiring decisions to align with organizational priorities.
* Perform additional duties as assigned to support broader company objectives.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone who has a:
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering such as Computer Science, Electrical, Mechanical, Software or a related technical field. Master’s degree preferred but not required.
* 10+ years in engineering, including 5+ years leading multidisciplinary teams (hardware, software, QA), with a track record of delivering hardware products into production.
* Expertise in medical device regulations and product safety standards such as FDA, ISO 9001, ISO 13485 etc.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, particularly with Product Management, UX Design, and Program Management.
* Strong understanding of the full product lifecycle from design to manufacturing and scaling hardware products.
* Proven ability to mentor and develop high-performing teams, fostering empowerment, accountability, and technical excellence.
* Strong in technical decision-making, strategic planning, agile methodologies, and problem-solving, with a focus on scalability and manufacturability.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Mobile Android Developer
description:
If you are passionate about mobile app development and have a track record of building successful Android applications, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 Join our team based in Stockholm, Sweden and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What You Would Do As Our Mobile IOS Developer**
 As an Android Developer you will develop mobile applications for our different Electronic Access Control systems. You would develop applications for configuration and operations of our wireless locks and systems. You will join a cross functional agile software team with mobile and cloud developers, QAs and a UX designer. You will work closely with our firmware team regarding communication with the devices. On top of this you will cooperate with product management on the app requirements.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and release new features.
* Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications.
* Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* At least three years' experience of mobile iOS app development, preferably with Swift.
* Experience with RESTful APIs and integration with cloud services
* Experience with Swift UI and good understanding of iOS release cycle.
* Strong command of written and spoken English.


 Ideally, you have experience working with several of the following – development of mobile applications for connected IoT devices, BLE communication, Swift UI, APIs for offline storage, threading and performance tuning, security technologies such as TLS, Keychain, MFA, OAuth and PKI, iOS development, cross platform languages such as React native (expo), Kotlin multi-platform or Flutter, SAFe agile methodology. I addition, you share our belief in lean and agile values, with an open mind set, cross-functional teams, where many competences are working together for successful projects.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* The opportunity to grow your skills in a versatile way and develop your career in a respected global group.
* Agile and innovative working environment.
* Motivated and encouraging team around you.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


**We review applications regularly, so don't wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Mona Yusefi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at mona.yusefi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Depending on the risk profile for the role, a background screening will need to be performed. Final candidates may therefore be a subject to a background screening. The performance of a background check is subject to consent and based on our Applicant Privacy Notice.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Requisition ID: 42374
Job Location(s):
Almhult, SE
**Job Description**
-------------------



Danfoss is proud to be at the forefront of driving a global transformation in digital and electric solutions that increase productivity and energy efficiency. We are truly passionate about investment, and innovation, as we continue to support our customers' journey towards a greener and lower-carbon future.

  


We now have an exciting opportunity for a **Software Engineer** to join **Danfoss Power Solutions** to strengthen our System Development Tools team. We work with developing a set of tools (PLUS+1 Tools) to support our customers in creating and maintaining control software for their machinery.

  


This role will be based from our facility in **Älmhult, Sweden**, with some remote work possible up to 2 days per week.


**Job Responsibilities**
------------------------



As our new Software Engineer, you will support the development with implementing new functionality in our tool chain. Your areas of responsibility will be to:


* Contribute to the overall functionality of our tools
* Participate in design and code reviews
* Develop software solutions using a high-level language IDE
* Provide maintenance and support for existing tool functions

  


Ideally, we are looking for candidates with experience in C# to develop Windows applications. But final tasks and responsibilities can be tailored according to the chosen candidate’s experience, potential and interest.


**Background & Skills**
-----------------------



To thrive in this role, we would expect you to demonstrate:


* Some experience in software development practices, processes and design
* Master’s or Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent technical field
* It is essential that your English language skills are fluent.
* Familiarity with C# and or C++
* Windows application development experience would be beneficial, as would experience in mobile or web application development

  




On a more personal note, you enjoy working in an international environment where everyone has their individual tasks but where there is a common goal for the whole team. You are structured and can adapt into changing situations when needed.

  

  

At Danfoss, we believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace fosters creativity, innovation, and a broader perspective in decision-making. When you consider this job posting, do you feel like your profile is not a perfect match? Numerous studies have found that women and people of color are more likely to apply only when they meet all requirements listed in the job posting. Even if you do not check all the boxes, we encourage you to apply anyway. We are curious to find out how you can bring new insights to the role or to Danfoss as an organization


**Danfoss – Engineering Tomorrow**
----------------------------------



At Danfoss, we are engineering solutions that allow the world to use resources in smarter ways - driving the sustainable transformation of tomorrow. No transformation has ever been started without a group of passionate, dedicated and empowered people. We believe that innovation and great results are driven by the right mix of people with diverse backgrounds, personalities, skills, and perspectives, reflecting the world in which we do business. To make sure the mix of people works, we strive to create an inclusive work environment where people of all backgrounds are treated equally, respected, and valued for who they are. It is a strong priority within Danfoss to improve the health, working environment and safety of our employees.


Following our founder’s mindset “action speaks louder than words”, we set ourselves ambitious targets to protect the environment by embarking on a plan to become CO2 neutral latest by 2030.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category.


  
Danfoss engineers solutions that increase machine productivity, reduce emissions, lower energy consumption, and enable electrification.


Our solutions are used in such areas as refrigeration, air conditioning, heating, power conversion, motor control, industrial machinery, automotive, marine, and off- and on-highway equipment. We also provide solutions for renewable energy, such as solar and wind power, as well as district-energy infrastructure for cities.


Our innovative engineering dates back to 1933. Danfoss is family-owned, employing more than 42.000 people, serving customers in more than 100 countries through a global footprint of 95 factories.

  

Danfoss engineers solutions that increase machine productivity, reduce emissions, lower energy consumption, and enable electrification.


Our solutions are used in such areas as refrigeration, air conditioning, heating, power conversion, motor control, industrial machinery, automotive, marine, and off- and on-highway equipment. We also provide solutions for renewable energy, such as solar and wind power, as well as district-energy infrastructure for cities.


Our innovative engineering dates back to 1933. Danfoss is family-owned, employing more than 42.000 people, serving customers in more than 100 countries through a global footprint of 95 factories.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
Job Description


AFRY is looking for an Embedded Software Engineer to further develop a software platform for connected digital locks. You will work across the entire stack, from hardware bring-up on new chipsets (such as Nordic Semiconductor BLE chipsets) to developing drivers for new peripherals and implementing high-level protocols over IP or BLE.


You will be responsible for bringing up new hardware platforms and chipsets, developing and optimizing embedded software in C, and implementing drivers for new peripherals. Your work will also involve designing and integrating communication protocols for BLE, Wi-Fi, and Thread, as well as working with RTOS-based environments such as Zephyr and FreeRTOS to ensure a robust and scalable platform.


Qualifications


* At least 5 years of experience in embedded systems development
* Strong proficiency in C
* Experience with hardware bring-up and low-level software development
* Familiarity with BLE, Wi-Fi, or Thread is a plus
* Experience with Nordic Semiconductor chipsets and Zephyr OS is a merit


Company Description


AFRY provides engineering, design, digital and advisory services. We are devoted experts in industry, energy and infrastructure sectors, creating impact for generations to come. AFRY has Nordic roots with a global reach. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable society.


Additional Information


This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge embedded systems in a dynamic and technically advanced environment. If you have a strong background in embedded development and want to shape the future of smart digital locks, we look forward to hear from you. In addition to an exciting and rewarding role, we offer a workplace with engaged leadership and a skilled team that enjoys fun activities together!


Application deadline: 2025-02-28


Contact:  

Marcos Cabral Svensson, Group Manager  

marcos.cabralsvensson@afry.com

*At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. That’s how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.*

Embedded Software Engineer
Location


Malmö
Country


Sweden
Reference number


REF11526S

title: End User Computing Engineer
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****10-12 months**
  
emagine are now looking for a End User Computing Engineer to one of our nordic banking clients.
  

  

**Start date:** ASAP

**End date:** 2025-12-31  

**Location:** Stockholm (2 days onsite, 3 days remote)  

  

**Detailed description of work task to be carried out**


We are seeking a skilled End User Computing Engineer to manage, maintain, and improve our organization’s IT end-user computing infrastructure. The role involves package creation ,deploying, supporting, and optimizing tools like CAPA Installer, Intune, SCCM, Microsoft 365 (M365), Exchange, and Distribution List Management (DLB). The ideal candidate should have strong technical expertise and a proactive approach to providing excellent user experiences.

**Key Responsibilities:**


1. Deployment and Configuration:

* Design, implement, and maintain end-user computing solutions using tools like Intune, SCCM, and CAPA Installer.


2. Software Packaging:

* packaging, software deployment (sccm, capa installer, intune), documentation, powershell, vbs
* Automate application packaging and deployment processes.


3. Device Management:

* Manage and secure endpoints (Windows, Mac, mobile devices) using Microsoft Intune and other tools.
* Implement and maintain device compliance policies.


5. Support:

* Provide Level 2/3 technical support for end-user computing issues.
* Troubleshoot and resolve application, device, and network-related issues.


6. Patch Management:

* Plan, schedule, and deploy patches and software updates using SCCM and Intune.
* Ensure compliance with security standards.


7. Process Improvement and Documentation:

* Develop and maintain technical documentation, including SOPs and knowledge base articles.
* Identify areas for automation and optimization in EUC processes.


8. Collaboration and Training:

* Work closely with IT teams to align end-user computing services with organizational goals.
* Provide training and support to team members to enhance productivity.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
* Proven experience with tools like CAPA Installer, Intune, SCCM, etc. and M365 administration.
* Packaging, deployment, sccm, capa installer, intune, documentation
* Solid understanding of Active Directory, Group Policy, and Azure AD.
* Experience with endpoint security and compliance management.
* Scripting skills (PowerShell, VBScript, etc.) for automation.
* Familiarity with ITIL practices for incident, problem, and change management.

title: Embedded Software Engineer F/M/X
description:
Who are we?
  
Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.
  
  

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:
  
  

**Brief Call:** Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!
  
  

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
  
  

**Case study:** Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.
  
  

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
  
We look forward to meeting you!
  
  

Job description
  
  

At Amaris Consulting Belgium, we are dedicated to delivering innovative solutions and exceptional service to our clients. We are currently seeking a talented Embedded Software Engineer with a focus on power management to join our dynamic team in Sweden. In this role, you will belong to a small team designing solutions for internal users using advanced technologies. As a consultant with us, you will develop modern applications and system solutions for our clients, primarily focusing on embedded software development.
  
  

**Your Responsibilities:**  

Design, develop, and optimize embedded software for power management applications, ensuring high performance and reliability.
  
Conduct software simulations and testing to evaluate performance and identify areas for improvement.
  
Collaborate closely with a committed and collaborative team of professionals, including hardware engineers and product managers, to implement software solutions that meet project requirements.
  
Lead debugging and troubleshooting initiatives to address software-related issues and ensure timely resolution.
  
Monitor software performance metrics and analyze data to track progress and identify trends for continuous improvement.
  
Prepare and present technical reports on software performance, improvements, and compliance status to management.
  
Stay updated on industry trends, technologies, and best practices to ensure innovative solutions are applied.
  
  

**Your Profile:**  

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
  
Minimum of 4 years of experience in embedded software development or a similar role.
  
Strong knowledge of embedded programming languages (C/C++) and real-time operating systems.
  
Proficiency in English is mandatory.
  
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to challenges.
  
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  
Proven experience in backend development with a strong enthusiasm for software engineering.
  
Familiarity with infrastructure as code using Terraform.
  
A creative thinker with a focus on finding effective solutions.
  
Ability to work autonomously as well as collaboratively within a team.
  
  

**Advantages:**  

An international learning environment.
  
Extensive training and certifications.
  
An R&D laboratory where you can develop your skills on innovative projects.
  
The opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving business.
  
Individual coaching and mentoring, as well as the chance to learn from experts for your professional and personal growth.
  
An attractive, tailor-made, and evolving career path.
  
  

**We are an independent company that values:**  

**Agility:** Thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.
  
**International scope:** Enjoy daily international exchanges and numerous mobility opportunities in over 60 countries.
  
**Intrapreneurship:** Engage in related topics or develop your own Business Unit.
  
**Attentive management:** With a limited number of consultants, your manager will adapt to your profile and support you throughout your professional journey.
  
  

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.
