Du får arbeta i en dynamisk miljö med komplexa migreringar och transformationer av befintliga system. Uppdraget är på heltid, med start så snart som möjligt och kommer att pågå under längre tid. Du kommer sitta centralt i Stockholm med möjlighet att jobba hybrid.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Möjligheten att leda en omfattande och affärskritisk systemförflyttning för en av Sveriges största banker.
* Få vara del av en dynamisk och innovativ arbetsmiljö.
* Chansen att driva migreringar i en komplex och utmanande IT-miljö.
* Ett uppdrag där du får samarbeta med specialister inom IT, affärsutveckling och systemförvaltning.


**Det här gör du hos oss**
* Jobbar operativt med test och krav i den pågående migreringen till Lumera.
* Säkerställer en smidig och effektiv transformation genom analys, strategi och genomförande.
* Samordnar olika intressenter, inklusive IT, affärsområden och externa leverantörer.
* Kommunicerar framsteg och utmaningar till berörda parter.


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med specialister inom IT, affärsutveckling och systemförvaltning. Teamet präglas av hög kompetens och samverkan, där fokus ligger på en framgångsrik transformation. Du kommer sitta centralt i Stockholm med möjlighet att jobba hybrid.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av att tidigare vare en del av en förflyttning till Lumera där du jobbat med test eller krav, eller i bästa fall båda. Du har en teknisk förståelse för systemmigrering och plattformsbyten samt vana att arbeta med komplexa IT-miljöer. Vi ser gärna att du har förståelse för bank- och finanssektorns IT-landskap och dess komplexitet.
   

  

 Som person ser vi att du är strukturerad i ditt arbetssätt, noggrann och har en god kommunikationsförmåga. Flytande i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift är ett krav.
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du antingen blir anställd av oss på Ada Digital eller anlitas som underkonsult, beroende på vilken lösning som passar dig bäst. I tillsättningen strävar vi efter att ge dig en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Och vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! För att ansöka behöver du inte bifoga några dokument. Skriv istället en kort motivering och bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Urval kommer sker löpande och uppdraget kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Senior Accountant
description:
Are you excited about accounting and passionate about leveraging digital innovation and automation? Join Instabridge—a fast-growing tech company, with over 10 million monthly users, on a mission to provide free internet access to everyone.
 



  





**Why You’ll Love It Here** 



* **High-Impact Projects** 
 : Drive our transition from K3 to IFRS, ensure global compliance, and help lead our finance department toward non-touch accounting through AI and automation.
* **Meaningful Mission** 
 : Work at the forefront of democratizing internet access for millions worldwide, contributing directly to our vision of a free global internet.
* **Fast Growth & Stability** 
 : We’re profitable, growing quickly, and set to exceed SEK +300m in revenue for 2024—over 5x last year’s earnings.



  





**What You’ll Do** 



* **Manage Daily Accounting** 
 : Oversee bookkeeping, VAT reporting, and month-end close processes as we expand our global footprint.
* **Improve & Automate** 
 : Collaborate with our small, dynamic team to streamline accounting workflows using AI and modern digital tools.
* **Ensure Accuracy & Compliance** 
 : Keep a keen eye on relevant laws and reporting needs, meeting deadlines without sacrificing precision.



  





**Who You Are** 



* **Experienced & Independent** 
 : You’ve got at least 2–3 years of accounting experience and can confidently handle month-end close and VAT reporting.
* **Detail-Oriented** 
 : You plan your work meticulously, maintaining high accuracy and meeting tight deadlines.
* **(Bonus) IFRS & Automation** 
 : Experience with IFRS, international VAT, and digital automation tools is a major plus.
* **(Bonus) Exceptional Achievements** 
 : We love hearing about standout accomplishments—sports, hobbies, or other personal feats.



  





**Your challenge** 



* **Our vision of “non-touch” accounting:** 
 At Instabridge, we strive for a forward-thinking approach to accounting, built on the belief that AI and automation are rapidly reshaping how we work. Our vision is rooted in the “non-touch” accounting model, where technology takes center stage in streamlining and optimizing processes. This aligns with our company-wide KPI measured as million dollar in annual revenue per employee (currently at 1.6m)
* **Build your accounting skills for the future** 
 : As our new Senior Accountant, we hope you’ll bring a curious and innovative mindset, eager to explore fresh opportunities for process. The way we approach accounting today will change in the next one to three years, and we are committed to staying ahead of the curve. Together, let’s lead the change in automation.



  





**What We Offer** 



* **Competitive Compensation** 
 : Including a yearly bonus of 1–2 months’ salary if company targets are met.
* **Flexibility & Work-Life Balance** 
 : Choose to work from home or our office (or both).
* **Health & Wellness** 
 : Access to an on-site gym, wellness allowance, and daily breakfast in the office.
* **Retirement & Security** 
 : Pension according to ITP1, giving you peace of mind for the future.
* **Positive Culture** 
 : Our team values a supportive, friendly atmosphere where everyone can thrive and have fun.



  





**Ready to Take the Next Step?** 




 We’re actively recruiting and will get back to you within five days of your application. Click “Easy Apply” now and start your journey at Instabridge—where your accounting expertise will help deliver free internet to the world!

title: Sourcing Manager Food
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for a Sourcing Manager Food in the ARKET café team.
   

  

 As a Sourcing Manager for our café business, you are responsible for translating the café concept into sourcing needs and find the best solutions to secure our supply chain while optimizing price and maximize savings.
   

  

 In this particular role, it is important to be a good communicator and thrive on building strong supplier relationships. You are passionate about our café concept and use your analytical skills to create the best possible assortment for our guests. You enjoy working with both hands on and strategic projects in a cross functional way and always seeks opportunity to improve processes with the end result in mind.
   

  

 Main tasks & responsibilities:
   

  

* Choose suppliers, producers, and wholesalers for assigned markets as well as new markets
* Secure a purchase plan for increased growth and profitability for all customer touch points/sales channels in line with section goals
* Build and maintain good relationships with new and existing suppliers
* Set the goals and strategy as well as work towards the best result for your department/s in line with the section strategy.
* Constantly follow up and analyze sales and take actions accordingly
* Negotiate and agree contracts, monitoring the quality of service provided for new and existing suppliers
* Maintenance of product prices and article updates in the ARKET Café database
* Ensure compliance to ARKET/H&M central Procurement agreements Compliance with traceability demands and certification demands
* Drive and initiate sourcing projects in accordance with the defined sourcing process


**Qualifications**
 We believe that you have a positive and creative attitude and always strive for improvement. You are structured and organized. You have a good sense for a high service level and teamwork but are also able to work independently.
   

  

* At least 3 years’ experience from a chain company in café/restaurant/food industry
* Experience working with FMCG
* International experience is preferred
* Experience working cross-functional between several different departments
* Fluent in English, both verbal and written
* Strong communication skills and a positive can-do attitude
* A proven and genuine interest in food and/or the café business


**Additional Information**
 This is a temporary role starting as soon as possible, untill end of August 2026 and is based at Weekday’s Head Office in Stockholm, Sweden. If you feel your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send in your resume (no need for cover letter) and relevant updated portfolio work in English, latest by 1st of March.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

 Inclusion & Diversity
   

  

 ARKET is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.
   

  

**Company Description**
 ARKET is a modern-day market with a Nordic soul, offering a mix of fashion, homeware and a café while having quality, sustainability and transparency at the core of our business. ARKET’s mission is to democratise quality through widely accessible, well-made, durable products, designed to be used and loved for a long time. Learn more about ARKET here.

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
Vantive is a vital organ therapy company on a mission to extend lives and expand possibilities for patients and care teams everywhere. For 70 years, our team has driven meaningful innovations in kidney care. As we build on our legacy, we are deepening our commitment to elevating the dialysis experience through digital solutions and advanced services, while looking beyond kidney care and investing in transforming vital organ therapies. Greater flexibility and efficiency in therapy administration for care teams, and longer, fuller lives for patients— that is what Vantive aspires to deliver.
   

  

 We believe Vantive will not only build our leadership in the kidney care space, it will also offer meaningful work to those who join us. At Vantive, you will become part of a community of people who are focused, courageous and don’t settle for the mediocre. Each of us is driven to help improve patients’ lives worldwide. Join us in advancing our mission to extend lives and expand possibilities.
   

  

**Summary**
 Are you always prioritizing the customer and love to give excellent service we have the perfect job for you! As a Customer Service representative, you will play an important role in our success in getting vital deliveries to patients every day and be a primary contact for our Home delivery-patients. You will serve as a customer contact (by telephone or email) regarding such matters as ordering, scheduling and shipping.
   

  

**Essential Duties And Responsibilities**
* You will be responsible for placing orders for our Home delivery-patients.
* You will be calling for orders, emails and communicate with the warehouses, pharmacies and clinics.
* You will work in Siebel and Excel daily.
* You will administrate patient travels in Sweden and abroad.
* You will support business with information when applicable.
* You will collaborate with cross-functional teams mainly the Renal team.
* You will maintain the customer - and patient data and keep customer files updated.


**Qualifications**
* You must be comfortable with Outlook and experience from an order management system is a plus.
* You must have good communications skills as well as good interpersonal and organizational skills.
* High school diploma required.
* Fluency in Swedish and a very high level of English is required.
* It is an advantage if you have experience from Logistics or/and Healthcare
* Previous experience in Customer Service is preferred.
* Flexibility, organization and self-drive to deal with customer requirements.
* A team player who is able to adapt to change and overcome challenges.
* Ability to establish trusted relationships with external customers and internal contacts.
* Possesses a curious mind with the ability to learn new concepts and skills quickly
* A nice to have is a Finnish-speaking person that could help our Finnish colleague during vacation etc.


**What We Can Offer**
* A challenging opportunity for you and also a chance to work in a diverse and experienced team with a great mix of people.
* To play an important role in Baxter’s mission “To save and sustain lives”
* Working hours are Monday to Friday, 8:00-16.30 onsite in Kista.


 #IND-NORD
   

  

**Reasonable Accommodation**
 Vantive is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information. Form Link
   

  

**Recruitment Fraud Notice**
 Vantive has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Vantive employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice.

title: Business Process Manager
description:
Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water and shipping. As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.
   

  

*Are you passionate about capturing the business requirements and stakeholder needs when implementing new systems, and driving process improvements and managing change to align our local Distribution Centers?*
 Within our Parts, Distribution & Logistics (PDL) division we’re constantly exploring how to elevate our processes, tools, and business practices globally across our DCs. As a key member of the Business Process Manager Team, your mission is to understand global and local requirements, drive process improvements, and pay attention to the end-to-end processes in our system roll-out projects.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Global process management: Identify common and unique parts of the DC supply chain processes, secure updated process documentation, review and align between DCs and ERP process managers. Collect, describe, prioritize and drive process change requests. Introduce new and changed processes to the DCs.
* Understand the business and translate into IT requirements: Take active part in the fit/gap analysis in the ERP replacement projects, secure that all DC requirements and business stakeholder needs are put into word and follow-up to ensure fit for purpose.
* ERP replacement projects: Support the DC key-users to define test scenarios, evaluate solutions, drive change, prepare for cut-over and go live, investigate and resolve issues.
* PDL process improvement projects: Lead initiatives to change and streamline targeted parts of the DC supply chain processes.
* Community Leadership: Drive the process community within PDL, sharing best practices and impactful use cases across the organization.


 This is a global role, based in Lund (SE), Tumba (SE) or Greenwood Indiana (US), with the opportunity to travel internationally to our sites in Asia, the USA, and Europe (~45 travel days per year).
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re a forward-thinking professional with a strong business acumen and a passion for business processes. You thrive on exploring and understanding requirements as a tool to reflect the business operations, map the processes and create tangible benefits for the business. Change, communication, continuous learning and best practice sharing excites you, and you’re eager to take lead to improve the PDL business processes.
   

  

* Open Mindset: You’re curious and eager to understand business operations and requirements to enhance the business processes.
* Results-Driven: With your ability to translate business needs into actionable plans, you lead projects that deliver measurable outcomes.
* Global Navigator: Your experience in international environments enables you to communicate effectively and foster collaboration across diverse teams.
* Team Player: Your open and informal communication style helps you build strong relationships and contribute to a positive team spirit.


**Your Background**
* Experience: Proven track record in managing process improvements and system implementation projects, especially within supply chain processes. Good understanding of the supply chain processes in general, source and production plan processes in particular.
* Education: A university degree in Engineering, Supply Chain Planning, Business Administration, or related field.
* Skills: Fluent in English, with familiarity in various Supply Chain process frameworks and project management methodologies, including agile approaches.


**What’s in It for You?**
 We offer a challenging position in an open and innovative environment where we help each other to develop and create value. Your work will have a true impact for a sustainable future and Alfa Laval’s future success.
   

  

 We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioural traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you may be invited to play the assessment games.
   

  

**For Union Information, Please Contact**
 Johan Ranhög, Akademikerna, +46 46 2891664
   

  

 Bror Garcia Lantz, Union, +46708477026
   

  

 Johnny Hultén, IF Metall, +46 709366517
   

  

**For further information please contact:** 
  

  

 Aina Cecilia Berglund, PDL Process Team Manager, PDL at AinaCecilia.Berglund@alfalaval.com
   

  

**We are reviewing applications continuously, make sure to send in yours before March 10th, 2024** 
 .
   

  

 All internal candidate must apply through Workday.
   

  

 Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications sent directly via email, they will be automatically disregarded.
   

  

 We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you may be invited to play the assessment games.
   

  

**We welcome your application!**

title: Head of Digital Marketing
description:
**The Head of Digital Marketing will be responsible for leading and developing Hemnet's digital marketing strategy, focusing on our B2C offering (sellers and buyers). This role will play a crucial part in driving customer growth, engagement, and loyalty across all digital channels.**
**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and execute a data-driven, customer-centric digital marketing strategy that aligns with Hemnet's overall business objectives and drives sustainable, long-term growth.
* Lead the strategic direction and roadmap for all digital marketing activities, including performance marketing, CRM, social media, and product marketing.
* Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) across all channels, analyze data, and translate insights into actionable strategies to optimize marketing performance and ROI.
* Drive innovation and experimentation within the digital marketing function, exploring new technologies, channels, and approaches to stay ahead of the curve and maintain a competitive advantage.
* Build and lead a high-performing, cross-functional team of digital marketing professionals, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
* Collaborate closely with senior leadership across the organisation, providing strategic input and guidance on key business decisions and initiatives.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum 5 years of experience leading and managing high-performing digital marketing teams in a digital environment.
* Proven track record of success in leading and managing high-performing digital marketing teams.
* Deep understanding of digital marketing principles and best practices across all channels.
* Strong analytical and data-driven decision-making skills.
* Experience with CRM platforms, marketing automation tools, and data analytics tools.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
* Strong leadership, mentorship, and team-building abilities.


 This role reports into the Marketing Director, and a key part of the Marketing organisation.
   

  

****🏡** 
 Your career at Hemnet**
 Are you ready to play a meaningful role in one of the biggest decisions people make in life? If so – welcome to Hemnet! Since 1998, we’ve taken pride in making the life-changing, often stressful journey of finding a new home as smooth and enjoyable as possible.
   

  

 At Hemnet, our mission is to connect every seller with every buyer, empower buyers to discover every home for sale, and enable real estate agents to match seamlessly with sellers. With over 40 million monthly visits, we’re Sweden’s most popular property platform and the first choice for Swedes looking to buy or sell a home. Together, we’re creating an open, transparent housing market, making home transactions in Sweden among the most efficient in the world.
   

  

 Our success is built on a strong, friendly culture that values creativity, inclusivity, and collaboration. Hemnet is a place where everyone has a voice, and our welcoming environment helps you thrive and grow as you work alongside passionate colleagues from around the globe.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working**
 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.
   

  

 Hemnet is Sweden’s largest property platform. Since the start in 1998, we have been the natural meeting place for real estate agents, property sellers and buyers. Hemnet offers the majority of properties for sale on the market; the largest number of potential buyers; products through which sellers are able to influence the selling of their property - and products that give real estate agents the opportunity to strengthen their brand. We are one of Sweden’s largest sites and apps, and one of the most popular property platforms in the world based on population.

title: Director Network Planning & B2B Sales
description:
TUI Airline, part of the world's leading integrated tourism group, is seeking a strategic leader for our Airline Commercial Senior Leadership Team. As Director of Network Planning & B2B Sales, you'll drive our airline's growth and profitability across multiple countries. You'll oversee network design, route planning, and B2B partnerships, leading a multinational team to optimize our commercial capabilities. If you're passionate about airline strategy and have a proven track record in network planning and commercial partnerships, we want to hear from you.
   

  

**Applications close on 19th March 2025.**
**About Our Offer**
* Personal benefits: Attractive remuneration, discretionary bonus schemes, generous travel benefits, extensive health & well-being support, and more.
* Flexible working: Work is something you do, not somewhere you go. We encourage a healthy work-life balance with a dynamic working environment.
* A career to shape: Access the TUI Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
* Broaden your network: We champion intercultural collaboration and provide opportunities to work on global projects and teams
* Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation.


**About The Job**
* Develop and implement customer-centric, profitable network structures across all TUI Airline AOCs
* Lead airport relations and B2B sales strategies to maximize incentives and optimize commercial agreements
* Optimise flight schedules and manage slot portfolio to ensure efficient fleet utilisation
* Negotiate and manage strategic partnerships, including codeshare and interline agreements
* Drive initiatives to increase seat sales through B2C and B2B channels
* Collaborate with regional teams to align network strategy with commercial business goals
* Analyse market trends to identify new route and market opportunities
* Oversee financial modeling and budgeting for network planning and B2B sales
* Lead a multinational team of approximately 30 professionals across various functions
* Serve as the empowered Single Point of Contact (SPOC) for internal and external B2B partners


**About You**
* Significant experience in airline network design and B2B sales, particularly in touristic markets
* Deep understanding of scheduling, slot management, and airline profitability drivers
* Strong leadership skills with proven ability to inspire and develop high-performing teams
* Excellent stakeholder management abilities, capable of influencing senior leaders across markets and functions
* Strategic thinking and analytical prowess, with experience in financial modeling and performance metrics
* Outstanding negotiation and communication skills, both written and verbal
* Proficiency in network planning software and standard IT tools
* Established network with European and preferably intercontinental airport sales teams
* Experience in negotiating airport incentive agreements and managing partnerships
* Adaptable problem-solver with a strong commercial drive
* Fluency in English; additional languages are a plus


 From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.
   

  

 We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.
   

  

**SECURITY STATEMENT**
 At TUI, safety is our top priority. We conduct thorough background checks on all employees who join our Airline. Rest assured; we’ll guide you on the necessary information you need to provide at each stage.
   

  

 Please note that if you are applying for a role in the UK, you must ensure you can provide a full 5 years referencing, plus a criminal record check for all countries you’ve resided in for more than 6 months in the past 5 years (some costs may apply).

title: AI Tools & Integration Specialist
description:
**Join Schibsted marketplaces to help change the way people consume**
 Schibsted Marketplaces is transforming the way people consume goods and services with some of the strongest brands in the Nordics. With a proud history of innovation, we are committed to making everyday life easier, more efficient, and sustainable for millions of users.
   

  

**Shape the Future with Our Growing AI Unit**
 Our newly established AI Unit plays a vital role in enabling Schibsted to deliver on its vision. By accelerating teams across the organization to adopt and scale AI, we focus on integrating and developing cutting-edge technological capabilities while fostering organizational readiness to unlock AI’s full potential.
   

  

**General Description Of The Role**
 The AI Tools and Integration Specialist plays a critical role in identifying, deploying, and integrating AI solutions into the company’s business processes. This role is also responsible for contributing to the development of internal training programs, ensuring that employees, including non-programmers, can effectively use and build tools with AI technologies. You will work closely with product owners, technical teams, and non-technical staff to optimize workflows and democratize the use of AI across the organization.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Evaluate and Select AI Tools: Continuously assess AI tools available in the market, identifying those that align with business needs and will improve process automation and efficiency.
* Integration: Be technically responsible in collaborations to implement the integration of AI tools with existing IT systems, ensuring compatibility, security, and seamless operation.
* Contribute to Internal Training Development: Contribute to design and development of internal training materials on AI tools, empowering employees to use them effectively.
* Empower Non-programmers: Develop and support training initiatives aimed at enabling non-technical staff to become "tool builders" by leveraging AI tools, fostering collaboration across departments.
* Collaborate with Cross-functional Teams: Work closely with product development teams, IT, and business units to understand workflow challenges and propose AI solutions tailored to their needs.
* Documentation and Training: Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for AI tools and processes, and assist in training team members to effectively use and manage AI systems.
* Bonus: use AI to automate as much of our own internal processes as possible to set an example for other units across the company.


**Experience**
**Qualifications & Experiences**
* 2-3 years of experience in software integration or testing, AI tools implementation, or IT systems development.
* Experience of using AI tools and integrating them in work flows.
* Experience in developing or contributing to (internal) training programs, especially for non-technical users.


**Skills**
* Strong understanding of AI technologies and their application in business contexts.
* Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to identify and resolve integration challenges.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex AI tools and integration processes to non-technical stakeholders, including enabling non-programmers to become tool builders.
* Proficiency in programming and experience with api access to AI services (e.g.,OpenAI, Claude, Google Vertex etc).


**Personal Attributes**
* Builder: you lean into and leverage AI in your own work to speed up and/or automate deliverables and outputs
* Innovative Mindset: Curious and forward-thinking, with a passion for exploring how AI can transform business processes and create new opportunities.
* Collaborative: Ability to work effectively within teams, fostering a cooperative environment and building strong relationships across the organization.
* Analytical Thinker: Able to quickly understand complex workflows and propose AI-driven solutions to optimize them.
* Educator: Passionate about training and enabling others, particularly non-technical employees, to engage with AI tools and become creators of AI-driven solutions.


**Sounds exciting? Let us hear from you!**
 If you are looking for a workplace and a role where you could share your knowledge and expertise, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you by 12th January 2025
   

  

 Please note that due to Christmas holidays we will start the process applications in early Jan 2025

title: Oracle Architect
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for a Desk Side Support to join our CIS DWP Digital support\DSS Team.
   

  

**What Will You Be Doing**
 As part of a DevOps team you will be building, supporting, migrating and automating the Oracle environment on Exadata Cloud at Customer(ExaCC). Products supported within that environment include Oracle databases, Oracle Enterprise Manager, Oracle Key Vault and ExaCC.
   

  

 You engineer the solution to build ExaCC platform to be complaint to regulatory requirements. You will be extensively working on Oracle Database migrations to ExaCC.
   

  

 A part of the workload will be developing the infrastructure as code to support CI/CD pipeline based on products such as Git, Jenkins, Ansible and Python.
   

  

 Your day-to-day activities range from actual engineering the Database migrations and coding automation scripts, but also engineering new or adapted solutions for customer organization. As part of the migration delivery team you will also be responsible for configuration of monitoring, maximum availability architecture(MAA) and support during and after the cutover window. Role sometimes will need to work outside office hours .
   

  

 You work closely together with other teams and the Product Owner.
   

  

**Who Are You**
* You are an experienced (at least 5 years) Oracle DBA with Exadata/ExaCC knowledge and like to work in a DevOps team in a complex environment
* You love challenges and really motivated to achieve the project
* You love automation challenges
* You understand that the “Oracle Cloud & Engineered Systems” will be a very large part of any infrastructure solution
* You see the big-picture but like to go in the details to solve complex integration issues
* You are a team player, but also a self-starter/self-organizing and resilient
* You love to give and receive constructive feedback, since continuous improvement is one of your drivers.


**What You Bring**
 Must have:
   

  

* Extensive experience of Oracle RDBMS Technology stack products
* Extensive experience in Oracle Database migrations
* Extensive experience of MAA
* Extensive experience of Oracle Exadata and ExaCC
* Extensive experience of Oracle Enterprise Manager
* Extensive experience of Oracle Enterprise Linux and virtualization
* Good experience with CI/CD Pipeline, automation (Ansible, Git, Jenkins and Python)
* Good experience and knowledge on Oracle Performance Tuning
* Good experience and knowledge on Oracle Key Vault
* Good experience of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure


**Nice To Have**
* Knowledge of SSO Authentication & Authorization, LDAP
* Knowledge of Networking
* Knowledge of Python


**And The Following Competence Related Qualities**
* Experience with DevOps, Scrum, working in an agile way
* Client focused
* Result-oriented
* Compliancy and standards focused
* Taking Initiative
* Being critical /contentious
* Collaborative attitude
* Willing to work on-site as part of a team sharing knowledge and experience
* You possess good communication skills and are transparent about your work within the team
* English language needs to be at proficient level
* Ready to travel couple of times in a Quarter if required.


**About Cognizant**
 Cognizant is one of the world’s leading professional services companies, transforming clients’ business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 205 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world.
   

  

**The Cognizant Community**
 We are a high caliber team who appreciate and support one another. Our people uphold an energetic, collaborative and inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive.
   

  

* Cognizant is a global community with more than 300,000 associates around the world.
* We don’t just dream of a better way – we make it happen.
* We take care of our people, clients, company, communities and climate by doing what’s right.
* We foster an innovative environment where you can build the career path that’s right for you.


**About Us**
 Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating, and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build, and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant (a member of the NASDAQ-100 and one of Forbes World’s Best Employers 2024) is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com
   

  

**Our Commitment To Diversity And Inclusion**
 Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity, champions equity and values inclusion. We are dedicated to nurturing a community where everyone feels heard, accepted and welcome. Your application and candidacy will not be considered based on race, color, sex, religion, creed, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws.

title: IT Service Manager Risk till Svensk Exportkredit
description:
**SEK i Stockholm söker en nyfiken, driven och engagerad IT Service Manager för ett av våra nyckelområden!**
 Riskområdet hos SEK är en central del av både vår affärsmässiga och tekniska miljö. Innovation, kvalitet och utveckling – både inom området och i samarbetet mellan IT och verksamhet – är avgörande för vår framgång. Nu söker vi en IT Service Manager som tar helhetsansvar för förvaltning och systemstöd, och säkerställer stabilitet och kontinuerlig utveckling av de system som möjliggör verksamhetens arbete. SEK är det stora lilla företaget – vi är ca 280 personer med en stor systemmiljö, en komplex affär och ett viktigt uppdrag! Det gör att vi arbetar nära varandra och är generösa med kunskap, engagemang och stöttning. Välkommen!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* En varierad och dynamisk roll, där du arbetar både med uppgifter här-och-nu och stora strategiska strukturer och initiativ
* Möjligheten att skapa struktur och långsiktighet i en spännande och komplex miljö
* En trygg arbetsplats med fokus på samarbete, engagemang och personlig utveckling


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 Som IT Service Manager Hos SEK Är Du En Viktig Länk Mellan Verksamheten Och IT-organisationen. Du Ansvarar Operativt Och Taktiskt För Förvaltning Och Systemstöd För Riskfunktionen, Som Hos SEK Hanterar Bolagets Samtliga Väsentliga Risker, Inklusive Kreditrisk, Marknadsrisk, Likviditetsrisk Och Operativa Risker. De System Du Ansvarar För Inkluderar En Kombination Av Inköpta Och Egenutvecklade Lösningar. Det Innebär Att Du
   

  

* Har relationsansvar mot tredjepartsleverantör och ansvarar för avtalshantering och kostnadsuppföljning
* Säkerställer leveranskapaciteter mellan verksamhet och IT
* Skapar och upprätthåller förvaltnings- och återställningsplaner och hanterar och följer upp incidenter
* Ansvarar för behörighetsstyrning och -kontroller, samt budget, licenskostnader och fakturahantering
* Uppdaterar system- och driftdokumentation i Confluence och ServiceNow


 Du arbetar tätt tillsammans med PO, Business Analysts och arkitekter (bland andra!) för att säkerställa att vår utvecklingsorganisation tillgodoser verksamhetens behov – och vice versa.
   

  

**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Du blir en del av IT Service Delivery-teamet, en central gruppering på 8 personer som ansvarar för förvaltning och utveckling av IT-stöd för olika verksamhetsområden. Du arbetar nära riskavdelningen (bestående av ett 30-tal specialister), BI-grupperingen och våra utvecklingsteam.
   

  

 Vårt kontor ligger på Fleminggatan 20 i Stockholm och vi arbetar med ett flexibelt arbetssätt och distansarbete när det passar uppgifterna och teamets leveranser.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi söker dig som vill arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där teknik och verksamhet möts! Du har erfarenhet av roller i gränslandet mellan IT och verksamhet, med tyngdpunkt på systemförvaltning, systemansvar eller leverantörshantering. Vi söker dig med erfarenhet inom den finansiella sektorn och även om du inte behöver arbetat med just risk-området tidigare söker vi dig med en förståelse för vår affär och verksamhet. Du har antingen en relevant examen (ex. systemvetenskap), eller relevant yrkesmässig erfarenhet.
   

  

 Du är bekväm med både svenska och engelska som arbetsspråk.
   

  

 Som person och kollega är du strukturerad och lösningsorienterad. Du tycker om att skapa stabilitet, samtidigt som du vill och kan utveckla och förbättra arbetssätt och kavla upp ärmarna – var det än behövs. Din prestigelösa inställning och kommunikativa förmåga gör dig till en tydlig och entusiasmerade drivkraft i samarbete och leverans över teamgränser!
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Business Director
description:
**Business Director to EssenceMediacom**
 We are currently seeking an experienced and visionary Business Director for our marketing agency. This key role focuses on driving new business growth, expanding our existing client relationships, and leading and developing a high-performing team. The ideal candidate has over 10 years of experience in a media agency or consulting firm and demonstrates outstanding drive, commitment, and a proven track record in client relations, business development, and team leadership.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Business Development:**
* Identify and drive new business opportunities by leveraging market insights and industry trends.
* Build and nurture strong relationships with prospective clients to understand their needs and highlight the agency's unique value.
* Create and deliver strategic presentations and commercial proposals to attract potential clients.


**Client Relationship Development:**
* Oversee and strengthen relationships with existing clients by aligning media strategies with their evolving needs.
* Regularly review client campaigns and provide strategic insights and recommendations for improvements.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for key clients, fostering long-term, trust-based partnerships.


**Team Leadership and Personnel Management:**
* Lead, guide, and develop the client team, focusing on both individual and team growth.
* Foster a culture of continuous learning, professional development, and excellence within the team.
* Implement effective team structures and processes to ensure efficient client service and career development opportunities for employees.
* Regularly assess and address the team’s training and career development needs in alignment with the agency’s strategic goals.


**Strategic Planning and Execution:**
* Contribute to the agency’s strategic planning with a focus on driving clients' overall business objectives.
* Monitor industry trends and competitor activities and adapt strategies to maintain competitive advantages.
* Ensure the use of innovative and effective media solutions in client campaigns.


**Qualifications And Experience**
* At least 10 years of experience in a media agency or consulting firm with a proven track record in growth-driven business development and team leadership.
* Strong leadership skills and experience in personnel management and team development.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships.
* Strategic and analytical thinking, capable of solving complex problems.
* Deep understanding of media planning, media buying, and digital strategies.
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, advertising, communication, or a related field. Advanced degrees or professional certifications are an advantage.


**Personal Attributes**
* Highly driven and engaged, with a passion for media, client success, and team development.
* Creative and innovative thinker who continuously seeks ways to improve services and enhance client satisfaction.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills, capable of handling multiple projects simultaneously.
* Adaptable and flexible, thriving in a fast-paced and evolving industry.


**What We Offer**
* A dynamic, collaborative work environment with a team of dedicated professionals.
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.


 The Business Director will play a crucial role in shaping the agency’s future, driving growth, ensuring the highest level of service for our clients, and fostering an environment where team members can thrive and succeed. If you are a motivated leader with a passion for media, client success, and talent development, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

**About EssenceMediacom**
 We are a leading global marketing and media agency and a part of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company. EssenceMediacom combines creativity, innovation, and data-driven strategy to help brands achieve their business goals and build strong connections with their target audiences. With expertise in marketing strategy, media planning, buying, and media optimization, the agency delivers tailored solutions that generate measurable results.
   

  

 As part of GroupM, EssenceMediacom has access to an extensive network and resources, making it a strategic partner for companies aiming to stay ahead in an ever-changing marketing landscape.
   

  

 EssenceMediacom has offices in Stockholm and Gothenburg and fosters a culture built on the belief that everything begins and ends with people. We take pride in working with exciting brands such as Tele2, Klarna, Byggmax, adidas, Kjell & Company, Coca-Cola, Bayer, and Google.
   

  

**Application**
 Selections are made continuously, so please upload your application as soon as possible. If you have any questions, feel free to contact Morten Flamand, CEO at EssenceMediacom, at morten.flamand@essencemediacom.com.

title: DNB Markets - Investment Banking Internship - Autumn 2025
description:
Our people are the DNA of DNB. Since 1822, bright minds have worked together to find the best solutions for our customers. Today, DNB is much more than Norway’s largest bank, and a key player in the Norwegian economy. We are a technology driven financial institution, constantly adapting our operations and tailoring our services to the time we’re living in and to the future. In DNB, you’ll find a wide range of career opportunities in Norway and internationally. We are among the best companies in the world when it comes to gender equality, and we take good care of the diversity represented by the people who choose to work here.
   

  

 Are you enthusiastic and curious? Do you enjoy solving challenging problems? Are you looking to start an extraordinary career within the financial markets?
   

  

 At DNB we offer a highly rewarding and insightful internship within Investment Banking. Early applicants will be favored as we consider candidates on a rolling basis. The application will be removed once the positions are filled with suitable candidates. No specific university degree or local language required, only that you are in the penultimate year of Bachelor’s or Master’s studies, and full proficiency in English.
   

  

**About DNB Markets**
 DNB Markets is a leading investment bank in the Nordics with approximately 700 employees and offices in ten countries worldwide. Our experienced professionals assist our clients with a broad range of Investment Banking products and services. Our Investment Banking Division within DNB Markets offers advisory and execution services in M&A, Equity Capital Markets, Debt Capital Markets.
   

  

 With around 170 professionals located in Oslo, Stockholm, London, New York and Singapore, our international team boasts extensive product, market and transaction experience. In Stockholm, we are a fast-growing team of about 50 professionals.
   

  

**Why join us?**
 We are currently seeking candidates for our Investment Banking Internships in the Stockholm team starting in August and October 2025. This internship provides the right candidate a unique opportunity to engage in M&A transactions, Initial Public Offerings, Private Placements and Debt/Equity transactions for clients across various sectors and geographies. You’ll work in a challenging and stimulating environment, facing a steep learning curve while receiving mentorship from experienced professionals.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A supportive and inclusive workplace that values diversity
* Hands-on experience with live transactions and deals, offering practical exposure to the investment banking world
* Mentorship and coaching from experienced Investment Banking professionals
* A chance to be a core member of deal and pitch teams, gaining deep insights into Investment Banking


**Who We Are Looking For**
* Motivated students who are eager to learn more about investment banking and financial markets
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English; proficiency in a Nordic language is considered a plus
* Strong academic results
* Completed at least one year of Bachelor’s or Master’s studies


**Application**
 Early applicants will be favored as we consider candidates on a rolling basis. The application will be removed once the positions are filled with suitable candidates.
   

  

 Join us at DNB Markets and take the first step towards an exciting career in investment banking. We look forward to your application!
   

  

**Contact**
 For questions please contact rekrytering@dnb.se
   

  

 As a qualitative step in DNB’s recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check to increase awareness of our future employees, secure work environment and meet regulatory requirements.  The process for background checks is carried out in collaboration with ToFindOut.   https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/
   

  

 As an employer DNB is encouraging all kind of internal mobility such as recruitment, job rotation, special assignments etc. This is an opportunity for you to take on a new career challenge within the company and get valuable personal and competence development. Some open positions are only published internally and can only be applied for by employees and consultants at DNB.
   

  

 When applying for a position it is only the hiring manager and HR who have access to your application.

title: Enterprise Account Executive Nordics
company_industry: Financial Services, Information Services, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
At Billogram we like to be the good guys of billing, making money when clients are happy and pay on time rather than from missed payments. We believe it always pays off to treat people well. That’s why our platform for invoices and payments is built to remove pain and instead be of gain to both our clients and their customers – improving their relations.
 



  





 To ensure continuous growth and become a leader in the European consumer billing market we are now looking for an Enterprise Account Executive Nordics to join our sales team.
 



  





**About the role:** 




 As an Enterprise Account Executive Nordics your primary responsibility is to create new business opportunities in the Nordic market and by that contribute to Billogram’s growth.
 



  





 Your responsibilities include targeting growth within our most successful verticals (Telecom, Utilities and Insurance) as well as exploring new business areas. Collaborating closely with our marketing and sales enablement teams, you are responsible for driving the entire sales cycle and executing the most successful sales strategies for each case. You will present and guide new clients towards the solution that generates the most value for their needs, ultimately reaching your targets and ensuring continued explosive growth for Billogram.
 



  





**Primary responsibilities:** 



* Full sales cycle responsibility, including managing ongoing sales processes with prospects through sales meetings, demos, technical screenings, business cases, and negotiations, until closing new business and transitioning clients to our customer success team
* Strategically and proactively identifying new business opportunities creating further growth within our most successful verticals; Utilities, Telecom and Insurance, as well as in new industries
* Actively creating and nurturing external stakeholder relationships
* Ensuring sales process compliance and CRM management in Salesforce
* Managing internal resources throughout Billogram, activating support from Sales Engineers, Professional Services, and Legal
* Play an essential part in defining, executing, and following up on the sales strategy



  





**What we are looking for:** 




 To get off to a great start in this role, you have a background within the Nordic invoicing and payment landscape. You understand the ecosystem, key players, and industry dynamics, which allows you to navigate complex sales cycles and engage effectively with decision-makers.
 



  





 Beyond industry experience, we are looking for someone with strong business acumen, capable of quickly grasping the bigger picture and identifying the key drivers behind business success. You set ambitious goals and are persistent in achieving them, always doing what it takes to deliver great results.
 



  





 You are cooperation-oriented, adapting to different stakeholders and fostering win-win solutions by being a team player and focusing on common goals. Your ability to collaborate and align interests helps you build trust and drive success.
 



  





 Additionally, you are analytical, approaching challenges with a structured mindset and the ability to recognize patterns, connections, and long-term implications.
 



  





**Skills & qualifications which will help you succeed in this role:** 



* Industry experience within invoicing or payments is crucial, preferably from a company providing solutions for invoicing and payment services
* Proven track record of driving complex B2B-sales processes
* Previous experience from working towards C-level
* A strong network within, and previous experience from, selling towards any of our key verticals; Utilities, Telecom and Insurance will be useful
* Knowledge of MEDDICC as opportunity qualification methodology is benefical
* Fluency in English and Swedish is a requirement, fluency in other languages is a plus such as Norwegian, Finnish or German.



  





**What we offer:** 




 At Billogram we promise you an exciting journey as we break into new markets and grow at a rapid pace. That aside, we offer you a supportive and collaborative environment that values your skills and growth. Starting with a generous and equitable salary, full sales onboarding, and continuous coaching, we'll help you meet your targets and achieve your goals.
 



  





 We're committed to your long-term development, offering clear career progression paths. You'll also enjoy a fantastic benefits package, including 30 (+2) days of holiday, an occupational pension, a flexible wellness allowance, sick leave top-up, and parental leave compensation.
 



  





*At Billogram, we provide equal opportunities and strive for an inclusive and diverse environment. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to gender, transgender identity or expression, ethnicity, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, or age.* 




  





 Welcome to the world of Billogram!

title: Plant Director
company_industry: Food and Beverage Manufacturing, Food and Beverage Services, and Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
**Plant Director Opportunity at Mondelēz International: Lead the Future of Snacking**
**Are you a visionary leader ready to shape the future of a global brand?**
 At Mondelēz International, we’re on a mission to lead the future of snacking. We are seeking a
 **Plant Director** 
 to take charge of our manufacturing operations and drive excellence and innovation. This senior leadership role is crucial to achieving our strategic goals and delivering impactful results.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
* Be a Strategic Leader: As Plant Director, you’ll craft and execute a 3-year strategic plan to ensure our manufacturing supply chain is agile, synchronized, and aligned with our growth agenda.
* Influence and Inspire: Lead, coach, and develop multi-functional teams to drive best practices and achieve operational excellence.
* Shape the Future: Establish and sustain a zero-loss mindset, embedding continuous improvement and world-class standards.
* Innovate with Purpose: Drive the implementation of Integrated Lean 6 Sigma and advanced manufacturing practices.


**What You’ll Do**
* Deliver Operational Excellence: Partner across functions to meet and exceed goals in safety, quality, cost, delivery, and sustainability.
* Develop Talent & Culture: Be accountable for building a high-performing workforce, ensuring a pipeline of critical talent, and fostering engagement at all levels.
* Protect & Optimize Assets: Lead governance to safeguard operational standards, compliance, and asset value.
* Build Relationships: Act as a vital bridge between internal and external stakeholders to align priorities and elevate Mondelēz’s equity and reputation.


**What You’ll Bring**
* Exceptional Leadership Experience: Proven track record in driving manufacturing performance, with expertise in Lean, Six Sigma, TPM, and 5S practices.
* Strategic and Growth Mindset: Strong financial and business acumen combined with project management expertise to deliver measurable results.
* Inspiring Leadership: Excellent communication skills. Inspire the team in developing and executing our vision and goals, coupled with coaching abilities that empower teams to thrive.
* Cross-Functional Excellence: Deep understanding of supply chain, demand planning, and commercial functions, with a history of building strong collaborative relationships.


**Why Mondelēz International?**
 As
 **Plant Director** 
 , you’ll join us in shaping the legacy of iconic brands like Marabou, Freia, Cadbury, Milka, and Oreo. At Mondelēz, innovation and opportunity are endless—and so are the smiles you’ll help create every day.
   

  

**Are you ready to lead, inspire, and innovate?**
 This is your chance to take on a pivotal senior role, guiding our mission forward and making a meaningful difference at Mondelēz International.
   

  

**Apply today to make it happen with pride!**
**More About This Role**
**Work schedule: 100%**
**Relocation Support Available?**
 No Relocation support available
   

  

**Business Unit Summary**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

*Our people make all the difference in our succes*
 Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
   

  

**Excited to grow your career?**
 We value our talented employees, and whenever possible strive to help one of our associates grow professionally before recruiting new talent to our open positions. If you think the open position you see is right for you, we encourage you to apply!
   

  

**IF YOU REQUIRE SUPPORT TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION OR DURING THE INTERVIEW PROCESS, PLEASE CONTACT THE RECRUITER**
**Job Type**
 Regular
   

  

 Manufacturing support
   

  

 Manufacturing

title: VP Finance
description:
***About Ingrid***




*Join us in shaping the future of global e-commerce delivery experiences.* 




  





*Ingrid is a cutting-edge B2B SaaS company revolutionizing the way businesses approach delivery experiences. At Ingrid, we're on a mission to solve some of the biggest challenges in e-commerce and redefine the delivery experience for retailers and shoppers worldwide. As a leader in Delivery Experience Management, our platform connects retailers, carriers, and shoppers to create seamless shopping journeys that fit people’s lives. Our solutions empower brands to elevate their online shopping and delivery experiences, building trust and convenience for millions of shoppers around the globe.* 




  





*Ingrid secured a £20M investment round in March 2024 to further fuel our international expansion.* 




  





**We are now looking for a VP of Finance who will become a key player in the team. This is an opportunity to be a part of a truly exciting growth journey!** 




  





 As VP Finance, you are responsible for further developing the finance team to a strategic and commercial function serving as a business partner and promoting data-driven decision-making throughout the organization. In this key leadership role, you will define and execute our financial strategy, ensuring optimized financial operations, forecasting, and reporting. You will also drive automation and efficiency, building robust, scalable processes that support our growth and long-term success.
 



  





 The ideal candidate thrives in the front lines, and can couple operational knowledge, with a clear grasp of business models, and data / reporting. The candidate has a solid financial toolbox coupled with an entrepreneurial mindset and a strong drive. You also have a strong interest in using technology as a way of enabling growth when building a successful company.
 



  





 As a person you excel in a down-to-earth and value-based culture, and you are committed to creating long-lasting relationships. You have strong interpersonal and analytical skills as well as a genuine interest in developing companies and making high level financial analyses. You also have experience working with people across organizations and communicating a vision as well as building buy-in whilst working at a high pace in a professional manner, both independently and in teams.
 



  





**Your primary responsibilities include:** 




  





**Financial Strategy & Data-Driven Insights** 



* Oversee Accounting, Financial Reporting, and Business Control to ensure accuracy and compliance.
* Leverage SaaS-specific KPIs to optimize growth and profitability.
* Develop scalable financial models and forecasting frameworks that support strategic decision-making.



  





**Business Control & Performance Optimization** 



* Implement data analytics and automation to improve financial insights, planning, and reporting.
* Partner with Revenue, Product, and Customer Success teams to drive financial efficiency.
* Lead unit economics analysis, identifying opportunities for cost optimization and margin expansion.



  





**Accounting, Compliance & Financial Operations** 



* Ensure accurate financial statements, tax compliance, and regulatory reporting.
* Lead financial audits, risk management, and internal controls to support scaling operations.



  





**Leadership & Cross-Functional Collaboration** 



* Lead, build and mentor a high-performing finance team of four individuals that drives a data-first culture.
* Work closely with C-suite and department heads to align financial insights with business goals.
* Support pricing strategy, contract structure, and financial efficiency in collaboration with Strategy, Sales & Product teams.



  





**Legal & Compliance Support** 



* Ensure compliance with corporate governance, financial regulations, and contract management.
* Support commercial contracts, SaaS agreements, and risk management in collaboration with external legal advisors.



  





**Major professional experiences & competencies** 



* You have 8-10+ years of full-time professional experience as a VP Finance, Finance Director, or similar senior Finance Roles. Ideally hands on experience from a technology-driven entrepreneurial growth company (specifically in a SaaS business)
* Masters's degree in Finance, Business Administration, or related field.
* Well-developed financial and commercial understanding which allows you to rapidly understand the business logic and value drivers of any given business
* You know “what good looks like” when it comes to finance functions, tools & processes
* You have experience with setting up and optimizing processes regarding SaaS KPI tracking and financial reporting
* Excellent analytical and strategic skill set
* Well-developed communication and leadership abilities



  





**Personal characteristics** 



* A growth mindset and an international perspective
* You are proactive and are driven to make an impact
* Team player with strong interpersonal skills
* Pragmatic, curious, down-to-earth and without prestige
* You believe in continuous improvement and implement feedback effectively
* Good reasoning abilities. Sound judgment. Good business acumen
* Results and people oriented. Resourceful and well organized. Ability to balance other business considerations



  





**What we offer** 




 At Ingrid, we embrace bold ideas and a forward-thinking approach. We experiment, challenge the status quo, and focus on creating a meaningful impact through high-quality work. Collaboration is key, and we value diversity, support growth, and hold each other accountable while having fun along the way. As part of Ingrid you will:
 



  




* Be part of a forward-thinking team in a rapidly growing international SaaS company.
* Work in an informal environment where innovation, collaboration, and creativity are valued.
* Enjoy flexible and remote-friendly work options for better work-life balance
* Have the opportunity to grow and develop your skills while working with global brands and cutting-edge projects



  





 Does this sound exciting? Then we would love to get in touch with you!
 



  





 Please apply with a CV or Linkedin profile. We will interview candidates on an ongoing basis, so send us your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at susanna.grill@ingrid.com. We look forward to your application and further contact!

title: Financial Risk Manager
description:
What we do at Qliro
   

  

 At Qliro, we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants, helping them serve their customers every day. We believe that when our merchants grow, we grow. Our team consists of dedicated, friendly, and highly competent people who have redefined what Qliro and payments can be. We are now on an exciting journey of scaling our business in Sweden and across the Nordics.
   

  

 What your team does
   

  

 The Risk Control function at Qliro plays a vital role in ensuring financial stability and compliance. Our team is responsible for analyzing and monitoring financial risks, including credit, liquidity, and market risk, while working closely with key stakeholders across the company. We provide essential insights that shape Qliro’s financial strategy and risk management framework.
   

  

 What you will get to do
   

  

 As a
 **Financial Risk Manager** 
 , you will:
   

  

* Coordinate and perform analysis, monitoring, and reporting on credit, capital, liquidity, and market risks.
* Develop, implement, and continuously improve risk frameworks within your area of expertise.
* Act as a subject matter expert in ICLAAP and relevant stress testing processes.
* Define IT requirements and optimize risk reporting and measurement processes.
* Stay up to date on regulatory developments and ensure compliance with capital adequacy, liquidity, and risk management regulations.
* Take ownership of financial risk control, working independently to shape the role and structure your work.


 This role is an "office first" role with the expectation to be in the office 4-5 days a week.
   

  

 What you bring to the team
   

  

 You are an eager, ambitious, and positive person looking to get full responsibility for the area you cover. You have a mindset where you see yourself as part of the solution rather than pointing out issues. You are a true team player, always helpful and contributing. We work in a fast-paced environment, and you should enjoy managing several things simultaneously. Additionally, you will have an ability to work independently and cope with complex project matters and administration tasks in a business with aggressive growth targets.
   

  

* 5–10 years of relevant experience in quantitative risk analysis within the financial industry.
* A strong educational background in mathematics, statistics, and/or financial economics.
* Proficiency in both Swedish and English.
* Deep understanding of regulatory requirements related to financial market operations.
* Experience in performing or participating in ICLAAP.
* Strong skills in SQL, R, Python, or similar systems, as well as advanced Excel (including VBA).
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and effective communication skills.
* A collaborative mindset with the ability to work flexibly and independently.
* The ability to navigate both tactical problem-solving and strategic decision-making.


 Does this sound like your next role?
   

  

 What are you waiting for? Apply now and become part of our journey at Qliro!

title: Head of Finance Product Line Wellbeing & SDA
description:
**Change how the world lives. One product at a time.**
 Electrolux Group is a leading global appliance company that has shaped living for the better for more than 100 years. We reinvent taste, care and wellbeing experiences for millions of people, always striving to be at the forefront of sustainability in society through our solutions and operations. Under our group of leading appliance brands, including Electrolux, AEG and Frigidaire, we sell household products in around 120 markets every year. In 2023 Electrolux Group had sales of SEK 134 billion and employed 45,000 people around the world. For more information go to www.electroluxgroup.com.
   

  

**All about the role:**
 The Head of Finance Product Line Wellbeing & SDA will hold a 360-business controller position to drive all financial activities for the product category. You collaborate in the development and execution of financial plans and budgets, ensuring alignment with the company's strategic objectives. You will support organizations part of Product Line Wellbeing & SDA (PL WB & SDA) in all long- and short-term financial analysis, follow-up, and decisions. The role will be also combined with a financial process, functional or IT tool responsibility within the PL Controlling team. The Head of Finance Product Line WB & SDA will be responsible for a team of Category, R&D and Innovation controllers.
   

  

 The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing all financial activities, ensuring the financial health of the organization, and providing strategic recommendations to the leadership team. This role requires a high level of expertise, strategic thinking, but also active engagement in operational tasks. As the Head of Finance, you will be responsible for navigating complex financial landscapes and managing financial risks. The ability to balance multiple high-stakes responsibilities in a business operating at high pace and communicate effectively with various stakeholders is crucial for success in this position.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Financial Strategy: Develop and implement financial strategy to support growth and profitability goals of the business.
* Budget Management: Oversee the preparation and management of PL WB&SDA’s budgets, forecasts, and financial plans.
* Financial Process / Functional Responsibility: Responsibility for one or more of the core financial processes/functional area within the PL Controlling, such as closing process, budget & strategic process, or investment process and/or functional responsibility for P&L, Working Capital or Capex.
* Financial Reporting: Ensure accurate and timely financial reporting, including monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
* Team Leadership: Lead and mentor the finance team, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and professional development.
* Team Contribution: Continuously share and support team colleagues to create and sustain an open, learning, and supportive team environment.
* Investment Management: Oversee investment activities, including portfolio management and capital allocation.
* Investment Financials: Consolidate the financial view of the full group Product Line including Quality and Purchasing and all the Electrolux regions.
* Cost Control: Drive optimal cost structure. Implement cost control measures to improve efficiency and reduce expenses.
* Stakeholder Communication: Communicate financial performance and strategy to stakeholders, including PL WB&SDA organization, Electrolux Group’s management and management teams in Business Areas.
* Business Development: Conduct financial due diligence on potential business opportunities. This involves analyzing financial statements, market conditions, and competitive landscapes to ensure informed decision-making. Provide detailed financial analysis to support business development initiatives - evaluating the financial viability of new projects, partnerships, market expansions.
* Other: Support in driving transformation projects affecting PL WB&SDA i.e. master data project, supply chain or tax optimization, restructuring & reorganization and impact on systems and data.


**Who you are:**
* University degree in Economics, Finance, Accounting, or a related field; MBA or CPA/ACCA preferred.
* Minimum of 10 years of experience in Finance, with at least 8 years in a senior leadership role.
* Strong analytical, strategic planning, and communication skills.
* Passion for analyzing data and making business conclusions and recommendations.
* High level of integrity, attention to detail, and ability to work under pressure.
* Proficiency in financial software and tools.
* Flexibility and agility are essential, as multiple projects will be running simultaneously.
* A fast thinker with the ability to pick up and treat new information rapidly.
* Your enthusiasm is infectious, inspires, and engages your colleagues and collaborators to achieve, deliver, be accountable and own their work.
* Ability to build teams, develop, and lead them to best performance. A true team player that however can stand up to the team when required.
* Fluent in English; any additional language is an advantage.


**Where you’ll be** 
**:**
 You will be based in the HQ in Sweden, Stockholm.
   

  

**As part of the Electrolux Group, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**
**Find out more on:
   

  

 Electrolux Group:** 
 https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux
   

  

**Stockholm HQ:** 
 https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/sweden

title: Brand Manager
description:
Brand Manager till Swedbag
   

  

 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens hållbara förpackningslösningar?
   

  

 Swedbag är en ledande leverantör av hållbara papperspåsar till några av de mest välkända varumärkena. Vi är stolta över vår starka hållbarhetsprofil och vår förmåga att leverera produkter av högsta kvalitet. Nu söker vi en passionerad och driven Brand Manager som vill vara med och öka kännedomen om Swedbag och attrahera nya kunder.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Brand Manager hos oss kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att skapa intresse för vårt varumärke och driva nykundsbearbetning. Du kommer att arbeta med att bygga långsiktiga relationer och säkerställa att våra kunder får den bästa möjliga upplevelsen. Du har fortsatt kundansvar efter att affären är inledd, men det administrativa arbetet hanteras internt.
   

  

 Som brand manager kommer du att arbeta över stora delar av Sverige, med särskilt fokus mot Stockholm, Göteborg och Malmö.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
* Kartlägga och identifiera potentiella kunder
* Skapa insikt och förståelse bland potentiella kunder om varför de ska välja Swedbags papperspåsar
* Skapa och genomföra strategier för att öka varumärkeskännedomen
* Bygga och underhålla relationer med kunder
* Planera och genomföra kundmöten


**Vad har Sara Törnstrand, COO, att säga om tjänsten och företaget?**
*"Här är det högt i tak med ett glatt och enkelt gäng. Vi är ett effektivt bolag där alla uppgifter har ett värde, inga fasta ramar eller boxar att förhålla sig till. Här har man möjligheten att skapa sina egna strategier och arbetssätt.*
*Swedbag genomsyras av medarbetare som alla vill vara bäst på det dem gör och vi jobbar utifrån att vi alla skall göra det vi är bra på. Du som söker tjänsten bör ha en stor entreprenörsanda, vara självgående, motiverad och uthållig i att driva idéer framåt. Du bör även vara van vid att hantera flera projekt samtidigt, samtidigt som du uppskattar möjligheten till samarbete med kompetenta kollegor."*
**Vi söker dig som**
* Har minst 5 års säljerfarenhet, gärna inom dagligvaruhandeln eller retail
* Är driven, entreprenöriell och självgående
* Har utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska och engelska
* Är van vid att arbeta med telefonförsäljning och att boka möten
