 If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.

title: Account Manager Sweden (m/f/d)
description:
**Your mission**

 As part of our Sales team focusing on growth, you will be responsible for expanding existing customers and acquiring new customers throughout Sweden. You will have a clear goal of driving growth on both existing customers by doing up- and cross-selling as well as net new logo sales. You will work hand in hand with internal colleagues from Sales, Pre-sales, Partner Management, Product team among others, and build long-term customer relationships. You will sell the entire Matrix42 product portfolio, develop projects independently until successful completion and coordinate the Winning Team, which will provide you with the necessary sales support in a wide range of disciplines.
   

  

**YOUR MISSION**



* You are based in the Stockholm Area and bring expertise in fostering partnerships and closing deals while cultivating enduring relationships with both customers and partners.
* Your role includes devising sales strategies through detailed analysis and ensuring the CRM system is meticulously maintained.
* You craft tailored solutions and establish strategic alliances with customers and partners to drive mutual success.
* With a talent for persuasive consulting, you guide clients toward achieving their sales goals through targeted advice and comprehensive planning.
* You organize impactful customer presentations and workshops, representing the company with professionalism at trade fairs and events.
* From initial outreach to finalizing agreements, you oversee the entire sales cycle, ensuring seamless execution of sales projects and contract negotiations.



  

  




**Your profile**

**MUST HAVES** 



* You bring extensive experience in IT and software sales, excelling in driving success through channel and/or strategic partnerships and confident deal closures.
* As a motivated sales professional, you have honed your ability to build enduring, results-driven customer relationships while collaborating effectively with partners.
* Your ability to understand complex challenges and translate them into tailored solution portfolios is one of your core strengths.
* With an entrepreneurial mindset, you are highly results-oriented, blending a determination to succeed with strong interpersonal and teamwork skills.
* You exude confidence, reliability, diligence, and technical expertise, coupled with a high degree of self-motivation and a healthy sense of self-assurance.
* An analytical thinker, you are committed, assertive, and adept at balancing precision with a proactive approach.
* Your attentive listening skills and knack for asking insightful questions enable you to navigate nuanced conversations effectively.
* Hard work, flexibility, and a readiness to travel come naturally to you, as does engaging with international customers and colleagues.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English, you seamlessly manage cross-cultural interactions and thrive in global environments.


**NICE TO HAVES**
* Language skills Finnish and/ or German would be a plus



  

  




**Our Benefits**

 We could tell you all about the free fruit and drinks in the office, that you will have flexible working hours or that remote work is part of everyday life. But in our eyes, that's not a benefit, it's standard. Here are some of our benefit offers:
   




* Comprehensive occupational healthcare via insurance (Länsförsäkringar - e.g.. visits to specialist, physiotherapy, etc.)
* Occupational pension benefit (ITP1)
* Sports benefit (200e/year, reimbursed against receipt)
* Home internet connection (max 40€ / month)
* Extra mileage allowance (if applicable) of 1.9 SEK/km
* Yearly training budget to support professional growth
* Any phone model can be chosen
* Free use of the gym at the HQ premises 24/7 when visiting
* Joint hobby clubs and activities



  

  




**Your contact person**

 Send us your application, including your salary requirements and earliest possible starting date, directly through our online portal via the "Apply for this job" button. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact
 **Jessica Loren Meyer.**
 We ask for your understanding that MATRIX42 can only accept applications online via the applicant portal in connection with our applicant management system due to the currently valid EU data protection regulations.
   

  




**About us**



 Our ambition is to be the European choice of Enterprise Service Management Software!
   

 By using our platform, customers can manage IT and business processes, assets, endpoints, and identities for improved productivity, agility, security, and employee experience. By enabling digital working environments and IT self-service through holistic integration and automated processes, we digitalize and automate our customers' everyday tasks. Join our diverse team of over 600 professionals spread across Europe!
   

  

 We deeply care about our people and the work we do. Our culture is built on our strong values, and customer success is our top priority. Start your personal development journey with us, no matter if it is about personal or professional growth, we want you to reach your full potential through personalized goals and a life that you love.
   

 We want to do the right things - and do them right!
   

  

 Remote work is an essential part of everyday life, though we also deeply value the magic that happens when we all come together. Do you want to be part of building the European leader in service management software, and work in a culture that inspires you to grow? At Matrix42, you can!

title: Senior Sales Manager - Gaming
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the team 
 

 The Gaming Sales team plays a crucial role in our organization's success by helping increase our merchant base in the gambling industry. The team is responsible for the full sales cycle from lead generation and prospecting to supporting the merchants go live with Trustly. The Senior Sales Manager will report directly to VP Gaming and will be a key member of the Gaming commercial team, and also work closely with the Account Development team based in Stockholm and other internal teams (Product, Marketing, Integrations, Legal, Compliance).
 








**About the role 
 

 The purpose of this role is to facilitate sales activities focused on revenue growth across Europe by expanding Trustly’s gambling merchant base. The objective of the Senior Sales Manager is to identify new merchant opportunities among online gambling operators, create a sizeable pipeline of potential clients, fully own the sales cycle and successfully conclude negotiations with key target merchants that will drive new revenue for the company. 
 





  




**What you'll do** 
* Manage and own the entire sales cycle, from lead generation and prospecting, to comfortably presenting our services in meetings and contract execution
* Establish a strong pipeline of gambling operator opportunities across European markets
* Work closely with the Integration team making sure our customers implement our services and go live
* Make sure to have a high sales activity output
* Work closely with Trustly’s Gaming Account Management and Partnership teams and external partners such as PSPs and PAM platforms to distribute our value proposition and drive sales activity
* Participate in and contribute to all relevant industry marketing activities, including conferences, external events and meet ups
* With these efforts establish the business as a market and thought leader and open up avenues for the identification of potential opportunities for sales and revenue generation



  




**Who you are** 
* To be successful in this role, you must be a true self-starter who is prepared to roll your sleeves up and get involved
* Strong ownership mentality and willingness to see opportunities through to completion
* At least 3-5 years experience in complex B2B sales and/or business development, preferably payments for online gambling
* Preferably you have a large network in the online gambling and/or payments industry
* A solution-driven problem solver with a creative mindset
* A strong team player with the ability to manage internal and external stakeholders with the highest degree of professionalism, firmness, integrity
* The ability to discuss and negotiate with customers at CXO-level
* Superb verbal and written communication skills in English and preferably another European language
* Your track record of success in sales speaks for itself!






  




  



 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, apply now and k
 

 indly submit your CV in English.****

title: Credit Risk Specialist
company_industry: Paper and Forest Product Manufacturing and Packaging and Containers Manufacturing
description:
**Job Description**
 Vi på Billerud tror att när vi har morgondagen i åtanke gör vi vårt bästa idag. Tack vare våra medarbetare är vi ett världsledande företag inom vår bransch av förnybara papper- och förpackningsmaterial. Vill du uppnå din fulla potential och bidra till en hållbar morgondag? Bli en del av oss!
   

  

**Vi söker nu en Credit Risk Specialist**
 Som Credit Risk Specialist har du ett övergripande ansvar för att stödja våra affärsområden med insikter kring kreditriskexponering. Du, övervakar, utvärderar och rapporterar kontinuerligt exponeringen, samtidigt som du säkerställer att att koncernens kreditdirektiv efterlevs ute i verksamheten. Vidare genomför du riskbedömningar av kreditengagemang och arbetar proaktivt för att minimera risken för att affärer avstannar. I nära samarbete med kollegor inom Trade Finance bidrar du till att utveckla processer och strategier för att hantera och balansera risker genom försäkrings- och finansieringslösningar.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar**
* Löpande supportera våra affärsområden med bedömning av kreditrisker på enskilda kunder, med medföljande rating och limitbeslut.
* Stödja affärsområdernas kreditkommittéer med relevant analysmaterial.
* Följa upp och monitorera kreditrisk på aggregerad nivå, med rapportering till Global Trade Risk Manager.
* Godkänna betalplaner på engagemang i default och följa upp inkassohantering och skadereglering.
* Utbilda medarbetare inom Sales och Business Support kring våra kreditdirektiv, instruktioner och processer för hantering av kreditrisk.
* Bidra till att utveckla systemstöd och driva digitalisering av processer för kreditriskbedömning.


 Du rapporterar till Global Trade Risk Manager, och blir en del av teamet Trade Risk under Group Treasury. Du är baserad på vårt kontor i Solna, vid Mall of Scandinavia.
   

  

 Vi sätter Safety First! Hos oss på Billerud ansvarar vi alla för att bidra till en säker arbetsmiljö. Läs mer om vårt Safety First initiativ
   

  

**Qualifications**
 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Minst kandidatexamen inom ekonomi, teknik eller motsvarande.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av kreditanalys och riskbedömning.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i Excel, inklusive pivottabeller samt förmåga att felsöka och analysera statistik för att driva förbättringsarbete.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera stakeholders, samt presentera kreditrelaterad information för beslutsfattare.


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av att optimera kreditprocesser genom förbättrad rapportering och effektivare systemstöd.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i projekt och driva förändringsarbete.


**Personal qualities**
 Vi lägger stor vikt vid din personlighet. För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du är en affärsdriven och analytisk person med hög integritet, då du hanterar känslig information och behöver fatta objektiva beslut även under tidspress. Med ett lösningsorienterat arbetssätt hanterar du en blandning av enklare uppgifter mixat med större utmaningar. Du är en god kommunikatör och nätverkare som bygger förtroende i en global organisation. Samarbete är en självklarhet för dig, och du trivs med att vägleda andra i kreditriskhantering.
   

  

 Våra värderingar är viktiga för oss och vi tror att du som söker känner igen dig i våra värdeord: Värna om varandra och vi håller det vi lovar.
   

  

**Contact**
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Tomas Eriksson, Global Trade Risk Manager, på tomas.n.eriksson@billerud.com
   

  

 Vid frågor om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta Alice Lundberg, Talent Acquisition Partner, på alice.lundberg@billerud.com
   

  

**Application information**
 Välkommen med din ansökan senast 13/3.
   

  

 Billerud är en jämställd arbetsgivare. Vi omfamnar mångfald och är engagerade i att skapa en inkluderande miljö för alla anställda och kandidater.
   

  

**Varför oss?**
* En möjlighet att bidra till en mer hållbar framtid.
* Utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter
* Prestationsbaserad bonus, tjänstepension och en rad olika förmåner enligt företagets policy.
* Möjlighet till hybridarbete enligt företagsstandard.


 Vår rektyeringsprocess innehåller: intervjuer, rekryteringstester, referenstagning, alkohol- och drogtest samt bakgrundskontroll.
   

  

**Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?**
 At Billerud, we are fully committed to reduce our and our customers carbon footprint by offering high-performance paper and packaging materials. We are convinced that the right solutions can be important tools to help fight climate change. That's why we see it as our responsibility to enable the best packaging choices, for a better tomorrow.
   

  

 Our proud history in the forestry and paper industry goes back more than 150 years. Since then, we’ve grown to what we are today: a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials - passionately committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our materials are the basis of packaging and paper products used by millions of people around the world, 24 hours a day, all year round.
   

  

 We serve customers in more than 100 countries through our three business areas Liquid Packaging Board, Paper and Paper Board. Our nine production units are located in Sweden, USA, and Finland and we have around 6,000 employees in 19 countries. Our annual turnover is approximately SEK 41.2 billion and the share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. At Billerud we always put safety first, care for each other, and do what we say.
   

  

**Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.**

title: Regional Sales Manager
description:
**An Amazing Career Opportunity for a Regional Sales Manager- Nordics !!**
**Location: Stockholm, Copenhagen**
**Job ID: 33566**
 We are recruiting for a Regional Sales Manager to join our team !!
   

  

 Reporting to the European Channel Sales Director, you will be assigned regional accounts within your given region and ensure all growth targets are achieved.
   

  

 You will be expected to support and collaborate across the whole team to develop business and project specification.
   

  

 If this sounds like you keep on reading !
   

  

**Who are we?**
**HID Global** 
 powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places, and things, allowing people to transact safely, work productively and travel freely.
   

  

 We are a high-tech software company headquartered in Austin, TX, with over 4,000 worldwide employees. Check us out here: www.hidglobal.com and https://youtu.be/23km5H4K9Eo
   

  

**As our Regional Sales Manager, you will support HID’s success by:**
* Manage and develop all assigned Accounts within your region to achieve set targets
* Field based position with 60% of your time spent travelling and engaging with customers.
* Identify new sales opportunities to increase market share in an established market
* The channel includes selling to distributors; Systems Integrators & Original Equipment manufacturers
* Introduce the latest products and solutions
* Devise and implement account plans to accommodate strategic goals
* Support indirect channel in the region where applicable
* Support our Key Accounts in your region, nurture the local sales relationship and manage the overall sales process
* Deliver the required support & training to all accounts
* Support and deliver training to Consultants and specifiers in region.
* Conduct regular market analysis to determine the customers needs
* Represent the company at trade shows, customer events and association meetings as required
* Collaborate across business areas to efficiently deliver solutions to meet customer needs
* Maintain customer details, activities and opportunities using the Salesforce CRM Tool
* Analyse key account sales figures on a regular business to understand buying patterns
* Maintain up to date knowledge of all HID Products and competitive products
* Prepare and submit accurate forecasts on a regular basis using the tools provided
* Create a Partner Community in order to maximize brand loyalty and revenue.


**What we will love about your background:**
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills
* Ability to work as a self-starter, but also a work effectively as part of a team
* Hands on attitude with the ability to manage multiple projects, successfully prioritizing
* Customer first approach with a clear can-do attitude
* Excellent Planning, Prioritizing and organization skills with the ability to adhere to deadlines
* Show good initiative and enthusiasm


**Your Experience and Education include:**
* Bachelor Degree or Equivalent
* A minimum of 5 years’ experience managing key accounts in a B2B environment
* Demonstrable ability to hit sales targets
* Previous experience of selling Physical Access Control solutions.
* Experience in a solution selling environment specifically Saas and/or Cloud based licensing models would be desirable.
* Experience of Salesforce.com CRM platform.


**Why apply?**
**Empowerment:** 
 You will work as part of a global team in a flexible work environment, learning and enhancing your expertise.
   

  

**Innovation:** 
 You embrace challenges and want to drive ambitious change.
   

  

**Integrity:** 
 You are results-orientated, reliable, and straightforward and value being treated accordingly.
   

  

 HID Global is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer – Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation
   

  

**We make it easier for people to get where they want to go!**
 On an average day, think of how many times you tap, twist, tag, push or swipe to get access, find information, connect with others or track something. HID technology is behind billions of interactions, in more than 100 countries. We help you create a verified, trusted identity that can get you where you need to go – without having to think about it.
   

  

 When you join our HID team, you’ll also be part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. You’ll have 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally. As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
**DevOps Engineer (Internal Networks)**

Now we are looking for a **DevOps Engineer** for the **Internal Networks area** , with good knowledge in **enterprise** **networks** for internal and external users.


I am Annette Ottosson, the leader of our team of the global team Internal Networks. We are a great bunch of people, and I am super proud of every single member of my team.


**As a DevOps Engineer you will…**

As a member of my team, you will work with our **Internal network supporting employees** and **consultants** for almost the **whole Telia Company** in offices and shops with wired and wireless solutions. We also support the Business market with technical and operational parts in the services Telia Managed **LAN** , **Telia Wifi** and **Cloud VPN** .


We are a DevOps team, meaning we have **Operations** and **Development** tasks for the network within the team and you will have good opportunities to work in both areas.


On-duty 24/7 is a part of the position as we are part of the incident process as 2nd and third line support.


This is a position that calls for someone who understand enterprise networks with many users that require very high service levels. You must have **deep knowledge in network** . You must have the capability to know and understand the different parts of the network, like switches and routers together with a good skillsets of trouble shoot in the environment.


Since security in the network is important, it´s good to have interest and some knowledge in security.


**Who we’re looking for**

Telia is on a journey to become the new generation telco, which means that you need to be open-minded and not be afraid of change. And to really enjoy your job here, you need to be forward thinking and enjoy teamwork, collaboration with other organizations in the company and service minded delivering the best service to users and customers.


Your personality is forward-thinking, people-oriented, and business-minded. You have experience with multiple and complex network solutions, along with knowledge of Cisco and HPE Aruba network solutions. You are passionate about new technologies, trends, and patterns, and you are fluent in both spoken and written English.


**We are more than a workplace**

Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.


**Ready to make better happen?**

We´re looking forward to your application by 06/03/2025. Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via email. Required background checks will be performed.


Got questions? Please reach out to Annette Ottosson via email annette.ottosson@teliacompany.com or phone +4670 397 64.


**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Test Engineer med erfarenhet inom bank/finans!
description:
**Ansök nu**

**Test Engineer med kompetens i testautomation med erfarenhet inom bank/finans branschen?**

Nu söker vi en teknisk testare som har erfarenhet inom testautomation för en stor kund inom bank och finans. Om du har erfarenhet från liknande roller och branscher, och trivs med att ingå i ett stort växande team, då är det dig vi söker!


Sedan många år har Sogeti placerat sig i toppen på världskartan när det gäller test och kvalitetssäkring. Att vara bäst på test är helt enkelt en passion för oss!


**Vi söker dig med följande erfarenheter:**


* Mellan 6-8 års erfarenhet av testarbete och testautomation.
* Programmeringsspråk som Python, JAVA, .NET.
* Erfarenhet av API-testning (t.ex. Postman, SoapUI, Ready API).
* Erfarenhet av GUI-testning med verktyg (t.ex. Selenium, Cypress, Playwright).
* Erfarenhet av projekthanterings-/testmanagement-system (t.ex. Jira, Azure DevOps).
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med CI/CD pipelines (t.ex. Jenkins, Azure DevOps).
* Microsoft Services och SOAP/REST-baserade tjänster och verktyg.
* ISTQB-certifiering.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med AI-drivna testverktyg eller ramverk, såsom verktyg för att generera testfall baserat på maskininlärning.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av att jobba med ETL- processer
* CI/CD pipelines


**I rollen ingår följande ansvarsområde:**


* Skapa och underhålla testautomationsramverk för kvalitétssäkrade IT-leveranser
* Du har en passion för teknisk-testning och en vilja att fortsätta lära och utvecklas inom området.
* Analysera testresultat och coacha utvecklingsteamet inom testområdet
* Hålla sig själv uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna inom testautomatisering och föreslå förbättringar av testprocessen
* Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av att driva, underhålla och exekvera tester inom DevOps-miljöer och är bekväm med att leda och genomföra tester i en agil arbetskontext


**Varför välja oss?**



Vi är ett ledande IT-konsultbolag med fokus på digital transformation och innovation. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med spännande kunder inom offentlig sektor, energi och finans – alltid med den senaste tekniken i fokus.



Som en del av Sogeti erbjuder vi dig en trygg anställning där vi prioriterar våra medarbetare och balans i livet. Vi värdesätter en positiv arbetsmiljö och strävar efter att skapa en atmosfär där du kan trivas och utvecklas.


**Nyfiken på fler anledningar till att jobba hos oss? Kika in här:**


* Ditt Sogeti - *Lär känna din framtida arbetsgivare!*
* Dina förmåner - *Få koll på vad vi erbjuder våra medarbetare!*
* Medarbetarnöjdhet - *Hur betygsätter våra egna sogetiare livet hos oss?*


**Skicka in din ansökan med CV redan idag!**



Vi hanterar alla ansökningar löpande!



Hoppas vi ses!



/Team Manager, Daniel Lindström

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
### **Digital Solutions - IT - at DevPort:**



Within IT, we focus “hands-on” on operational development and providing expertise to design and develop high quality software solutions. We have experience working with various clients in traditional industry as well as start-ups. In line with the latest technologies and trends, we develop customized solutions that create value for our clients and their end users.


### **About the Role:**



We are looking for a **Software Test Engineer** to join our team within Digital Solutions. You will be responsible for writing and maintaining automated test scripts, performing manual testing, and collaborating with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment.In IT, we focus “hands-on” on operational development and providing expertise to design and develop high quality software solutions. We have experience working with various clients in traditional industry as well as start-ups. In line with the latest technologies and trends, we develop customized solutions that create value for our clients and their end users.


### **Responsibilities:**


* Develop and maintain automated test scripts using **C#, Selenium, SpecFlow, MSTest**
* Execute test cases in **Azure Pipelines** and maintain test cases in **Azure DevOps**
* Perform **manual testing** and log issues in **Azure DevOps**
* Work with **Windows and Linux environments** to validate application functionality
* Participate in **daily Scrum meetings** to report progress and discuss tasks

### **Required Skills & Experience:**


* Bachelors- or Masters degree within a relevant field
* Atleast 5 years of experience in a similar role
* Proficiency in **C#, .NET, Selenium, MSTest**
* Experience with **SpecFlow, Gherkin, Cucumber** for behavior-driven development (BDD)
* Strong understanding of **test case management in Azure DevOps**
* Familiarity with **PowerShell scripting**
* Experience working in both **Windows and Linux environments**
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
* Fluent in English, both spoken and written

### **Other requirements:**



Some Asignments and Projects in this role may be related to classified information regarding the security of Sweden. Due to this, the specific role **requires** a **Swedish Citizenship.**


### **What We Offer:**


* **Diverse and Challenging Assignments:** Engage in exciting projects with various clients and industries where your skills will be highly valued.
* **Flexible Compensation:** Choose between two salary models—it's your choice!
* **Inspiring Work Environment:** Participate in fun activities and conference trips that strengthen the team and create memorable experiences.
* **Continuous Development:** Enhance your skills through our special projects and lunch lectures covering topics from social skills and stress management to advanced battery technology.
* **Innovative Tasks:** Work with cutting-edge products and the latest technologies in an environment that fosters creativity and innovation.

### **Application:**



If this sounds like something you want to be a part of, apply by following the steps below.



If you have any questions, send an email to Samuel Bogeryd at [email protected]



We are looking forward to reading your application!


### **About DevPort:**



DevPort is a technology consulting company in an expansive development phase with headquarter in Gothenburg and offices in Stockholm, Linköping, Jönköping, Helsingborg and Karlskrona. DevPort has its core competence in the automotive industry and employs more than 500 people in three competence areas - Digital solutions, production development and product development.



We are proud of our employees and of collaborating with several of the world's leading vehicle manufacturers, companies in the defence industry and other development-intensive industries.



We are characterized by a family culture with entrepreneurship, competence, security, and a community that infuses the company's operations and contributes to a pleasant and inspiring workplace.

title: AI Management & Operational Excellence Leader | Data & Product Enabling Functions | Inter IKEA
description:
**Job ID:** REF20507E


**Date posted:** 19/02/2025


We are on a journey to establishing operations across Inter IKEA, bringing core business processes, people, data, and technology together. This change will enable IKEA to become an even better home furnishing retailer in the future. We need passionate people who embrace change, dare to question, and want to make a difference. If that sounds like you, come and join us. Together, we can do great things!

**About the Area**


Inter IKEA Group is organized into three core businesses: Range, Supply, and Retail Concept, along with five enabling functions. Together, we contribute to the success of IKEA and share responsibility for the franchise offer. The enabling functions are Operations Management, Business Performance & Support, Communication, Sustainability, and People & Culture.


Operations Management works together with operations teams across Inter IKEA to lead and develop the overall IKEA operating model, and to enable strategic movements towards IKEA goals. It includes teams for business insights, capability and process development, strategy and roadmap, data, and technology.

**About the Job**


This role involves leading and maintaining the IKEA AI direction as an evolving framework that aligns with the organization’s business objectives and enhances operational efficiency.


In this role, you will be accountable for managing the AI agenda connected to the Inter IKEA Ai direction focusing on operational excellence. Ensuring synergy across the Inter IKEA Group, and optimizing AI implementation for measurable operational improvements to its end user, suppliers and customers. You will spearhead initiatives leveraging AI to enhance efficiency, data integration, and competitive positioning while supporting long-term business objectives.


You will be responsible for implementing principles, best practices, and structures to guide and support efficient and effective AI integration across all four business capability dimensions (people, process, data, and technology) in the explore, develop, and preparing for next phase where Ai can accelerate and support IKEAs uniqueness.


You will work closely with all operations across to strengthen human productivity, reduce complexity and increase quality and decision precision and atomisation for cost out.


Additionally, you will define the future setup for the AI-team and lead a network close to the data network to coordinate it across.

**About You**

**To be successful in this role, you should have several years of experience in:**

* Leading AI-driven digital transformation initiatives and overseeing AI strategy development.
* Implementing AI systems and frameworks within large organizations, ensuring compliance with legal and ethical standards.
* Working in a delivery organization with agile development practices and/or a DevOps setup.
* Managing and developing high-performing AI and data teams.
* Experience with AI applications in different types of businesses like retail, supply chain management, and/or product development.
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related technical field or similar is essential.
* Understanding of the importance to prioritise the totality of an integrated value chain and at the same time test and learn.

**To be successful in this role, the following knowledge, skills, and experiences would be valuable:**

* Deep knowledge in the craftsmanship of data and AI
* Extensive knowledge of AI frameworks, standards, and European Union AI regulations.
* Strong understanding of AI-driven business models and their impact on operations.
* Deep knowledge of digital technology, data infrastructure, and IT services within retail and supply chain-driven environments.
* Ability to develop, lead, and inspire high-performing, cross-functional AI teams.
* Strategic thinking combined with the ability to execute and drive measurable outcomes.
* Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to break down complex information and communicate it clearly and engagingly.
* Hands-on experience with AI model deployment, data-driven decision-making, and agile development processes.
* Understanding and experiences within the IKEA value chain, would be an advantage.

**Additional Information**


This role is full-time (40 hours per week) and based in Malmö, Sweden or Delft, the Netherlands. We believe in working together and we work the majority of the time from the office, a hybrid solution between the office and working remotely will create the best environment for us to be creative, productive, and find a work-life balance.


At IKEA, we believe everyone deserves a seat at the table. You’re welcome no matter where you come from, what you believe, or what you look like. We don’t even care how you have furnished your home. We’re interested in you simply because you’re you. We believe that people’s different perspectives, backgrounds, and personalities make us better at understanding our customers' dreams and needs. At IKEA, we’re all on the same project. If you have a special need that requires accommodation in the recruitment process, just let us know.

***Interested? Submit your CV and let us know why you would be a good fit for this role, in English, by March the 5th, 2025.***
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: Security Engineer
description:
### **Role Overview**

As a Security Engineer, you will play a crucial role in protecting our infrastructure and applications. You will be responsible for conducting internal security assessments, contributing to our detection and response capabilities, and enhancing our cloud security posture. Your expertise will help us to deliver improved vulnerability management and enhance our defenses while contributing to compliance with security best practices.

### **Key Responsibilities**

Conduct internal security testing, including penetration testing, internal red teaming, and threat simulations.


Collaborate with technical teams to identify and mitigate security vulnerabilities in applications, infrastructure, and cloud environments.


Secure cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP) by implementing best practices and identifying misconfigurations.


Participate in incident response, threat hunting, and security monitoring activities.


Develop and implement security tools, automation scripts, and testing frameworks.


Knowledge sharing regarding latest cyber threats, attack techniques, and security trends.


Work closely with our DevOps and IT teams to enforce secure coding and infrastructure deployment practices.

**Requirements**

* 4 to 6 years of experience in Cybersecurity
* Strong expertise in vulnerability management and internal red teaming
* Experience in Operational Security (OpSec) and Cloud Security (AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Proficiency in exploiting and securing web applications, networks, and cloud services.
* Strong knowledge of MITRE ATT&CK framework, SIEM tools, and security automation.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work independently.
* Certifications or other proven qualifications such as OSCP (Offensive Security Certified Professional) and AWS Certified Security – Red Team.

### **Nice-to-Have**

Ability to utilize offensive security skills for defensive practices (Purple team)


Familiarity with Kubernetes security, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and DevSecOps practices.


Scripting and automation skills (Python, PowerShell, Bash).

**Benefits**


Across Vizrt, we all work with our shared purpose in mind; to deliver more stories, better told. That is because we believe that stories have the power to impact not just the audience, but the teller as well. A well-crafted and well-delivered story can change the world. We strive and innovate to deliver the best software-defined visual storytelling tools to the world’s storytellers across broadcast, media, public service, enterprise, not-for-profit, education, health, houses of worship, in fact wherever there is a need to educate, entertain or inform. Because that is what stories do, it is why they are important.


4 billion humans see the stories that our customers tell every day. So, for us diversity is not an optional objective, it is a simple reality. Our customers’ customers are diverse, our customers are diverse, Vizrt gains strength from being diverse.


It is true that we hold our diversity to be essential, it is something we constantly nourish and pay attention to, but it is not something we take for granted. We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment. We champion inclusion and we value each other’s stories, and we relish their telling.


We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes:

* Health Insurance: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance plans to keep you and your family healthy.
* Paid Time Off: Generous vacation days, sick leave, and holidays to ensure you have a work-life balance.
* Professional Development: Opportunities for ongoing training

Join our team and take advantage of these benefits while working in a dynamic and supportive environment.

### **Recruitment Process**

* Recruiter Screening
* Team Interview
* Case Interview
* Final Interview

title: Skogforsk söker en Azure-arkitekt/administratör till Uppsala
description:
Skogforsk är det svenska skogsbrukets forskningsinstitut och vi drivs av att bidra till ett skogsbruk i världsklass för ett hållbart samhälle. Vår nisch är tillämpad forskning och utveckling och vi jobbar i nära samverkan med såväl skogssektorn, teknikleverantörer som andra forskningsorganisationer. Skogforsks uppdrag är att utveckla, utvärdera och demonstrera nya metoder och prototypverktyg för skogsbruket. Det svenska skogsbruket har ett starkt utvecklingsfokus och den digitala transformationen går fort. Teknik, beslutsstöd, automation, standarder och dataförsörjning är viktiga frågor, likaså sociala och sociotekniska frågeställningar kopplade till arbetsinnehåll, organisation och innovation. Artificiell intelligens (AI) är på stark frammarsch och har potential att revolutionera olika tekniska applikationer och förutsättningar att skapa datadrivna beslutsunderlag.
  
  

Skogforsk söker en Azure-arkitekt/administratör till Uppsala
  
Vi söker en driven och lösningsorienterad nätverksarkitekt som vill vara med och utveckla framtidens IT-miljö inom skoglig forskning. Hos oss får du vara med och utveckla vår digitala infrastruktur. Som Azure-arkitekt hos oss kommer du att ansvara för att designa, utveckla och implementera molnlösningar som möter våra verksamhetens behov. Du arbetar tätt med utvecklingsteam och verksamheten (forskare) för att säkerställa att lösningarna är optimerade, kostnadseffektiva och framtidssäkra.
  
  

Din profil
  
För att lyckas i rollen har du ett par års erfarenhet av att arbeta med molnlösningar, framförallt med Azure. Med ett öga för helheten och en förmåga att hantera komplexa system ser du till att våra lösningar är effektiva, hållbara och framtidssäkra. Vi tror att du har en relevant utbildning inom systemvetenskap eller ett närliggande område.
  
Du är en analytisk och samarbetsinriktad person som gillar att ta ansvar och lösa tekniska utmaningar. Genom din kommunikativa förmåga och ditt engagemang bygger du starka relationer både internt och externt.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:**  

Designa och implementera Azure-baserade infrastrukturer och applikationer
  
Säkerställa säkerhet, efterlevnad och skalbarhet i molnmiljön
  
Automatisera och effektivisera driften med Infrastructure as Code
  
Arbeta med DevOps och CI/CD för att möjliggöra smidiga driftsättningar
  
Rådgiva och samarbeta med utvecklare, forskare och andra intressenter
  
  

* Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste trenderna och bästa praxis inom Azure och molnteknologi


Vårt erbjudande
  
Hos Skogforsk får du ett spännande, omväxlande och framtidsinriktat jobb i en platt organisation där du har stora möjligheter att påverka. Du kommer att arbeta inom en organisation som är stadd i förändring och satsar på molnteknologi. På vår arbetsplats är vi övertygade om att mångfald är viktigt för både trivsel och effektivitet. Vårt huvudkontor ligger i Uppsala, och vi har forskningsstationer i Sävar i Västerbotten samt i Ekebo i Skåne.

title: Senior DevOps-Engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Din profil (Skall krav)**

* Fordon
* Jenkins
* Git
* Artifactory
* Project management och atlassian suiten (jira, confluence, bitbucket) är ett måste

 **Meriterande**  

* c, make, matlab+simulink, bash och python

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 07-03-2025 **Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: DevOps Engineer with Event-Driven Architecture Expertise
description:
**Job Description**
 If taking H&M’s integration platform to its next level excites you, then this opportunity is for you! The Event and Integration Services team is looking for an experienced DevOps engineer with a strong focus on working with Kafka. In this role, you will engage with a diverse and innovative integration ecosystem, collaborating with a highly skilled team that maintains various central integration platforms at H&M. You will see the big picture, identify patterns, and instinctively know how to win support for your ideas. Partnering with different teams and areas, you will support our Unit in driving the Integration Platforms & Services mission and roadmap. You will build and configure Kafka solutions that are easy to maintain and adapt, regardless of tools or languages. Believing in a non-hierarchical culture of collaboration, transparency, safety, and trust, you will work with a focus on value creation, growth, and serving customers with full ownership and accountability. Join our high-performance team and constantly improve the experience of our end users.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Strong experience in software engineering with focus on event streaming platforms such as Kafka and Solace.
* Worked with Event-driven Architecture and knowledge of how to implement this on a large scale in an Enterprise.
* Deep understanding of CI/CD automation for platform onboarding and self-service capabilities
* Deep knowledge of public cloud technologies (Azure & GCP primary)
* Strong agile mindset and skilled in planning, prioritizing, execution, and follow ups with cross functional teams.
* Develop and maintain event-driven architecture using platforms like Solace and Kafka.
* Ensure high quality of developed technical solutions
* Evaluate new platforms and features and work on proof of concepts and prototypes
* Deliver on time, demonstrating a strong commitment to deliver on the team mission and agreed backlog
* Create knowledge and produce the necessary documentation


**Qualifications**
* 10+ years of overall experience with 5+ years of experience working as a DevOps Engineer
* Deep understanding of Event-Driven Architecture principles.
* Substantial experience with version control software (Azure DevOps, Github etc.)
* Extensive hands-on experience with event platforms such as Solace and Kafka.
* Strong scripting skills (Powershell, Bash, or similar).
* Proficiency in scripting and automation using tools such as Terraform, Ansible, or similar.
* Extensive experience with the Microsoft Azure platform especially working with Azure storage, Event grid.
* Experience with a sprint-based agile way of working and knowledge of tools like Jira, confluence, ServiceNow
* Knowledge and experience working with performance testing methodologies and tools


**Additional Information**
 This is a
 **fulltime permanent position** 
 , starting as soon as possible according to agreement. The role is an on-site position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible, but no later than the
 **28th of February** 
 . Due to data policies, we only accept applications through career page.
   

  

**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

 In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.
   

  

**Inclusion & Diversity**
 H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.
   

  

 We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
   

  

**Company Description**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

title: DevOps Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for a Azure DevOps to join our Artificial Intelligence & Advance Analytics Team.
   

  

 Our practice Artificial Intelligence & Analytics is a global practice working across more than 15 verticals including, Banking & Financial Services, Healthcare, Retail, Consumer Goods & Insurance to deliver cutting edge solutions for their data & analytics requirements.
   

  

 We specialize in leading technology trends in market like cloud analytics, data modernization, Generative AI & AI/ML solutions.
   

  

 We help organizations engage people and uncover insight from data to shape the products, services and experiences they offer. We work with the world’s leading organizations to provide collaborative solutions to their business and IT challenges with innovative ideas that are embraced by their customers. More than 5,300 professionals around the world leverage deep industry knowledge across 15 verticals including: banking and financial services, healthcare, retail, consumer goods and insurance to deliver robust digital solutions in key areas of client growth.
   

  

 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced DevOps Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in DevOps practices, Databricks, and Azure Cloud Data Lake platforms. This role will involve managing and optimizing our cloud infrastructure, ensuring seamless integration and operation of our data pipelines, and enhancing our overall DevOps processes.
   

  

**Our ideal candidate**
 We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced DevOps Engineer to join our team at Cognizant will have a strong background in DevOps practices, Databricks, and Azure Cloud Data Lake platforms. This role will involve managing and optimizing our cloud infrastructure, ensuring seamless integration and operation of our data pipelines, and enhancing our overall DevOps processes.
   

  

* Design, implement, and manage DevOps pipelines for our Azure Cloud Data Lake platform.
* Automate and streamline CI/CD processes.
* Integrate and manage Databricks for data warehousing and analytics.
* Monitor and optimize cloud infrastructure for performance and cost efficiency.
* Ensure high availability and disaster recovery for all cloud services.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve issues.
* Implement and maintain security best practices for cloud and data environments.
* Stay current with the latest DevOps and cloud technologies and apply them to our systems.
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior team members.


**Nice to Have**
* Experience with Azure DevOps: Experience with Azure DevOps, including Azure Pipelines and Azure Boards is a plus.
* Experience with security: Experience with security practices and tools such as Azure Security Centre, Azure Active Directory, or Azure Key Vault is a plus.
* Experience in Kafka: experience in Kafka with Azure, such as Confluent Kafka is a plus.

title: Senior Cloud Engineer
description:
**Company Description** 




  





 At Cabonline, we’re redefining the Nordic taxi industry by transforming how transporters operate with our advanced platform. Our solutions optimize booking, dispatch, and payment processes, enabling seamless and efficient transportation services. Serving a diverse range of customers—B2C, B2B, and B2P—we are committed to innovation and technology-driven progress.
 



 If you’re eager to shape the future of cloud infrastructure and play a crucial role in building a scalable, secure, and high-performing IT ecosystem, Cabonline is the place for you!
 



  





**Why Join Us?** 




 Join a small but highly skilled
 **platform engineering team** 
 at a pivotal moment in our transformation journey! You’ll be a key contributor in establishing a
 **new AWS landing zone** 
 and
 **networking architecture** 
 , ensuring the foundation of our cloud infrastructure is robust, secure, and built for the future. We value collaboration, flexibility, and technical excellence in a hybrid work environment.
 



  





**Your Role as a Cloud Engineer** 




 As a Cloud Engineer at Cabonline, your primary focus will be on
 **AWS infrastructure, networking, containerization, and database management** 
 . You will:
 


* **Design, implement, and manage AWS infrastructure** 
 using best practices to ensure scalability, security, and resilience.
* **Develop and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC)** 
 using Terraform or CloudFormation to automate deployments.
* **Architect and optimize AWS networking solutions** 
 , including VPC design, interconnectivity, and hybrid cloud setups.
* **Ensure high availability and security** 
 across cloud resources by implementing best practices in IAM, security groups, WAF, and encryption.
* **Optimize and manage AWS services** 
 such as Transit Gateway, Direct Connect, VPC peering, and PrivateLink for secure network communication.
* **Improve CI/CD pipeline automation** 
 to streamline infrastructure deployments and updates.
* **Monitor, troubleshoot, and enhance performance** 
 across AWS networking, ensuring reliable and efficient operations.
* **Design and implement containerized solutions using Kubernetes (EKS)** 
 to support microservices architectures and scalable applications.
* **Collaborate with cross-functional teams** 
 to integrate networking, containerization, and database solutions that align with business objectives and regulatory requirements.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




 We’re looking for a
 **passionate and skilled cloud engineer** 
 with a strong background in
 **AWS networking, containerization, and database management** 
 . The ideal candidate will have:
 


* **Deep expertise in AWS Networking services** 
 , including VPC, Transit Gateway, Direct Connect, and Route 53.
* **Strong proficiency in Infrastructure as Code (IaC)** 
 with Terraform or CloudFormation.
* **Experience designing secure and scalable AWS networking architectures** 
 , including hybrid cloud and multi-account setups.
* **Understanding of security best practices** 
 in AWS, including IAM, network segmentation, and compliance frameworks.
* **Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines** 
 and DevOps automation.
* **Proficiency in scripting** 
 (Python, Bash, or similar) for automation and infrastructure management.
* **Experience with Kubernetes (EKS) and containerization** 
 to support microservices and scalable applications.
* **Experience with AWS RDS** 
 , including backups and high availability.
* **Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools** 
 such as CloudWatch, Prometheus, or ELK Stack.
* **A problem-solving mindset and strong collaboration skills.**



  





**Why You’ll Love Working Here** 



* Play a key role in building
 **next-generation AWS infrastructure, networking, containerization, and database solutions** 
 .
* Work in a
 **flexible hybrid environment** 
 that values collaboration and innovation.
* Join a supportive and talented team where your expertise
 **directly impacts business success** 
 .
* Contribute to a
 **modern, cloud-native IT stack** 
 that drives efficiency and scalability.



  





**Ready to Transform with Us?** 




 If you’re excited about designing, securing, and optimizing AWS infrastructure, networking, containerized environments, and databases, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and
 **help us build the future of cloud-based transportation** 
 .

title: Security Engineer
description:
**Role Overview**

 As a Security Engineer, you will play a crucial role in protecting our infrastructure and applications. You will be responsible for conducting internal security assessments, contributing to our detection and response capabilities, and enhancing our cloud security posture. Your expertise will help us to deliver improved vulnerability management and enhance our defenses while contributing to compliance with security best practices.
 


**Key Responsibilities**

 Conduct internal security testing, including penetration testing, internal red teaming, and threat simulations.
 



 Collaborate with technical teams to identify and mitigate security vulnerabilities in applications, infrastructure, and cloud environments.
 



 Secure cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP) by implementing best practices and identifying misconfigurations.
 



 Participate in incident response, threat hunting, and security monitoring activities.
 



 Develop and implement security tools, automation scripts, and testing frameworks.
 



 Knowledge sharing regarding latest cyber threats, attack techniques, and security trends.
 



 Work closely with our DevOps and IT teams to enforce secure coding and infrastructure deployment practices.
   

  




**Requirements**
* 4 to 6 years of experience in Cybersecurity
* Strong expertise in vulnerability management and internal red teaming
* Experience in Operational Security (OpSec) and Cloud Security (AWS, Azure, GCP).
* Proficiency in exploiting and securing web applications, networks, and cloud services.
* Strong knowledge of MITRE ATT&CK framework, SIEM tools, and security automation.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work independently.
* Certifications or other proven qualifications such as OSCP (Offensive Security Certified Professional) and AWS Certified Security - Red Team


**Nice-to-Have**

 Ability to utilize offensive security skills for defensive practices (Purple team)
 



 Familiarity with Kubernetes security, Infrastructure as Code (IaC), and DevSecOps practices.
 



 Scripting and automation skills (Python, PowerShell, Bash).
   

  




**Benefits**

 Across Vizrt, we all work with our shared purpose in mind; to deliver more stories, better told. That is because we believe that stories have the power to impact not just the audience, but the teller as well. A well-crafted and well-delivered story can change the world. We strive and innovate to deliver the best software-defined visual storytelling tools to the world's storytellers across broadcast, media, public service, enterprise, not-for-profit, education, health, houses of worship, in fact wherever there is a need to educate, entertain or inform. Because that is what stories do, it is why they are important.
 



 4 billion humans see the stories that our customers tell every day. So, for us diversity is not an optional objective, it is a simple reality. Our customers' customers are diverse, our customers are diverse, Vizrt gains strength from being diverse.
 



 It is true that we hold our diversity to be essential, it is something we constantly nourish and pay attention to, but it is not something we take for granted. We do not tolerate discrimination or harassment. We champion inclusion and we value each other's stories, and we relish their telling.
 



 We offer a comprehensive benefits package that includes{​{:}
 



 }

 h

title: DevOps Cloud Engineer
description:
Who We Are Looking For
   

  

 We are looking for a DevOps Cloud Engineer with 5 years of experience in infrastructure engineering, cloud environments, and possessing high technical skills along with an 'automation first' mindset. You are someone who is proactive with a strong sense of ownership and responsibility, eager to learn, and keen to share knowledge. Experience with building continuous integration and deployment pipelines on cloud platforms is required, along with excellent communication skills.
   

  

 What is Dev-IT
   

  

 You will be working in a small (but growing) team that is providing infrastructure and services to almost every part of the business. Be it from smaller automations to big implementations or development.
   

  

 What you will do
   

  

  

* Build automations for creating new services and integrations for many departments within the company.
* Play an important part of the team, managing the infrastructure of AWS.
* Manage and develop our containers, instances as well as serverless environments.


 Your profile
   

  

**Required Experience**
* Advanced knowledge and hands-on experience with AWS (other public clouds such as Azure and GCP are a plus)
* Experience in working with container technology (ECS, EKS / Kubernetes).
* Advanced experience within scripting languages such as Python, Bash and PowerShell.
* Managed and configured pipelines within Continuous Integration Solutions Azure DevOps / Jira.
* Administrated version control systems like Git, GitHub.
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation and Ansible.
* Identity management and SSO integrations, OAuth, SAML.


**Nice To Have Qualifications**
* Windows and/or Linux sysop background
* ETL knowledge
* Grafana
* VMWare (or similar solutions)


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization
 **, where** 
 everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability
 **to deliver** 
 exceptional results,
 **pay** 
 close attention to detail, and consistently
 **go** 
 the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in
 **their** 
 field
 **, driven by** 
 a relentless focus on solving problems
 **-** 
 no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in
 **leading the way in** 
 cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative
 **solutions** 
 that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Please apply to the position through the application form below. Selection and interviews will be ongoing. We do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Oracle Devops Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative, and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for an Oracle DevOps Engineer to join our DevOps team.
   

  

**About Cognizant EAS-Oracle**
 Cognizant is a highly respected and successful IT & business transformation partner for many distinguished organizations globally. We work with the world’s leading organizations to provide collaborative solutions to their business and IT challenges with innovative ideas. As Oracle solution practice (EAS-Oracle) our expertise in cloud and Oracle delivery empowers our customers with best-in-class service for digital transformation across 15 verticals including: banking and financial services, healthcare, retail, consumer goods and insurance.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As part of a DevOps team you will be building, supporting, migrating, and automating the Oracle environment on Exadata Cloud at Customer (ExaCC). Products supported within that environment include Oracle databases, Oracle Enterprise Manager, Oracle Key Vault and ExaCC.
   

  

 You will engineer the solution to build ExaCC platform to be compliant to regulatory requirements. You will be extensively working on Oracle Database migrations to ExaCC.
   

  

 A part of the workload will be developing the infrastructure as code to support CI/CD pipeline based on products such as Git, Jenkins, Ansible and Python.
   

  

 Your day-to-day activities will range from actual engineering the Database migrations and coding automation scripts to engineering new or adapted solutions for the customer. As part of the migration delivery team you will also be responsible for configuration of monitoring, maximum availability architecture (MAA) and support during and after the cutover window.
   

  

 You will work closely together with other teams and the Product Owner.
   

  

**Our ideal candidate**
* You are an experienced Oracle database administrator with Exadata/ExaCC knowledge and like to work in a DevOps team in a complex environment
* You love challenges and are motivated to achieve the project objectivesm. You are a team player, but also a self-starter
* You see the big-picture but like to go in detail to solve complex integration issues
* Experience with DevOps, Scrum, Agile
* Extensive experience with Oracle Enterprise Manager, Oracle Enterprise Linux and virtualization
* Good knowledge of Oracle Cloud Infrastructure


**What You Can Expect**
* Become part of a the ‘flag ship’ success story - We go through enormous growth!
* Based in the Nordics – we have offices in Norway, Denmark and Sweden in an European and Global network
* Organization driven by technology – We have a tremendous technology backbone
* Open, ‘can do’ team spirit
* Environment where you can make your own ideas reality
* To work on various challenging clients and projects


 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
   

  

 For more information contact: Cajsa.orvenholt@cognizant.com
