title: Engineering Manager
description:
**About Mindler** 




 Mindler was founded in 2018 by two psychologists and a doctor with a shared vision of creating a world with improved mental health. Thanks to our dedicated tech teams, who developed our app and health care platform, Mindler has emerged as a leading provider, transforming the mental health industry.
 



  





 Our tech organization is split into three teams: Growth, Treatment and Operational Efficiency. All teams work full-stack across our different applications like the patient app, psychologist web platform and back office systems.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As an Engineering Manager, you’ll play a key role at the intersection of people and technology. Leading a team of 4-6 engineers, you’ll be an integral part of one of our three product development teams, working closely with the Product Manager to drive innovation and execution. You’ll report directly to our VP of Engineering, and together with two other EM:s form a strategic tech leadership team. You’ll have budget responsibilities for systems & services, team activities and individuals, as well as partnering with the talent team to shape your team and retain top talents. Additionally, you’ll take on a special assignment to strengthen collaboration with our Analytics team, contributing to data-driven initiatives and projects.
 



  





*Here’s some of the things you’ll do practically:* 




  




* **Team Leadership** 
 – Lead and support a team of 4-6 engineers, including hiring, personal development, and well-being.
* **Budget responsibility** 
 - Estimate, track & report costs related to systems & services, individuals & teams.
* **Product team collaboration** 
 – Participate in standups, planning, workshops, retrospectives, and process improvements.
* **Remove blockers** 
 – Streamline communication, refine requirements, and resolve team dependencies.
* **Finetune processes & work methods** 
 - Developing procedures to ensure that quality standards are met and risk is managed.
* **Provide know-how** 
 - Monitor system compliance with applicable laws and regulations, such as GDPR and PDL.
* **Manage third-party relations** 
 - Communicate with technical vendors, negotiating agreements & keeping track of upcoming changes.
* **Identify and drive your own projects** 
 - What do you think is important for Mindler to succeed on our mission to provide better mental healthcare?



  





**Our Stack** 




 Our tech stack is built with TypeScript and runs on AWS.
 


* Our patient app is built with React-Native & Expo, tRPC, Storybook, Jest, Detox.
* Our backend services use Node, Express, tRPC, Vitest, Kysely for PostGres & MySQL, Docker, CDK and Lambdas.
* For our front-end clinician interface and backoffice tools we use React, Vite, Vitest, Playwright, styled-components, tRPC & react-query.



  





**Who are you?** 




 You’re a people-first leader with at least 7 years of combined technical and leadership experience, who cares deeply about the well-being and growth of your team. You’re looking for a job where your work has a real, positive impact on people’s lives. While coding is no longer your main focus, your strong technical background helps you navigate complex challenges. You thrive in a fast-paced tech environment, easily connecting with engineers, product teams, and other parts of the organisation, while keeping the bigger picture in mind. You appreciate high levels of autonomy and responsibility, and enjoy working on-site most days and engaging in team activities.
 



  





*What you bring:* 



* **Leadership & initiative** 
 – You take ownership, drive change, and have the authority to make an impact.
* **Technical expertise** 
 – Background in software development, DevOps, or data engineering.
* **Cross-team collaboration** 
 – Strong communication skills to bridge engineering, product, and business needs.
* **Data-driven mindset** 
 – Passion for building a market-leading, data-focused organization.
* **Practical management experience** 
 – Hands-on leadership, with experience in team and project management.



  





**What can we offer?** 




 If you thrive on collaborating with talented colleagues in the office, but also appreciate the flexibility to work remotely, we could be a great match. We offer a diverse role that emphasizes work-life balance, including tech-driven social activities to drive creativity and innovation. For example we arrange hack weeks, music quizzes, board game nights, etc. There are also parties and physical well-being activities together with the rest of the organization.
 



  





 You’ll be surrounded by inspiring engineers in a dynamic, forward-thinking environment. This gives you the opportunity to contribute to a company on a mission to make a meaningful impact on the global market of improving digital mental healthcare.
 



  





 We are looking forward to hearing from you!
 



  





**Q&A** 




 Does an Engineering Manager at Mindler write code?
 


* Yes! As much as they deem fit. But not as much as our Tech Leads or Developers, and likely there are often other priorities that they need to prioritize before.



  





 Is an Engineering Manager at Mindler the utmost technical expert in their team?
 


* No, that would be our Tech Leads, and developers with skills in different areas. As an EM you’ll be expected to understand the technical solutions we implement, and be able to provide input in technical discussions, but also keep a birds-eye-view and have other perspectives in mind when making decisions - like product, business, compliance, and team well-being.



  





 Is an Engineering Manager at Mindler an HR position?
 


* No, Mindler has a People and Culture department that will support you in common HR questions. Although you’ll have staff responsibility for your team and be the first point of contact for many queries. Since you are the person working closest to your team, you’re expected to take responsibility for each individuals well-being and personal development.



  





 Can I be an Engineering Manager at Mindler without a technical background?
 


* No, since you’ll be a core part of the product development team’s activities, you need to have experience working practically with software development, DevOps, modern agile processes and system design.



  





 Can I apply even if I don’t have any previous leadership experience?
 


* No, at this point we’re looking for someone with a shorter ramp-up time, with existing experience leading a development team.



  





 Does an Engineering Manager at Mindler manage a whole cross-functional team?
 


* No, each product development team consists of an Engineering Manager, a Product Manager, a Tech Lead and a number of developers, and then design and content resources depending on team functionality. The engineering manager has staff responsibility for the Tech Lead and developers, while designers, PM:s and content editors report to our VP of Product.



  





*–-* 




*Mindler is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to gender, gender identity or expression, national origin, religion or other beliefs, disability, sexual orientation or age.*

title: QA Lead
description:
You will work with quality assurance at If Insurance IT Corporate unit. This means you will lead test activities for several different projects and activities in IT Corporate. IT Corporate is a Nordic IT unit with close to 60 employees and consultants divided into three teams. We are responsible for systems and IT solutions for If's corporate units such as Accounting, Cash Management, Brand marketing and communication, Legal and HR. You see it as a matter of course to actively participate in the testing work. We work in an agile way and collaborate closely with our system suppliers, developers and other stakeholders.
   

  

 We are now looking for a QA lead. To thrive in the role of QA lead, we see that you can understand both IT and the needs of the business. You are a committed team player. You have the will and ability to drive improvements in routines and working methods and are happy to share your knowledge and experience with colleagues.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are now looking for a dedicated and skilled professional to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining effective working methods and routines to ensure smooth operations. You will take charge of planning, leading, and following up on test work, collaborating closely with technical testers, acceptance testers, and other team members. Together, you'll optimize test planning, test environments, and automation processes. A key aspect of this position involves driving automation efforts within tests. Furthermore, you will also actively participate in hands-on test activities. If you are passionate about quality assurance and innovation, we invite you to bring your expertise to our team.
   

  

**We offer**
 In the same way that we place expectations on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer.
   

  

 Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
   

  

* An including work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits
* High pension saving
* Lunch benefit


**About The Team**
 IT Corporate consists of several agile teams consisting of 3 – 10 colleagues. In this role you will sometime join an agile team for improving and participating in the agile sprint. You will also work across the teams and make sure the QA principles and methods are up to date. The spirit in the teams is very much anchored in If’s core values, “Put your heart into it”, “Trust is our backbone” and “We stay ahead”.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 We are seeking an individual who thrives on collaboration and enjoys sharing knowledge with others. The ideal candidate is both pedagogical and communicative, with a strong ability to convey ideas effectively. You should be driven and self-motivated, with a clear focus on quality and a thorough approach to your work. If you excel at juggling multiple tasks, are flexible and solution-oriented, and bring a proactive and innovative mindset
 **.**
**You have:**
* A relevant education with a university/college degree or comparable skills
* A great interest in quality assurance of IT systems
* At least 3 years of test management experience
* Experience driving implementation in test automation
* Experience driving integration testing (APIs and file integrations) end to end
* Experience with test automation frameworks


**It is a plus if you also:**
* Are experienced in Load tests/Performance tests and penetration tests
* Experience with one or more testing and test automation tools
* Microsoft Azure Dev Ops Test Management module


**Additional Facts And Recruitment Process**
**Application deadline:** 
 Screening and interviewing will start immediately. However, application deadline is 12th of March 2025.
   

**To apply for the position:** 
 Please attach your CV and answer the questions in the application form.
   

**Work location** 
 : Bergshamra, Stockholm.
   

  

**Start:** 
 As soon as possible/by agreement.
   

**For more information** 
 , please contact Sofia Thomsson, Leader and Technical sponsor, Business Support solutions, sofia.thomsson@if.se.
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: Senior Platform Engineer
description:
Welcome to SSC – Swedish Space Corporation, the perfect workplace for those passionate about technology in general and space in particular.
   

  

 With space organizations, research institutes, institutional and commercial actors as customers, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications, space consulting
   

  

 services, rocket and balloon systems, flight test services, satellite propulsion systems, and much more.
   

  

 At SSC, we provide our customers access to Space. With over 700 employees around the world, we provide expert-level competence in customer support including the design,
   

  

 test, launch, in-orbit and routine operations of flight and space systems. To achieve this, SSC uses our global network of ground systems and multi-mission antennas to provide
   

  

 satellite management, data downlink, antenna hosting and launch support to some of the largest names in the space industry including NASA, ESA, JAXA and many other New
   

  

 Space customers as well.
   

  

**Are you fueled by a passion for people and the ambition to create an awesome workplace?
   

  

 Are you ready to embark on an exciting journey with us to help Earth benefit from space?** 
  

  

 If you answer yes to these questions, we invite you to seize the opportunity to make a significant impact as a Senior Platform Engineer in our team. We are looking for an engaged team memberwho shares our core values of Customer passion, Care, Collaboration, Curiosity, and Courage.
   

  

**YOUR ROLE**
 We offer the opportunity to join the Software unit within SSC Connect, which develop and maintain critical systems required to connect our customers with their satellites.
   

  

 This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a team that is building a new Monitoring & Control system. With a new system comes challenges beyond the code. Together with architects, cloud experts and software engineers, you will set the standard for how we run development and production environments in the cloud. Furthermore, how we enable efficient operations by enhanced observability and most importantly how we create a great user experience for our customers. What this team builds up, many other teams will use.
   

  

 Initially, you will work closely with one of our software teams to enable the new Monitoring & Control system. Over time, you will share your experience with all our software teams and work on initiatives that gain the whole Software unit.
   

  

**As a Senior Platform Engineer, You Will**
* Manage and optimize cloud infrastructure.
* Offer expertise to development teams to improve workflows.
* Automate deployments and supervision.
* Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines.


**Who You Are**
 We think that you care – about your systems, your colleagues and your users. That you have a creative and analytical mindset. You take responsibility, drive your own initiatives and can learn and process technical details quickly. We also think that you appreciate both working autonomously and together with other people.
   

  

 We believe that you have a developer background, but you could also have gained your knowledge by working alongside developers. Regardless, you know what a great developer environment looks like, and can help us get there.
   

  

 You have a European citizenship and can travel within and outside Sweden if needed.
   

  

 As this position is critical to the operations of the SSC Services, it may include outside of standard working hours working and/or being part of an on-call team with up to 1 week on-call per month.
   

  

**What You Need To Know**
* B.S. Computer Science or Computer/Software Engineering, or similar experience.
* Proficiency in DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipeline management and Infrastructure as Code. Knowledge about GitHub and Terraform is a plus.
* Experience in Container ecosystem, preferably with Kubernetes.
* Cloud experience, preferably AWS.
* Comfortable working in Linux.
* Fluency in English.


**EXTRA MERITS**
* Experience optimizing cloud resource usage and costs.
* Understanding of cloud storage and databases, e.g., S3.
* Experience with Configuration management using tools as Ansible.
* Proficiency in Python and Go.
* Expertise in observability platforms and tools, e.g., Prometheus and ElasticSearch.


**WE OFFER YOU**
* An opportunity to be part of the exciting space industry and help Earth benefit from Space.
* An excellent opportunity for personal development and challenging endeavors.
* To be part of international development projects with highly engaged teams.
* A workplace characterized by an open atmosphere and proud employees all over the world.
* Possibility to work remotely part of the time (max 50%), and flexible work hours.


**LOCATION**
 This is permanent position with 40 hours/week, located at our office in Solna or Kiruna.
   

  

**NEXT STEP**
 If this opportunity sparks your interest, don’t wait—apply today! Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis, and interviews will be conducted continuously. We kindly ask you to submit your CV when applying. While you are welcome to include a brief personal note or letter, our evaluation will primarily focus on your skills and qualifications as outlined in your CV, ensuring a fair and unbiased recruitment process.
   

  

 Please note that the job advertisement may close earlier than the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications. This allows us to ensure a fair and efficient recruitment process and give each application the attention it deserves.
   

  

 This is a security-classified position and will require a background check prior to employment.
   

  

**WE HELP EARTH BENEFIT FROM SPACE**
 Swedish Space Corporation (SSC) is a leading global provider of advanced space services, with more than 50 years of experience. We help space organizations, research institutes, commercial and institutional actors from all over the world to get access to space.
   

  

 With local presence on all continents and about 700 committed employees, we offer specialist expertise in satellite communications and satellite control services, spacecraft operations, rocket and balloon systems, launch services and flight test services, as well as engineering, operations and consultancy services for space missions.
   

  

 We help Earth benefit from Space.

title: Test Engineer med erfarenhet inom bank/finans!
description:
**Test Engineer med kompetens i testautomation med erfarenhet inom bank/finans branschen?**
 Nu söker vi en teknisk testare som har erfarenhet inom testautomation för en stor kund inom bank och finans. Om du har erfarenhet från liknande roller och branscher, och trivs med att ingå i ett stort växande team, då är det dig vi söker!
   

  

 Sedan många år har Sogeti placerat sig i toppen på världskartan när det gäller test och kvalitetssäkring. Att vara bäst på test är helt enkelt en passion för oss!
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Med Följande Erfarenheter**
* Mellan 6-8 års erfarenhet av testarbete och testautomation.
* Programmeringsspråk som Python, JAVA, .NET.
* Erfarenhet av API-testning (t.ex. Postman, SoapUI, Ready API).
* Erfarenhet av GUI-testning med verktyg (t.ex. Selenium, Cypress, Playwright).
* Erfarenhet av projekthanterings-/testmanagement-system (t.ex. Jira, Azure DevOps).
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med CI/CD pipelines (t.ex. Jenkins, Azure DevOps).
* Microsoft Services och SOAP/REST-baserade tjänster och verktyg.
* ISTQB-certifiering.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med AI-drivna testverktyg eller ramverk, såsom verktyg för att generera testfall baserat på maskininlärning.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av att jobba med ETL- processer
* CI/CD pipelines


**I Rollen Ingår Följande Ansvarsområde**
* Skapa och underhålla testautomationsramverk för kvalitétssäkrade IT-leveranser
* Du har en passion för teknisk-testning och en vilja att fortsätta lära och utvecklas inom området.
* Analysera testresultat och coacha utvecklingsteamet inom testområdet
* Hålla sig själv uppdaterad med de senaste trenderna inom testautomatisering och föreslå förbättringar av testprocessen
* Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av att driva, underhålla och exekvera tester inom DevOps-miljöer och är bekväm med att leda och genomföra tester i en agil arbetskontext


**Varför välja oss?**
 Vi är ett ledande IT-konsultbolag med fokus på digital transformation och innovation. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med spännande kunder inom offentlig sektor, energi och finans – alltid med den senaste tekniken i fokus.
   

  

 Som en del av Sogeti erbjuder vi dig en trygg anställning där vi prioriterar våra medarbetare och balans i livet. Vi värdesätter en positiv arbetsmiljö och strävar efter att skapa en atmosfär där du kan trivas och utvecklas.
   

  

**Nyfiken på fler anledningar till att jobba hos oss? Kika in här:**
* Ditt Sogeti - Lär känna din framtida arbetsgivare!
* Dina förmåner - Få koll på vad vi erbjuder våra medarbetare!
* Medarbetarnöjdhet - Hur betygsätter våra egna sogetiare livet hos oss?


**Skicka in din ansökan med CV redan idag!**
 Vi hanterar alla ansökningar löpande!
   

  

 Hoppas vi ses!
   

  

 /Team Manager, Daniel Lindström

title: Data Platform Engineer
description:
**THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL**
**You?** 
 A skilled Data Platform Engineer with a passion for building agile data platforms in a Data Mesh environment.
   

  

**Role?** 
 Develop and maintain an Internal Developer Platform, handling tasks from coding to communication across teams.
   

  

**Location?** 
 Join us at Blocket in our
 **Stockholm** 
**office** 
 , with the flexibility to work remotely
 **2-3 days a week** 
 —your choice, your balance.
   

  

**Why us?** 
 Join us to work at the scale of millions of end-users, contributing to a sustainable circular economy.
   

  

**WHO ARE YOU?**
* You have 3+ years of experience in software engineering.
* Excellent DevOps skills with focus on automation (GitHub Actions and Make) and infrastructure as code (Terraform).
* Proficient with Linux and scripting (BASH, Python).
* Strong on async collaboration and communication in English.
* Experience in building self-service platforms for high-availability systems and data engineering (SQL, Snowflake, dbt, Kafka) is a plus.


**WHAT's THE JOB LIKE?**
* Develop & Maintain: Work on an internal developer platform driven by a Data Mesh philosophy to support data engineering teams.
* Code & Automate: Use BASH, Python, Terraform, GitHub Actions to automate and deploy solutions.
* Data & Security: Handle managed-services and data pipelines according to security and compliance practices.
* Collaborate & Communicate: Work with teams across Nordics, using Slack, GitHub, and Google Meet for async and real-time discussions.
* Own & Improve: Take ownership of tasks, improve workflows, and contribute to a scalable and agile data platform.


**COLLEAGUES**
* You will be part of a team of 7 individuals, distributed in Stockholm and Helsinki, meeting digitally daily, meeting physically regularly in one of our Nordic locations, for larger meetups but also for ad-hoc work-from-another-office visits. We're part of the data platform area, combining data engineering, data management, data science and machine learning teams. We are only one out of many teams of talented individuals with diverse backgrounds, intellects and identities.
* Hi, I'm Dagmar! I've been a Data Engineer at Schibsted for 3 years and enjoyed every bit of it. I get to work with modern technologies, varied technology stacks, international colleagues and on interesting data from Finland's biggest marketplace and real estate sites. Being a multinational with English as the working language, we get to cooperate with diverse people and inspire each other from our experiences. The company culture values open-minded people, supports everyone to succeed in their work, gain new knowledge and creates opportunities to hang out outside of work hours.


**GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!**
 If you're a passionate Data Platform Engineer eager to contribute to a sustainable circular economy, we want to hear from you! Apply by February 20, 2025. We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.
   

  

**QUESTIONS?**
 Hi! My name is Andrei, and I am the hiring manager for this role. I am happy to provide information about the position and answer any questions you may have, so please reach out through (andrei.neculau@schibsted.com) if you have any questions!

title: Data Engineer
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

 Would you like to make a difference and work together with us on our big target? Do you want to play a significant role in supporting the Asset Driven Business Areas within Vattenfall in accelerating the digital transformation? You are convinced that the information assets generated by our physical assets, i.e. the big data coming from our wind turbines, batteries or heating grids hold the key for improved decision making, advanced business models, optimized asset utilization and furthermore?
   

  

 Within the Asset Analytics team, the
 **Data Engineer** 
 is a front runner who is in continuous dialogue with the experts in Vattenfall’s various departments to build, maintain and optimize state of the art analytics solutions.
   

  

**What will you do?**
 You will be a member of one of our DevOps teams designing, creating, and maintaining solutions based on the MS Azure technology stack. In doing so, we as IT partner up with our colleagues from the various departments within Vattenfall on a daily basis. The tasks and projects are varied and so are the data, the use cases and the technology. For instance our solutions have a direct impact on fuel consumption in the district heating grid of Berlin based on live Smart Meter data evaluation, optimize maintenance cycles of turbines and under water cables via predictive maintenance or allow for cross country streaming data analytics on Hydro powerplant sensor data.
   

  

 Your tasks and responsibilities:
   

  

* Analyzing business needs and translating them into IT specifications;
* Providing expert advice both internally in the team and to various other departments in Vattenfall.
* Proactively adapting value adding solutions to the needs of other departments;
* Designing, building and maintaining data lake solutions to share data within Vattenfall & with external stakeholders;
* Implementing traditional database & DWH concepts to structure the data in the cloud, on-premise and hybrid to provide self-service reporting solutions (e.g. using PowerBI).
* Building and maintaining ETL/ELT tracks and APIs;
* Creating and continuously developing dashboards in PowerBI;
* Working with streaming data analytics together with business stakeholders;
* Being part of DevOps teams together with architects, requirement engineers, data engineers, data scientists and business specialists.


**Location**
 Katowice, Gliwice, Amsterdam, Stockholm, Berlin or Hamburg
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

**Who are you?**
 As our
 **Data Engineer** 
 you have a hands-on mentality to solve complex issues. You have a strong drive to ask questions. You are willing to learn new tools and continuously improve your soft and hard skills. You embrace working on new topics and projects every day. You think about data as a massive asset to leverage & are familiar with data sharing concepts in the cloud. You have an agile mindset and SCRUM way of working. You feel personally committed to the goal setting and delivery of the team (local and international). You have a teaching mindset and you love to share your knowledge with the team. Last but not least you are not afraid to drink a cup of coffee with our key users.
   

  

 As our Data Engineer you:
   

  

* Have working experience with Analytics & BI tools and services, preferably in the MS Azure stack (e.g. Synapse workspaces and dedicated SQL pools, SQL Database, PostgreSQL, Snowflake, Databricks, Data Factory, Analysis Services, Function Apps, Power BI, ML);
* Have a technical background with an understanding of how analytics solutions are brought into life by means of preferably but not exclusively Python, SQL, C#, PowerShell;
* Are familiar with CI / CD, testing and version control (e.g. Azure DevOps, ARM, GIT or similar);
* Are familiar with Data Warehousing and Data modelling concepts;
* Have an understanding of IT Architecture guidelines & principles (e.g. TOGAF) and on-premise, cloud & hybrid architectural patterns;
* Have experience in working agile;
* Are proficient in spoken and written English;
* Ideally you already have a good understanding of utility business processes and their IT landscape (SAP ERP, IAM, EAM, SCADA, infrastructure and security regulations like GDPR).


 Mer information
   

  

**Our offer**
 Good remuneration, a challenging and international work environment, and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development.
   

  

**More Information**
 We welcome your application in English. We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.
   

  

 For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Ewa Krajewska via ewa.krajewska@vattenfall.com
   

  

 At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.
   

  

 The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall. The screening will be performed by a third party, Validata.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall is a European energy company with approximately 21 000 employees. For more than 100 years we have electrified industries, supplied energy to people’s homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation. We are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful corporate mission.

title: Technical Lead / Lösningsarkitekt
description:
**Om oss** 




  





 Valtech, som nyligen förvärvade Kin + Carta, är ett ledande digitalt transformationsföretag som strävar efter att skapa bättre sätt att uppleva världen. Med över 6,500 medarbetare på mer än 60 kontor globalt hjälper vi varumärken att frigöra värde i en snabbt digitaliserad värld. Vi samarbetar med några av världens mest framstående företag, likaväl som lokala aktörer på den svenska marknaden och fokuserar på att utveckla innovativa lösningar som förbättrar både kundupplevelser och affärsprocesser.
 



  





**Rollen** 




  





 Vi söker en
 **Tech Lead / Solution Architect** 
 som har djup teknisk expertis och erfarenhet inom plattformsimplementering, särskilt med verktyg som
 **Optimizely** 
 . Du kommer att arbeta nära våra kunder och interna team för att designa, implementera och optimera digitala lösningar. Du bör vara baserad i Stockholm och kunna arbeta från vårt kontor 2–3 dagar per vecka.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




  




* Leda och delta i kundprojekt från förförsäljning och upptäckt till leverans, i samarbete med både lokala och globala team.
* Engagera både IT- och affärsintressenter för att skräddarsy lösningar som skapar affärsnytta.
* Designa och implementera skalbara och hållbara lösningar för CMS-projekt.
* Leda tvärfunktionella team för att integrera komplexa backend-system, inklusive CMS och externa tjänster.
* Bidra med tekniskt ledarskap och mentorskap för utvecklingsteam, samt främja en kultur av innovation och kvalitet.
* Aktivt identifiera och åtgärda tekniska utmaningar och flaskhalsar för att säkerställa optimal prestanda och effektivitet.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste trenderna och teknologierna inom digital transformation.



  





**Din Bakgrund** 




  




* Minst 10 års erfarenhet av backend-utveckling, med särskilt fokus på Optimizely CMS. Erfarenhet av eCommerce-plattformar är ett plus.
* Goda kunskaper inom .NET / .NET Core (C#), API-driven utveckling samt Privacy by Design.
* Erfarenhet av molnplattformar, främst Azure, och god förståelse för DevOps-principer.
* Erfarenhet av databasdesign och utveckling (inklusive SQL).
* Du är van vid att hantera kundrelationer och identifiera ytterligare sätt för att skapa värde genom tekniska lösningar.
* Erfarenhet av att leda och designa arkitekturen för företagslösningar.



  





**Vad kan du förvänta dig hos oss?** 




  





 På Valtech kommer du att bli en del av ett kreativt och innovativt team som strävar efter att göra skillnad genom våra lösningar. Vi ger dig möjlighet att ta stort ansvar, vara en nyckelperson i vårt globala team och leda förändring. Vi värdesätter innovation, samarbete och frihet under ansvar. Hos oss får du kontinuerliga möjligheter att utvecklas och bidra till den globala tekniska utvecklingen.
 



  





**Är du redo att ta nästa steg?** 




  





 Vi söker en driven och engagerad person som vill vara med och forma framtidens digitala lösningar. Om detta låter som en spännande möjlighet för dig, ansök idag! Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och diskutera hur du kan bidra till vår resa.
 



  





**Välkommen till Valtech!**

title: Tech Lead inom E-handel, CMS & Commerce
description:
*Vill du vara med och skapa framtidens digitala lösningar för e-handel? På Nexer Unified Commerce får du chansen att inte bara leda ett engagerat team, utan också vara den kreativa kraften bakom banbrytande tekniska innovationer. Med din tekniska expertis och ditt strategiska ledarskap är du nyckeln till att skapa skräddarsydda e-handelsplattformar som förändrar spelplanen för våra kunder. Är du redo att ta din karriär inom e-handel till nästa nivå? Sök tjänsten som Tech Lead till Nexer Unified Commerce idag!*
 Som Tech Lead kommer du att vara den drivande kraften bakom vår e-handelsutveckling, ansvarig för att leda och coacha ditt team mot att skapa skräddarsydda lösningar som passar våra kunders unika behov. Genom din strategiska och operativa expertis styr du arbetet med att skapa och implementera e-handelslösningar, med fokus på att leverera maximalt affärsvärde.
   

  

 Tillsammans med ditt team skapar du en inspirerande arbetsmiljö där ni kontinuerligt lär av varandra och utvecklar innovativa lösningar. Med din omfattande erfarenhet och tekniska kunnande inom ledande e-handelsplattformar som Optimizely (Episerver) och Umbraco leder du utvecklingen av lösningar baserade på CMS/e-handelsplattformar för både B2C och B2B kunder.
   

  

 Du har tidigare arbetat med internationell e-handel och hanterat flera olika kundprojekt, vilket har gett dig en bred erfarenhet av olika e-handelssystem och branscher. Tillsammans med dina kollegor i teamet säkerställer du att varje kund erhåller den mest lämpliga lösningen och främjar utvecklingen av innovativa svar på kommande utmaningar. Som teknisk expert inom förstudier och kravställningar spelar du en central roll i att driva vår fortsatta tillväxt och framgång inom e-handelsbranschen.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som har...**
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet inom webbutveckling och .NET-utveckling
* Erfarenhet av att leda inom backend-utveckling
* Erfarenhet av molntjänster såsom AWS och/eller Azure
* Erfarenhet av Optimizely, och/eller Umbraco CMS, Norce, Oro och övrig Commerce
* Teknisk expertis i plattformar såsom Optimizely och Umbraco
* Erfarenhet av internationell e-handel
* Erfarenhet av integrationer mot olika system
* Ansvarig erfarenhet för att tillsammans med projektledaren skapa en övergripande projektplan, inklusive målsättningar och tidslinjer
* Förmåga att säkerställa att projektet uppfyller tekniska krav och kvalitetsstandarder
* Kommunikationsfärdigheter med ledaregenskaper, och vana att samarbeta med externa leverantörer och tekniska team
* Kompetens att behärska både svenska och engelska på en professionell nivå


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* Erfarenhet av DevOps, Jira, Scrum, GIT
* Utbildning eller certifiering inom systemarkitektur
* Erfarenhet av AI - verktyg


 Du är en ledare som kan vara en stabil stöttepelare för teamet, med en ödmjuk och hjälpsam inställning. Förmågan att trivas i team och vara ansvarstagande är avgörande för att säkerställa en smidig samarbetsprocess och framgångsrik projektgenomföring. Att vara självständig är också viktigt för att ta initiativ och bidra till att lösa problem när de uppstår, vilket är kritiskt för att hantera de tekniska utmaningar som du i rollen som Tech Lead ställs inför.
   

  

**Om Nexer Unified Commerce**
 Nexer Unified Commerce är en specialistenhet för allt inom e-handel. Vårt mål är att ta våra kunders e-handel till nästa nivå och vara en partner på resan genom att ge deras kunder en bättre upplevelse. Det gör vi genom att samla de bästa inom branschen i vårt team och samlar alla system som rör e-handel och kunddialog till ett ekosystem för att skapa en bättre köpupplevelse.
   

  

 Alla våra medarbetare har lång erfarenhet av e-handel och har arbetat med och på några av världens mest framgångsrika e-handlare. Vi arbetar sida vid sida med några av de främsta plattformarna inom e-handel. Vi värdesätter samarbete och tror på möjligheten att skapa framgång genom att arbeta tillsammans. Oavsett om du sitter på vårt kontor i Stockholm, Borås eller Umeå, erbjuder vi en flexibel arbetsmiljö som stöder hybridarbete.
   

  

**Ansök idag**
 Vi tar löpande emot ansökningar, så vänta inte med att söka! Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-post, men om du har några frågor är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Ebba Persson på ebba.persson@nexergroup.com.

title: Senior Full-Stack Developer (Android)
description:
**Role: Senior Full-Stack Developer (Android)** 

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (Partial Remote Possible)

 Contract (12 Months, Extendable)
 



**Start Date:** 
 ASAP
   




**Job Overview:** 

 We are seeking a
 **Senior Full-Stack Developer with a focus on Android** 
 to join one of our
 **five product teams** 
 within IT Traffic and Service. The team develops and manages critical
 **traffic planning and management systems,** 
 essential to the company’s core operations. The development process is
 **highly collaborative, involving close work with end users.** 




 The company is currently migrating and
 **rebuilding its backend to a microservices architecture** 
 , with applications hosted on
 **Azure Cloud** 
 . You will work on

 , directly influencing the future of digital services.

* **API Design** 
 – Design and develop REST APIs.

 – Write testable code and ensure high test coverage.

 – Set up and manage CI/CD pipelines for application deployment.
* **Agile Collaboration**

* **REST API Design** 
 – Experience in designing and implementing APIs.
* **Legacy Code Refactoring** 
 – Ability to modernize and optimize existing codebases.

**Preferred Skills (Meritorious):**

 – Experience with
 **Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud** 
 .
* **CI/CD Pipelines** 
 – Setting up deployment pipelines in
 **Microsoft DevOps or equivalent tools** 
 .
* **Version Control & Agile Tools** 
 – Jira, Confluence, Git, DevOps Pipelines.
* **Pair & Mob Programming** 
 – Experience working in collaborative coding environments.


**Work Environment & Schedule:** 
* **Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden (Onsite with Partial Remote Work Possible).

 12 months, with a possibility of extension.
* **Language Requirements:** 
 Good proficiency in
 **Swedish and English** 
 (spoken and written).

**About HCLTech**  

HCLTech is a global technology company, spread across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products. We work with clients across all major verticals, providing industry solutions for Financial Services, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail and CPG, and Public Services. We re powered by our people a global, diverse, multi-generational talent - representing 161 nationalities whose unique spark, perspective and boundless passion drive our culture of proactive value creation and problem-solving.  

Our purpose is to bring together the best of technology and our people to supercharge progress for everyone, everywhere our clients, partners, their stakeholders, communities, and the planet. As a company, we are deeply focused on accelerating our ESG agenda. We are also creating technology-enabled sustainable solutions with and for our clients and partners. We embed ESG imperatives into every aspect of our business and ensure that the progress we supercharge is responsible, inclusive and beneficial to all our stakeholders in the long term. We have committed to achieving net zero by 2040.  

  

To learn more about how we can supercharge progress for you, visit www.hcltech.com

To play a pivotal role in designing and implementing complex technical solutions, ensuring they align with business objectives and industry best practices. (1.) **Key Responsibilities**

title: Enterprise Network Architect
description:
### **Responsibilities**


* Take lead in design work for new solutions supporting business initiatives requiring new functions and services.
* Develop, build, and manage the H&M Network, transforming our legacy network to network as a code with a service layer.
* Control that architectural policies and guidelines are followed and in accordance with roadmap.
* Documentation of service design package and service description.
* Documentation of guidelines, processes and routines.
* Cooperate and coordinate with stakeholder’s contribution with Network knowledge to reach business needs.
* Contribute to the Domain and Product Area strategy and OKRs.
* Striving for cost efficiency and automation based on trends and new technologies for service-layer oriented Networking.
* Provide technical engineering and best practices concerning the overall Network.
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices, making recommendations as needed to help our company develop.
* Understand and visualize concepts that are not yet concrete, and use your problem-solving skills, strong analytic ability, creativity and customer and business drive to find a solution.
* See the big picture, identify patterns and instinctively know how to win support for your ideas.
* Take the initiative and are not afraid to take the first steps to identify and address existing and potential obstacles, issues, and opportunities.

  


**Requirements**


* Network design and Network architecture.
* Creating High, and low-level designs.
* Planning, design and lifecycle management for global WAN networks (either from ISP or big IT organizations).
* The ability to understand business needs transforming them into design for new services or infrastructure functionalities.
* Design and implementation of routing, switching, WAN optimization, MP-BGP, Ethernet QoS, DMVPN, VPLS etc.
* A curious mindset to learn and understand how the Network delivery can support the business needs.
* The ability to recognize structural issues within the organization, functional interdependencies and cross-silo redundancies and apply architectural principles to business solutions.
* An understanding about product development from ideation to release.
* Cloud networking and cloud connectivity solutions in a multicloud environment.
* Understanding of network security ((IPS, proxy, firewall, reverse-proxy, load balancing, VPN).
* Experience of micro segmentation and profiling.
* IP Networking and SDWAN and SD-LAN.
* Running network as a code.
* Scripting, python, ansible, Git etc.
* Network automation and programming.
* Experience of working with APIs and system integrations.
* Knowledge and experience of Cisco and Aruba environment.

  


**Desired Skills**


* 802.1x Network Access Control.
* BGP and internet routing.
* Cisco ICE.
* Cisco Wireless on enterprise level.
* Aruba Clearpass.
* Aruba center.
* PCI/DSS.
* Infoblox IPAM.

title: Data Platform Engineer
description:
**Job ID:** REF20224F


**Date posted:** 19/02/2025


**Company Description**


The goal of Range Experience - IKEA Planning experience is to support and empower customers to find their personal best home furnishing solutions. We run and develop digital solutions used by customers and co-workers enabling them to design homes and home furnishing solutions for the entire IKEA range for all IKEA retailers. Part of our portfolio are planning solutions for Kitchens, Bathrooms, Storage solutions, Beds... Our next big step ahead will be to enable customers to design their full homes.  

  

Our customers should experience an inspiring, fun, simple and rewarding planning journey based on their needs and preferences. Our co-workers and service partners should experience a fun, efficient and unbroken sales process.  

  

The solutions and capabilities we develop are an integral part of the entire seamless buying and selling experience and a key contributor to converting visitors into happy customers and to engaging with our customers from the start. Utilising data around and about our products to create more personalised experiences is an integral part of the work we do.  

  

Range Experience deliver solutions to all IKEA retailers spanning over 50 markets worldwide and over 400 stores and IKEAs digital channels. All solutions are made to help customers and co-workers in all customer meetings, from a mobile phone to the largest IKEA store in the world.  

  

***Being a Data Engineer in the Range Experience team***  

As a Data Engineer in the Range Experience team, you will be responsible to design, build and maintain the data pipelines and tools that enable our teams to work in a data driven way. You will work very close to other Data engineers, Data scientists, Product teams and other stakeholders. You will be part of creating solutions that enable customers to design any space in their homes and businesses and configure home furnishing solutions digitally. Exploring and utilising different technologies and approaches to achieve the best result is a natural part of everything you do. With your data driven mindset you are a strong ambassador and driver for the data literacy and culture in Range Experience.

***To be successful in this role***  

You are passionate about generating continuous value through providing, analysing and utilising data and together with other Data engineers, Data scientist, product team(s) and other stakeholders. You thrive in understanding data needs and assisting in development of models and analysis.  

  

You have an interest and proven track record in finding the most efficient ways to extract, transform and load data from different sources, to ensure that our digital solutions fulfil and adapt to actual and future business needs. Staying up to date with the latest technologies and best practices in data engineering and bringing this specialised knowledge to the whole organisation is a part of your toolbox. You have a great interest in the world around you and keep yourself updated with the latest trends and future technology, just as we do.  

  

You make mistakes sometimes that keep you evolving and learning as you are not afraid to find new ways to solve a challenging task together with your colleagues.  

  

***Your main responsibilities as the Data Engineer will be:***

* Collaborate with engineers, product managers, and data scientists to understand data needs, representing key data insights in a meaningful way
* Influence product and cross-functional teams to identify data opportunities to drive impact
* Optimize pipelines to enhance data quality and reliability
* Contribute to the development of analytical tools and programs, ensuring easy and standardised access and sharing of data.
* Mentor and coach junior data engineers in the team.
* Ensure application and consistency with relevant digital frameworks, principles, guidelines and standards.
* Document and make the relevant know-how available.

***Required/Relevant work experience:***

* Strong knowledge in designing efficient, robust and automated data pipelines, ETL workflows, data warehousing and Big Data processing.
* Develop and implement a scalable data architecture to manage, store, and process large datasets generated from customer facing applications.
* Influence product and cross-functional teams to identify data opportunities to drive impact
* Advanced experience with Python or PySpark is required.
* Proficiency in cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud) for data storage and processing.
* Experience in applying new cutting-edge data engineering methods to improve performance of data flow
* Experience preparing data for Data Science and Machine Learning.
* Preferred experience in a product environment.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive approach to challenges.

  

You enjoy an Agile and iterative, yet structured way of working and achieving results together with a team in a flexible environment, but also have a strong individual drive to deliver high quality results on time. You have great communication and networking skills and are fluent in written and spoken English.

***Qualifications:***

* 5+ years of experience where the primary responsibility involves working with data. This could include roles such Software Developer, Backend Developer, and/or Data Engineer.
* Demonstrable experience with data modelling, and Python/Pyspark
* Demonstrable experience with Airflow or use of any other engineering workflows
* Bachelor’s degree within Engineering, Computer science, Information Systems, Mathematics or related fields. Master’s degree is preferred within Engineering, Computer science, Information Systems, Mathematics or related fields.
* Experience of working alongside multiple teams and with an understanding of multiple product environments.

  

**More Information**  

This role is full-time (40 hours per week) and is based in Malmö, Sweden. *Travelling based on business needs might be necessary.* This role sits within Range Experience and reports to the Architecture Manager.  

  

At IKEA, we are looking for people who believe everyone deserves a seat at the table. You’re welcome no matter where you come from, what you believe, and what you look like. We don’t even care how you have furnished your home. We’re interested in you simply because you’re you. Even if your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. We believe that people’s different perspectives, backgrounds, and personalities make us better at understanding our customers dreams and needs. At IKEA, we’re all on the same project.  

  

If you have a special need that requires accommodation in the recruitment process, just let us know.
company_description: At IKEA, we share an inspiring vision: “to create a better everyday life for the many people”.

title: ML Engineer
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**  

We are looking for an enthusiastic mid to senior level machine learning engineer to join our dynamic and growing team at LeoVegas. The ideal candidate will have an open-minded attitude and be eager to learn. You will get the opportunity to work hands-on in the entire lifecycle of putting machine learning based applications in production.  

Our team is responsible for providing the entire organisation, including all brands and markets, with algorithms for decision-making support, product personalization, and optimization and automation of business processes. Our project portfolio is diverse and constantly growing. Examples include churn prediction, lifetime-value prediction, player risk assessment models (responsible gaming), money laundering detection, and recommender systems to name a few. **YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:**  

* Design, build, and optimize machine learning models to meet business objectives, while adhering to new regulations.
* Continuously improve and maintain existing models to enhance their performance, accuracy, and efficiency.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (product, engineering, business) to seamlessly integrate machine learning solutions and align with company goals.
* Analyze and transform data using SQL to prepare datasets for model development, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
* Conduct A/B testing and experiments to evaluate the effectiveness of new features and promotions.
* Write clean, modular, and well-documented code for machine learning models, and implement CI/CD pipelines for automated model training and deployment.
* Ensure model performance and reliability by setting up monitoring systems and addressing issues like model drift.

**OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:**  

ESSENTIAL SKILLS

* Experience researching, developing, deploying and maintaining machine learning models in a production environment for at least 2 years
* Understanding of fundamental concepts in statistics and machine learning
* Strong software engineering skills with a focus on writing clean and maintainable code
* Proficiency in Python
* Experience with SQL, Git and Docker

  

NICE TO HAVES

* Experience in any of the following techniques or systems: Google Cloud Platform, Vertex AI, BigQuery, Airflow, GitHub, Kubeflow, scikit-learn, Stan, survival analysis, Bayesian statistics, causal inference, TensorFlow, time-series forecasting and XGBoost.

 **WHO WE ARE**

  

At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.  

  



**BENEFITS**  

* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation *(**T&C apply)*
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.

 **JOIN US!**

  

In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!


Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!  

\*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*  

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

title: Operational Manager, Evidensia Dyrehospital, Karlslunde
description:
Evidensia Dyrehospital søger en datadrevet Operational Manager, der sammen med den øvrige ledelse, kan drive vores organisation fremad gennem effektive driftsoptimeringer og stærk projektledelse.

**Om rollen:**


Som Operational Manager vil du være en del af ledelsesgruppen og du vil referere til Business Manager Danmark. Du vil være ansvarlig for, at identificere og implementere forbedringer i vores driftsprocesser, for at øge effektiviteten og reducere omkostningerne, ligesom du vil være en del af tværfunktionelle projekter fra start til slut samt at sikre at deadlines overholdes, og at projekterne leveres inden for budgettet. Du vil have et stort fokus på, at opretholde fortsat vækst og sikre en stærk markedsposition.

**Dine ansvarsområder:**

* Bistå med data til beslutningsgrundlag for kampagner og andre initiativer (business controlling).
* Være lokal lead på ProVet Cloud (elektronisk patient journalsystem)
* Support ifm. Onboarding af nye dyrehospitaler og -klinikker
* Optimere drift, så klinik- og hospitalspersonale kan bruge mest muligt tid på patienter.
* Sikre, at værktøjer og projekter fra UK & Sverige tilpasses og implementeres til det danske marked.
* Ansvar for vores driftssystemer i Danmark i samarbejde med øvrige lande.
* Forretningsudvikling - deltage i udvikling af interne og eksterne forretningsmuligheder.
* Yderligere udvikling af Evidensia’s markedsposition
* Diverse tværgående projekter, som naturligt vil opstå af ovenstående fokusområder.

**Om dig:**


Vi søger dig der har en naturlig evne til at motivere og bemyndige kollegaer, skabe et positivt og produktivt arbejdsmiljø, og fremme en kultur af kontinuerlig læring og udvikling. Vi ser gerne, at du er samarbejdsorienteret og god til at arbejde i teams. Du er ambitiøs og målrettet, struktureret og detalje orienteret når det er nødvendigt, samt positiv og tålmodig.

**Kvalifikationer og kompetencer:**

* Forretningsstærk, med afsæt i og fokus på data med dokumenterede kommercielle resultater.
* Proaktiv og løsningsorienteret i både tankesæt og handling.
* Erfaring med tæt tværfagligt samarbejde.
* Systemstærk og teknisk kyndig.
* Motiveres naturligt af at afslutte, følge op og evaluere projekter.
* Evne til at gennemskue komplekse forhold og gøre dem enkle for organisationen.
* Flydende i engelsk; svensk tale/skrift er en fordel.
* Erfaring med samarbejde i nordiske lande, især Sverige, er en fordel.

**Om os:**


Evidensia Danmark er en del af Europas største veterinærkoncern, IVC Evidensia, som består af mere end 2.600 dyrehospitaler og klinikker i 20 lande. Dyrene og deres ejere er altid i centrum i Evidensia, og vi gør os umage hver dag ved at tilbyde den bedste behandling og service af højeste veterinærfaglige kvalitet. I Evidensia Danmark er vi samlet ca. 200 medarbejdere, der arbejder fordelt på 13 lokationer.


Vores værdier:

* **We Care**: Vi tager os af både dyr og mennesker. Det indebærer at holde løfter, behandle hinanden med anstændighed og respekt, og sikre, at alle føler sig værdsatte og støttede.
* **We Dare**: Vi opmuntrer til innovation og iværksættertænkning. Vi tør tage chancer og identificere muligheder for at lykkes i en verden i konstant forandring.
* **We Share**: Deling af viden og bedste praksis er centralt. Beslutninger træffes baseret på tillid, dialog og engagement, hvilket styrker samarbejdet på tværs af organisationen.


Hvad kan vi tilbyde:

* En spændende stilling i en branche, der er karakteriseret af faglig og forretningsmæssig innovation.
* En dansk organisation, der er en integreret del af Europas største veterinærkoncern med hovedkontor i UK
* En virksomhed, der har særlig fokus på den markedsmæssige positionering, herunder digital tilstedeværelse.
* En virksomhedskultur med stærke og sunde værdier, hvor teams kommer frem for personlige ambitioner og interesser.
* En organisation med fladt organisationshierarki.

**Ansøgning:**


Hvis du kan genkende dig selv i ovenstående stilling og har vi fanget din interesse hører vi gerne fra dig snarest. Vi behandler ansøgningerne løbende og derfor må du hellere sende din ansøgning nu i stedet for senere. Alle ansøgninger behandles med 100 % fortrolighed.


Har du yderligere spørgsmål til stillingen kan vores Business Manager Rune Rehlund kontaktes på tlf. 35 77 97 81 eller vores HR Chef Gitte Wagner kontaktes på tlf. 81 77 13 04.


Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig
company_description: We are a global leader in veterinary care, dedicated to providing exceptional animal care. Our network of first-opinion practices, referral hospitals, and emergency care centres.

title: Email and Automation Specialist
description:
**Vill du vara med och forma framtidens digitala marknadsföring?**


**Vi söker en Email and Automation Specialist till vårt framgångsrika team i Halmstad. Här får du en central roll i att utveckla och driva vår kundkommunikation med hjälp av moderna verktyg och ett engagerat team. Tjänsten är både kreativ och strategisk, med möjligheten att göra verklig skillnad i en digitalt driven organisation.**


*Vi på AJ Produkter är proffs på att utforma arbetsmiljöer där människor mår bra. Med fokus på innovation, egendesignade produktserier och två egna fabriker skapar vi smarta lösningar för arbetsplatsen i tiden. Och med verksamhet i 19 europeiska länder, ca 900 anställda och en omsättning på drygt 2,5 mdkr, bidrar vi årligen till att förbättra arbetsmiljön på 330 000 arbetsplatser Europa runt. Sortimentet består av möbler, inredningslösningar och utrustning för materialhantering. Totalt mer än 15 000 produkter för kontor, skola, lager och industri – allt är lättillgängligt via katalog, e-handel, kundanpassande projekt eller ett samtal till någon av våra säljare.*


**Om tjänsten**



Ditt uppdrag som Email and Automation Specialist är att driva, utveckla, automatisera samt genomföra riktade aktiviteter i syfte att kommunicera värde till våra kunder vid rätt tillfälle. Din roll på avdelningen är att ansvara för Marketing Automation. Du kommer ha ett tätt samarbete med vår Customer Loyalty Specialist och du rapporterar till Head of Digital Marketing.



 Som Email and Automation Specialist kommer du att:


* Utveckla vår lojalitetsskapande marknadsföring med fokus på Email och befintliga kunder.
* Planera, segmentera kunddatabasen, designa och bygga automatiska flöden i MA-verktyg så att vår kommunikation alltid träffar rätt.
* Lägga planen för vår Email kommunikation i samarbete med våra Marketing Managers och arbeta operativt med kanalen i Sverige samt stötta alla våra marknader.
* Jobba för att integrera fler kanaler ur ett MA-perspektiv i syfte att föra dialogen med kund på det sätt som är mest effektivt.
* Arbeta med olika segment och genomföra löpande tester i syfte att optimera effekten av våra utskick.


**Om dig**



Vi söker dig som har några års erfarenhet av att arbeta med e-handel i liknande roll inom försäljningsdriven marknadsföring, gärna med inriktning på Email, CRM, Marketing Automation eller kundlojalitet. Har du jobbat med ovan i en internationell organisation är det ett stort plus. Vi ser även att du har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom marknadsföring, e-handel, CRM eller liknande områden. Du talar och skriver flytande i svenska och engelska.



Gällande de tekniska kunskaperna och erfarenheterna ser vi gärna att du har:


* Erfarenhet av Marketing Automation plattformar som exempelvis Apsis, Voyado, Adobe Marketing Cloud, Salesforce, Microsoft Customer Insights, Segment etc.
* Erfarenhet av Google Analytics.
* Du har en god förståelse för kundsegmentering samt KPI:er som retention rate, churn rate, conversion rate etc.


Som person är du driven och innovativ har en stor passion för digital marknadsföring och Marketing Automation och allt som hör därtill. Du är social, självgående, kommunikativ och lösningsorienterad. Du är en lagspelare men är också van vid att planera och utföra dina uppgifter självständigt. Vidare är du analytiskt lagd och ser det som en självklarhet att fatta beslut utifrån data. Viktigast av allt är att du har ett kommersiellt tankesätt och en ambition att flytta vår verksamhet i en så positiv riktning som möjligt.



**Vi erbjuder**


En kreativ och utvecklande roll där du får påverka och se resultatet av ditt arbete  

* 

En plats i ett engagerat team som brinner för digital utveckling och kundupplevelser  
* 
* Möjlighet att arbeta i en framgångsrik organisation med stora ambitioner


Låter det som något för dig? Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


**Information**



Tjänsten är ett vikariat på heltid under ca ett års tid. Placering är på huvudkontoret i Halmstad. Önskad start är i början av maj -2025.

  



För frågor om tjänsten:



För frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef:
  

Viktor Sundberg, 0736 54 54 09, viktor.sundberg@ajprodukter.se

  



Frågor om processen:



Kontakta ansvarig rekryterare

  



Vi tar endast emot ansökningar digitalt via vårt rekryteringssystem.

  



Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Lead Architect
description:
Stockholm Hybrid
  
  

The world is changing in the way we consume products, from ownership to usership, and DigitalRoute is positioned in the centre of the transition. Because, when enterprises pivot to usage-based business models, they often make an unfortunate discovery. Their systems weren’t built to handle the massive data volumes and complexity that usage-based models generate. This causes them to leak revenue and respond too slowly to customer demand. DigitalRoute solves this by creating a real-time usage data layer for enterprises. Our products transform raw usage data into clear information for billing, in real time and at high scale.
  
  

About the Job
  
The Lead MZ/PE Architect will work in one of our two main product areas, where our classic offerings called Mediation Zone and Private Edition are created. All product development is done by our own teams in Stockholm, Gothenburg, Östersund and Kuala Lumpur.
  
  

The Lead MZ/PE Architect role will report directly to our global Head of Engineering.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

You will own and drive the software architecture work for both of these products, which have around 90% shared codebase.
  
You will lead and prioritize work through collaboration, coaching, and decision-making. And you’ll do some coding as well.
  
You will be working closely with PM/POs for these products, balancing business requirements and technical must-haves together.
  
  

You will also be involved in other things; anything from leading investigations and improving quality to coaching AI-assisted development or recommending changes to priorities.
  
  

The support around you
  
You will work right next to a lot of good help; software engineering teams, PMs/POs, Security Architect, Lead Architect for the other product, management, Support, Product Documentation, etc.
  
  

About you
  
  

You have extensive experience developing transaction-safe and high-performing enterprise software in Java, including leading architectural work. If your experience is related to advanced integration or mediation, that’s even better.
  
You are of course very skilled technically, but you are also communicative. You are comfortable leading meetings, explaining, discussing and collaborating,
  
and you can prioritize, take in feedback and make decisions.
  
You have a strong Java developer background, even if you may not be spending 100% of your time coding these days.
  
You are quite comfortable working with cloud technologies (AWS/GCP/Azure/OCI) as well as with Docker and Kubernetes – and with Kafka and various databases.
  
We often speak English in our offices, so your English needs to be good. If you also speak Swedish – great.
  
If not, you can learn that on the job.
  
  

About us
  
We produce some really cool things for very large and well-known customers. Many of them are already waiting for the results of the work YOU will do. Read more about the product and the company here: MediationZone- DigitalRoute and here: Usage Engine - Private Edition - DigitalRoute
  
  

In short? Well, we offer very advanced and high-performing automated mediation\* software for many of the world’s largest or most well-known companies. Examples? Well, how about Booking.com, Orange, Microsoft and many more?
  
  

* Advanced systems integration (kind of), but lots more and on steroids


We offer
  
Competitive salary with a good pension plan and insurances. Other nice benefits as well. Good coffee, fussball, and all that, yes.
  
+ free access to Udemy learning + we pay for AWS certifications.
  
  

Location
  
Stockholm (modern, comfy office). Hybrid work, yes.
  
  

We apply continuous selection, and the position may be filled before the last application date. Please note that we do not take applications via e-mail or LinkedIn.
  
  

DigitalRoute wants to be part of an inclusive and diverse environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or age. You will be part of a global and diverse company where our differences are our strengths.
  
  

Apply now! We look forward to you joining us!
  
  

We care
  
  

We team up
  
  

We are covered
  
  

We work our way
  
  

We invest in parenthood
  
  

We create our destiny
  
  

ABOUT THE COMPANY
  
  

DigitalRoute processes data about how customers use digital services. Our software is used by telecoms, streaming services, SaaS companies, and many others. Why does this data matter? Data about usage helps companies send accurate invoices, improve customer experiences, and control how much of a service is used. It even helps companies create entirely new services based on customer behavior. We help some of the world’s most iconic brands shift to subscription and usage-based services.
  
  

Everyone makes a differen
  
We believe in the individual. We are not just saying it but knowing that everyone makes a difference. Being a relatively small company with a flat organization, people here have room to influence, be visible and make a real difference. We want people to feel empowered to raise opinions, drive initiatives and take ownership.
  
  

Big-hearted across the wo
  
We have a soul of a small and big-hearted team working together across the globe. Here, it is as natural to work with someone hundreds of miles away as with someone sitting next to you. And we do it together as one team. We actively strive for an environment where everyone feels included and valued.
  
  

Dedicated to succeed.
  
We are a growth company with high ambitions, chosen by the most iconic brands in the world. With a true passion for our customers, we constantly go after new grounds to be at the forefront of what we do. We provide the possibilities to grow in a culture where flexibility, courage, and dedication to succeed take us to the next level.
  
  

Fares Fares

title: Solution Consultant
description:
**Company Description** **Our Mission**


At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:


Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.  

Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

**Who We Are**


We take our mission of protecting the digital way of life seriously. We are relentless in protecting our customers and we believe that the unique ideas of every member of our team contributes to our collective success. Our values were crowdsourced by employees and are brought to life through each of us everyday - from disruptive innovation and collaboration, to execution. From showing up for each other with integrity to creating an environment where we all feel included.


As a member of our team, you will be shaping the future of cybersecurity. We work fast, value ongoing learning, and we respect each employee as a unique individual. Knowing we all have different needs, our development and personal wellbeing programs are designed to give you choice in how you are supported. This includes our FLEXBenefits wellbeing spending account with over 1,000 eligible items selected by employees, our mental and financial health resources, and our personalized learning opportunities - just to name a few!

 **Job Description** **Your Career**


The Solutions Consultant is the evolution of the traditional Sales Engineering role, aligning how we best serve our customers in understanding their environment, providing solution guidance and ensuring value realization in their investment with Palo Alto Networks. As a Solutions Consultant you provide technical leadership and expertise and guidance in your customer’s security transformation journey. You will play a key role in defining technical solutions that secure a customer’s key business imperatives and ensuring value realization of their investment with Palo Alto Networks. You evangelize our industry leadership in on-prem, cloud, and security operations services that establish PANW as your customer’s cybersecurity partner of choice.

**Your Impact**


Curiosity is core to the Solutions Consultant role, and you see complex problems as opportunities to learn and deliver innovative solutions! You define your impact by:

* Meeting and exceeding sales quotas by building and implementing strategic, technical account plans that target cross-platform solutions.
* Your ability to position, demonstrate and create high level designs across the entire PANW portfolio based on customer business needs
* Conducting discovery to understand and articulate the key technical, operational, and commercial imperatives of your prospects and customers
* Working closely with Professional Services, Customer Success and Specialist teams to ensure overall customer implementation and adoption of solutions.
* Demonstrating strong communication skills and the ability to influence through effective presentations and customer-specific demos, technical engagements, and workshops
* Leading successful technical validation efforts based on best practices to ensure technical win in assigned opportunities.
* Orchestrating supporting resources (Specialists, Channel Resources, Customer Support) to ensure a one-team approach that demonstrates a cohesive strategy
* Promoting end-to-end solutions that include PANW and/or partner professional services to ensure customers realize business value sooner
* Understanding the competitive landscape and effectively differentiating our leadership
* Continuously investing in yourself to develop technical and professional skills that drive your ever-increasing contributions to success of our customers while actively participating within the Solutions Consultant community and at industry events
* (OT) - Identifying technical stakeholders and cultivating relationships with key personas to build and drive a security architecture transformation roadmap

 **Qualifications** **Your Experience**

* Based in Sweden and Fluent in Swedish and English.
* Understanding of data networking and/or modern application design and cloud architectures
* Delivering cybersecurity solutions that solve technical challenges and influence new business initiatives
* Influencing and gaining buy-in from key stakeholders, either in a customer-facing or internal role; prior experience in a pre-sales role is ideal
* Creating and delivering technical presentations, workshops, or technical validation engagements
* Experience in selling, designing, implementing, or managing one or more of the following solutions: Network Security, SASE, SaaS, CNAPP and/or SOC Transformation Technologies
* Partnering with Customer Support functions to ensure successful implementation and adoption of sold solutions
* Complex sales involving long sales processes with multiple buying centers and multi-product solutions are preferred

 **Additional Information** **The Team**


Our Solutions Consultant team members work hand-in-hand with large organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire,and empower our potential clients in their journey to transform their security architectures.


You are empowered with unmatched systems and tools and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. Our Solutions Consulting community is driven by the mission to be our customers’ cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting their digital way of life.

**Our Commitment**


We’re trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.


We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.


Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
