title: System engineer - Light Vehicle Area
description:
Applications are considered on a rolling basis Linköping Hybrid
  
  

We are now looking for a System engineer to join our Light Vehicle Area in Linköping, where we work with some of the world’s most leading hyper car brands. You will join a team with a number of highly skilled colleagues, all sharing the same goal – to deliver great quality to our customers, on time and with a strong commitment to innovation and reliability.
  
  

As a System engineer at ACTIA Nordic, you will act as a main interface between the team and the customers engineering department. Your job is to make sure the customer specific requirements are feasible and possible to align with our internal requirements and current legislations. A big part of the role is to communicate with both internal and external stakeholders.
  
  

At ACTIA Nordic, you will be able to work with the entire development chain: from conceptualization, to design, development and test (there is also a later step – production. We have our own factory on-site, allowing you to see your product take physical form.). As the core development of our connectivity platform is complete, our primary focus will be on developing new features for our Light Vehicle customers – but we are also tasked with looking into the development on the next generation of connectivity platforms.
  
  

Arvid Trygg
  
Software Development Engineer
  
"At ACTIA, you are never stuck alone with a problem. Everybody wants to help you succeed in your work. That is for me a huge advantage when it comes to developing the best solutions"
  
Kais Trabelsi
  
SW Line Manager
  
"Here, you have the opportunity to influence all decisions made. We are close to the management, you can express your opinions freely and it is a workplace culture with friendly, respectful colleagues."
  
Skills & Requirements
  
  

For this position, we are looking for someone who has the following background:
  
  

You have at least 5 years of relevant experience as a System engineer.
  
You have a relevant degree in engineering.
  
**You are familiar with several of the following techniques:** 5G, Bluetooth, CAN, FuSa, Embedded Systems and WiFi or LTE, UDS, DoIP, Cyber Security.
  
You are an avid problem solver. You are analytic, and eager to learn new things.
  
You are a team player, and are used to maintaining customer relations.
  
  

**The following skills are considered merits:**  

Experience working in the automotive industry.
  
Linux and SW development
  
  

Full-spectrum development. From SW to HW
  
  

In-house production. Full insight and control
  
  

Workplace flexibility. Hybrid work set-up
  
  

High-profile clients – global well-known brands
  
  

Company health care and health insurance
  
  

Flat organization. Collaborate and innovate freely
  
  

About the company
  
  

Welcome to the technology leader in connectivity
  
  

ACTIA Nordic AB (‘ACTIA’) is a technology leader in telematics. Our latest connectivity platform – the ACU6 - lets clients in the automotive, truck, asset management and supercar industries realize their opportunities both today and in the future.
  
  

When used in the automotive industry, our technology will allow the driver to pinpoint the position of the vehicle, to reduce vehicle speed if it is stolen, download and update new software over the air, lock/unlock the car remotely and much more. One of our key features is the E-Call.
  
  

If an accident occurs, the eCall information enables emergency services to locate the car and prepare for the accident before arriving at the scene - our technology saves lives.
  
  

Founded in 2004, ACTIA is a subsidiary of the French company ACTIA Group. In total, we are 3500 employees in 17 countries. In Sweden, we have 85 employees, divided at our two offices in Linköping and Stockholm. At our tech center in Linköping, we develop our products in cross functional teams, based on agile principles.
  
  

We work with global brands on a global market, and we attract employees by providing an innovative workplace where each individual is encouraged and expected to think outside the box. We are skilled at what we do and proud of our sought-after products. We have now embarked on a new journey, bringing our vision to life – we want to make the world green, safe and connected, for a viable and sustainable future.
  
  

Come join us!
  
  

Our Core Values
  
  

Care
  
The wellbeing of people and environment is important to us and we make long-term sustainable choices.
  
  

Courage
  
We empower each other and seek opportunities to develop both individuals and as a company.
  
  

Dedication
  
We take a genuine interest in our client’s business and strive for excellence together.
  
  

Trust
  
We create safe and efficient technology that both our customers and society can rely on.
  
  

Oscar Bentevik Holm | Contact Person

title: Senior Enterprise Account Manager
description:
**Humble, Honest, with Heart.****The Opportunity**
Nutanix is looking for an **Enterprise Sales Executive,** you will be a highly visible, key player within the Nutanix field sales team, tasked to drive net new business in large enterprise customers within Automotive, manufacturing, retail and telecommunications .
You are responsible for selling Nutanix’s Products and Solutions directly & indirectly to large enterprise customers and prospects. You will also be working closely with Presales Engineers and the extended account team.**About the Team**
At Nutanix, you will be joining the Swedish team. This team is known for its exceptional performance and in combination with a consistent class-leading employee-NPS score. The team strongly value collaboration across functions and hierarchies, making it a fun, dynamic and rewarding environment to be a part of. As part of your role, you will be expected to travel within Sweden to visit prospective and existing customers. This travel requirement provides you with the opportunity to engage directly with clients and build strong relationships, further enhancing the impact and reach of your work within the region.**Your Role*** As an **Enterprise Sales Executive,** you will be a highly visible, key player within the Nutanix field sales team, tasked to drive net new business in large multinational organisations.
* You will work in close partnership with an experienced technical Pre-sales engineer
* Forge new and cultivate existing Partner relationships (Resellers, Global Systems Integrators and Alliances) to align go-to-market strategies at the account level.
* Work collaboratively across Nutanix cross-functional teams such as Channel Sales, Marketing, Sales Operations, and Product Management to ensure the best possible coverage for your accounts.
* Drive accurate and timely sales forecasting through SFDC
* Develop account plans for Tier 1 Accounts
* Build and strengthen the business relationship with current accounts and new prospects by promoting Nutanix’s impact across other large organisations.
* Recommend Enterprise marketing strategies

**What You Will Bring*** >7 years of outside software sales experience
* A track record of exceeding sales quotas in multiple, continuous years.
* Keen ability to develop new accounts and penetrate new divisions and organizations within your assigned accounts.
* Expertise in selling technology solutions to the Swedish Enterprise sector , having an existing network of relevant customer stakeholders within this sector which you will utilize.
* An aptitude to articulate how Nutanix technology solves business problems, acting as a trusted advisor to the most demanding enterprise sector organisations in Sweden
* Deep understanding of the competitive landscape and how Nutanix differentiates
* Deep understanding of the customers and partner ecosystem in the region
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, including presentation skills for large audiences
* An entrepreneurial spirit with an affinity for growth, collaboration, and teamwork.
* Highly organized, with deep knowledge of account planning and strategy.
* An expert in Target Account Selling and consultative solution selling
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience



This position is primarily remote. There is no specific in-office requirement, however, there may be circumstances where you may be required to come into a local office for a specific purpose, and/or to travel to other locations based on business needs.
company_addresses:
1740 Technology Drive, Suite 150
San Jose, CA 95110 United States
company_description: Nutanix offers a single platform to run all your apps and data across clouds while simplifying operations and freeing companies to focus on business outcomes.

title: Documentation Specialist
description:
Telescope Services har som konsultbolag sedan början av 2000-talet anställt och flyttat ingenjörer och specialister från hela världen till Sverige. Idag har vi circa 150 stycken utländska ingenjörer på konsultuppdrag hos flertalet av våra olika klienter. Vårt huvudkontor är placerat i Lund, men vi har rekryteringskontor i över 10 olika länder.
  
Job description
  
We are looking for a technical writer and coordinator of documentation to join our software development organization.
  
Required skills & experience
  
* Proven experience in validation requirements of computerized systems in a regulated environment
* Experience in working within software development projects
* Experience working in a global organization as well as coordinating global, geographically dispersed project teams and stakeholders
* Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
* Expert knowledge of MS Word
* Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset


Please send Your CV to jobs@telescopeservices.se.

title: Lead Engineer Requirement Handling - InfiMotion Technology
description:
"Infinite motion for the future" InfiMotion Technology is a leading developer, manufacturer, and distributor of high-performance electric drive units for fully electric vehicles. We cover the entire value chain, from production software to individual components. Since our inception, we've experienced rapid growth and have consistently delivered outstanding results in technological innovation. InfiMotion Technology has enhanced the influence of the industry and enlightened new ideas for the future development of the electric drive field.
  
The headquarters is situated in Wuxi, China and in June 2022, we launched our Swedish office with the goal of establishing local manufacturing. Our R&D site is structured with interconnected departments, ensuring quick and easy communication for maximum efficiency. The InfiMotion team has been responsible for over millions sold units to date, including the European market.
  
Our Gothenburg office is now expanding and looking for a Lead Engineer Requirement Handling. Trust and effective communication shape the cornerstone of our culture. Here, you're not just joining a team; you're adding value. If you're seeking to be part of a flexible and dynamic team, we invite you to submit your application today!
  
  

Responsibilities Join us as a Lead Engineer Requirement Handling where you'll play a crucial role in our dynamic team. In this role, you'll be a key person in developing cutting-edge electric drive units collaborating closely with our global InfiMotion team, customers and suppliers. You are expected to ensure fulfilment of our product development goals and their alignment with project goals. This includes documenting, reviewing, and prioritizing requirements to guide the engineering team regarding current and approved requirements. Tasks will include:
  
Investigating project needs and documenting technical requirements
  
Researching, developing, and communicating requirements for projects
  
Ensuring that the project is meeting customer’s needs
  
Driving on-point communication to ensure everyone understands the requirements
  
Conducting routine investigations to make sure that requirements are met
  
Having the required technical- and project management skills to stay on top of the job
  
Work collaboratively within cross-functional teams, supporting both software and hardware development for electric drive units
  
Engage in customer and supplier meetings, providing technical expertise and otherinsights while understanding the business impact
  
Collaborate closely with colleagues in China and interact with our European customers.
  
  

We are looking for Someone with a minimum of 5 years experience in product development and requirements handling, with a preference for automotive experience. We believe that you have a MSc within mechanical or electrical engineering, engineering physics or similar.
  
To succeed in the role you have documented expertise in requirements handling systems e.g. DOORS, Codebeamer, Systemweaver etc.
  
As a person you are excellent with details and a real problem solver. In parallel you are a great relationship builder that listens in an build trust and can naturally take on a leadership role when needed. We take it for granted that you are self-motivated enough to take ownership and drive your area with proactiveness and successful completion.
  
Collaboration is key for us so you are a true team player with strong communication skills. You are fluent in English and if you have a knowledge of Mandarin Chinese, Swedish or German it is a plus. To thrive in this role you are structured enough to manage multiple tasks and at the same time enjoy the fast moving pace and changes that comes with joining a growth company!
  
  

We offer you An opportunity to be an integral part of business development and growth, then you've come to the right place. Here, you'll embark on an exciting journey within one of the automotive industry's most progressive and hottest topics. From conceptualization and development to production and sales, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the entire lifecycle of our products.
  
Our company embraces diversity and celebrates multiculturalism, fostering an environment where everyone's perspectives are valued and respected.
  
Moreover, teamwork is at the heart of everything we do. As a small company within a larger context, we work closely as a team. We collaborate closely on projects and supports one another's growth and development. Whether it's participating in regular social events like after-work gatherings, group workouts, breakfasts and coffee breaks together, you'll find that camaraderie and collaboration are central to our workplace culture.
  
Does this sound like you? Then you are welcome to join our team
  
Our Office; The InfiMotion office is conveniently located within the Uni3 campus at Pumpgatan 1, on Lindholmen in Gothenburg. The office is easily accessible by car, bus, or the newly introduced ferry service.
  
For those driving, there are parking facilities available around Lindholmen. Please note that ongoing extensive roadworks are in progress to enhance future tram connections which may cause delays and inconvenience.
  
If you prefer public transport, simply get off at Pumpgatan or Regnbågsgatan when taking the bus. Alternatively, for ferry commuters, you'll get off at the Lundbystrand ferry terminal.
  
  

Hiring process
  
If you're ready to join a dynamic team where you can make a meaningful impact while enjoying a supportive and inclusive culture, then we invite you to be part of our exciting journey forward. The application process is currently underway, and the final deadline for submissions is 26th of May. We will review the applications continuously, so dont wait -apply now!
  
Please note that in accordance with GDPR regulations, we can only accept applications through our system.

title: PhD student in Computer Science
description:
Employment information
  
**Employment:** Temporary employment
  
**Scope:** Full time
  
**Number of positions:** 1
  
**Closing date for application:** 2nd of April 2025
  
**Campus location:** Västerås
  
**School:** School of Innovation, Design and Engineering, (IDT)
  
  

Eligibility
  
Access to third-cycle courses and study programmes at a higher education education as well as basic eligibility requirements and assessment criteria, are regulated in the Higher Education Ordinance chapter 7 §§ 34–41(SFS 1993:100). More information about third-cycle studies at MDU
  
  

A full-time employment as a doctoral student is attached to this third-cycle studies which corresponds to four years
  
  

Position description
  
The PhD position is expected to join an EU-ITEA funded project MONA LISA, with several industrial partners from Sweden. Based on the needs of our industrial partner, the work will investigate the application of large language models (LLMs). This includes investigating the associated setup of a knowledge base and other optimizations, in an industrial setting. The aim is to easily retrieve and access relevant information/documentation and to provide useful decision-support. This means having a LLM based solution that can offer support to an engineer looking for relevant information, such as analysis of repair reports to offer efficient repair resolution strategies. An LLM-based approach can help find patterns, visualize them for early issue resolution.
  
  

**The PhD student will undertake the following major tasks:**  

* Analyze industrial needs to set up a customized LLM-based solution.
* Investigate mechanisms to improve the setup and efficiency of such a solution.
* Conduct thorough scientific evaluations (through e.g. experiments and case studies) of the pros and cons of the solution.


The PhD student is expected to have 20% of the time teaching and 80% on research. However, in initial years, research can get extended up to 100%.
  
  

Qualifications
  
  

**For basic eligibility, the following is required:**  

* A degree at an advanced level.
* At least 240 higher education credits, of which at least 60 are at an advanced level.
* Equivalent knowledge acquired in Sweden or abroad through other means.


For eligibility to be admitted to doctoral education in computer science, the specific eligibility requirements state that the doctoral student must hold a master's degree (240 higher education credits) in computer science, software engineering, systems engineering or equivalent.
  
  

Assessment criteria
  
Prior to employment, consideration must be given to the ability to assimilate third-cycle courses and study programmes at a higher education. In addition to these skills, particular attention will be paid to the following knowledge and experience:
  
* Knowledge of or experience in software industry.
* Experience in working with industrial applications.
* Experience of collaboration with individuals in various roles and environments, particularly with industry partners in industrial settings.
* Strong background in Computer Science
* Good knowledge of machine learning, artificial intelligence and generative AI
* Strong programming skills (e.g. Python, C/C++, etc)
* Proficient written and oral communication in English


In an overall assessment of suitability, emphasis is also placed on personal abilities. All employees at MDU are expected to cooperate and treat colleagues and students with respect, take responsibility for the organisation and their own work duties and contribute to a positive work environment. Great emphasis will be placed on the assessment of the following personal qualities and abilities:
  
  

* Ability to independently drive, plan, and conduct doctoral studies both individually and in collaboration with others, both within and outside academia.
* Ability to communicate and collaborate with others both within academia and industry.
* Ability to identify industrial needs and transfer research results to demonstrators, industrial applications, and for use in education.


We value the qualities that an even distribution of age and gender, as well as ethnic and cultural diversity, can contribute to the organization.
  
  

Application
  
Application is made online. Make your application by clicking the "Apply" button below.
  
  

The applicant is responsible for ensuring that the application is complete in accordance with the advertisement and will reach the University no later than closing date for application.
  
  

We look forward to receiving your application.
  
  

**Union representatives:**  

Saco-S saco-s@mdu.se
  
**Susanne Meijer ST-OFR/S, tel:** 021-10 14 89
  
  

We decline all contact with recruiters and salespersons of advertisements. We have made our strategic choices for this recruitment.

title: Partner Integration Engineer in Play & Control
description:
**The Team**


Play & Control handles the music playback on all of our platforms. We have apps for mobile and desktop, our own hardware player and partner integrations through our SDK. We are building an API for custom integrations which we already use ourselves to deliver a custom web radio station where the customer can control the music.


We manage the clients playing music and the servers providing them with instructions and remote control functionality.  

  



**The Role**


We are searching for a skilled Embedded Engineer to join our team and play a crucial role in expanding the reach of our music streaming services. You will be working together with the team to facilitate integrations with new partners. This involves:

* Understanding the partner’s technical requirements and providing guidance on SDK integration best practices.
* Adjusting our offering to improve integration flows and features.
* Developing and maintaining comprehensive technical documentation, including integration guides and sample code.
* Working closely with internal teams to provide feedback and identify areas for improvement in our platforms.
* Staying up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in the audio technology space.

 **About You**


We are looking for someone who is passionate about technology, thrives in a fast-paced environment, and enjoys working with external partners. You should be a strong communicator, a creative problem-solver, and a team player.

**Mandatory Requirements**

* Solid understanding of software development principles and experience with C++
* Experience with embedded systems development
* Experience with SDK integrations or API integrations
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills

**Beneficial Skills**

* Experience with audio technologies and streaming protocols such as Dante and AES67
* Familiarity with various operating systems
* Knowledge of networking concepts and protocols
* Experience with programming languages such as C, Rust, Scala, Kotlin, Java, Objective C, Swift, Go, or others.

  

**About us**

  

Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.  

  

**Employee benefits**

* + You have the freedom to decide where you work the best with our Work From Anywhere program with a one-off setup bonus included
	+ Generous pension plan
	+ Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
	+ Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription.
	+ Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
	+ Daily breakfast served at the office

If you have any questions about the position or need to reach out, get in touch with Oskar Thorin at oskar@soundtrack.io. Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by email.

title: Integration Platform Specialist
description:
*At Benifex, we have created a world-class integration platform! The capabilities of the platform include API gateways, messaging, and a low-code integration tool! And, of course, logging and monitoring tools. In the integration platform we are using open-source products to a very large extent.*

As an Integration Platform Specialist, you will work with a variety of interesting and leading-edge integration components, tools, and setups within our Integration Platforms team. Your workdays will be filled with various, fast-paced, and stimulating tasks in a dynamic and diverse work environment together with motivated people. You will work with internal and external parties and support our customers with new/updated functionality and solve existing challenges in our integration landscape. You will be supporting our development teams with integration expertise.


In your daily work, you will support agile teams and cross-functionally with other teams spread across multiple geographic locations to deliver the right data flow and flexible solutions for our clients, and you will monitor and improve our technical setup. You will work within the Integration Platform team and work closely with the head of Integration Platforms.


All team members participate in day-to-day standups comprising among other things operations monitoring which is a key part in order to understand the platform and its behaviour. You will have a shared responsibility to further develop and maintain our integration landscape.


**You will also:**


* Support development teams and our customer integration teams in messaging and low-code development, most often as an expert, a sounding board and/or reviewer
* Further develop the capabilities of our low code integration platform
* Participate in overseeing operations and support our internal teams with operational information
* Participate in day-to-day operations of the integration platform, including patches, admin and more
* Participate in managing CI/CD toolchains
* Update info on our Developer Portal
* Educate developers in our tools

**Personal attributes**


We are seeking someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and takes ownership of their work. You should have a genuine passion for **problem-solving**, **taking initiative**, and being proactive, **detail-oriented**, and committed to continuously improving processes and tools. A **collaborative** mindset and strong communication skills are essential, as you will be working with diverse teams across multiple geographies.


You should definitely bring this with you:


* Software engineer degree, preferably BSc in computer science or equal
* Programming experience, preferably in JavaScript/TypeScript and Python. Experience in Java and/or LUA is a plus
* Experience in using low-code tools
* Professional proficiency in English, both written and spoken. Any additional languages are welcomed in our global company

It's a , thus not a requirement if you also got...* IdP (Identity provider) tools/systems experience
* Kubernetes experience
* REST API design experience

**Benefits**

* 30 days holiday
* Company pension scheme
* Guaranteed work-life balance with a hybrid working model
* Various team events and activities in the offices
* You are responsible for your own development, and we offer internal career opportunities
* 

**Practical information**

**Start:** As soon as we find the right match!
  

**Extent:** Full-time, 100%  

**Location:** Stockholm and Gothenburg, Sweden.

  

Apply by submitting your CV and/or your LinkedIn profile using the application form below. We screen applications continuously and may hire someone before the last application date.

*Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments for interviews by replying to the email you will receive after you apply.*

title: Trainee Program at Westermo
description:
*Are you an aspiring engineer with a passion for leadership? Join Westermo's Global Graduate Trainee Program!*

**Are you our next Graduate Trainee?**


Westermo, a Swedish growing mid-sized global company, is looking for four enthusiastic trainees to join us in September 2025. If you have a keen interest in both technology and people, and are curious about a future leadership role, this is your chance to get a flying start!

**About the Program:**


Our trainee program lasts about a year and includes both on-the-job training and various development activities. While most activities are planned, you and your fellow trainees will also have the opportunity to suggest and organize activities that interest you. From day one, you will start in a permanent position, but during the program, you will rotate through different roles to enhance your skills and experiences. You will be supported by a manager and a dedicated mentor throughout the program. Two of the roles are based in Västerås and two in Stora Sundby. Additionally, the program includes participants from other countries, making it a truly global experience with both in-person and online interactions.

**Available Positions:**



* **Software Developer (Västerås):** Join our software team as a passionate developer! We seek a team player who thrives on diving deep into complex technical contexts while understanding the bigger picture. A degree in software engineering, IT, engineering physics, robotics, or a related field is ideal. Knowledge in embedded systems, networks, Linux environments, and C-programming is a plus.


* **Software Test Developer (Västerås):** If you believe testing is key to quality and enjoy a holistic approach to development, this role is for you. We seek a team player and technical explorer who enjoys problem-solving with colleagues. A degree in software engineering, IT, engineering physics, robotics, or a related field is ideal. Knowledge in embedded systems, networks, Linux environments, and C-programming is a plus.


* **Production Engineer (Stora Sundby, Eskilstuna):** Dive into the exciting world of Surface Mount Technology (SMT) with us! As a Production Engineer, you'll work with advanced Fuji machines to program, analyze, and optimize surface mounting. A degree in production engineering, mechanical engineering, or a related field is ideal.


* **Production Test Engineer (Stora Sundby, Eskilstuna):** Join our Test Engineering team to program in LabVIEW, troubleshoot, and solve problems in electronic components. This role combines programming with hands-on factory work. Experience with Python, Linux environments, and Bash scripting is a plus. A degree in electrical engineering, engineering physics, or a related field is ideal.


**Program Highlights:**

* Start in one of the roles above and rotate through different positions and training opportunities.
* Gain valuable skills and experience to prepare for future challenges.
* Work in a supportive environment with a manager and mentor.
* Participate in a global program with colleagues from around the world.

**Requirements:**

* B.Sc. or M.Sc. in a relevant field for the position you apply to.
* No more than 2 years of relevant work experience since graduating.
* Alignment with our values: Teamwork & Trust, Integrity & Ownership, Innovation & Learning, and Customer Focus & Quality.
* Excellent communication skills in English and Swedish, both written and spoken.

**What We Offer:**

* A great start to your career with personal and professional development.
* An open and friendly work environment with mature and caring leadership.
* Attractive benefits and a focus on a healthy, fun workplace with regular company and team activities.

**Basic Information:**

* **Location:** Västerås or Stora Sundby
* **Job Type:** Full-time
* **Employment Contract:** Permanent
* **Starting Date:** September 1st, 2025
* **Application Deadline:** March 23rd, 2025


Don’t miss out on this opportunity – apply today! We look forward to meeting you!
company_addresses: Westermo Network Technologies, Metallverksgatan 6, SE-721 30 Västerås, Sweden
company_description: We are a leading supplier of robust, reliable and easy-to-use Industrial Data Communications equipment to the global market, devoted to delivering the world's best industrial networks.

title: System Design Engineer
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

 **Join Us in Revolutionizing the Future of Transportation!**  

At AMT, we are on a mission to innovate and drive sustainability in the transport industry. If you're ready to be part of a transformative journey, we invite you to join our team and work with next-generation technologies that will shape a better tomorrow.  

  

**About the Role**  

As a System Design Engineer at AMT, you will be at the forefront of redefining how we design, develop, and deploy tools for our internal teams and end users. Your leadership in cross-functional initiatives will be crucial as you translate complex needs into actionable deliverables, contributing to the broader transformation of the transport sector.  

  

**Key Responsibilities**  

* **Collaborate** with cross-functional teams to drive the development of innovative tools and processes.
* **Investigate** user needs, define project requirements, and establish clear roadmaps for successful execution.
* **Translate** roadmaps into actionable deliverables, overseeing their implementation from start to finish.
* **Advocate** for your team’s needs within larger organizational initiatives, ensuring alignment and support.

  

**Your Future Team**  

Join a dynamic, global team of talented engineers who thrive on collaboration, continuous improvement, and knowledge sharing. We believe in hands-on learning, and you will have the unique opportunity to work directly with our trucks in the workshop, gaining invaluable experience.  

  

**Who Are You?**  

We are looking for a passionate, forward-thinking engineer who dreams big and takes action. To excel in this role, you should possess:  

* A Master’s degree in Mechanical, Mechatronic, Electrical Engineering, IT, Industrial Engineering or education and experience that we consider equivalent.
* Fluency in English with strong communication skills.
* Proficiency in 3D CAD visualization software (e.g., Creo View or similar) and Product Data Management systems.
* A solid understanding of the aftermarket business.
* A curious mindset and a desire to challenge the status quo.


It´s a merit if you have interest or knowledge in data analysis and artificial intelligence.  

  

**Why Join AMT?**  

At AMT, you will be part of a global movement driving innovation and sustainability in the transport industry. With access to cutting-edge technologies and a collaborative work environment, you will have the opportunity to make a lasting impact on a global scale.  

  

**Ready to Shape the Future of Sustainable Transport?**  

If you're excited to join us in building a better tomorrow, apply no later than the **2nd of March** and let’s create the future together!
Please contact juliana.pintarelli@volvo.com if you have any questions concerning this opportunity.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Recent Graduated Engineers - Your future challenge starts here!
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Ready to find your path? Try new things. Share experiences. And discover what you truly enjoy.*
 Saab is growing across the country and is constantly looking for new talent! If you are at the end of your studies or at the beginning of your career and want to continue developing while working to keep people and society safe, you are warmly welcome to apply to us.
   

  

**Your role**
 With us, learning is everywhere. A place where each day is a chance to discover something new, share what you know and learn from others. Here, you´ll get inspired by a bunch of smart and experienced people. Ready to dive in? You can explore different areas, find a new passion, and figure out your own path. Plus, we got plenty of courses and training to help you level up your skills. Grow with us, every step of the way.
   

  

 Saab offers diverse roles and continuous learning opportunities within IT, software development, systems engineering, electronics and mechanical engineering, just to mention a few. Start your journey as an engineer with us and play a key role in developing cutting-edge defense and security systems.
   

  

 There are several ways to work at Saab as a recent graduate, in a team as a junior engineer or through different introductory and trainee programs.
   

  

**Your profile**
 To be a successful employee at Saab, we want you to be a curious person who thrives in a supportive and friendly workplace where teamwork is the core to find smart solutions. You should be in the final stages of your post-secondary studies or a recent graduate.
   

  

 We believe that you have a Bachelor´s or Master´s degree within one of the following fields:
   

  

* Information Technology/System Science
* Computer Science
* Engineering Physics
* Electrical Engineering
* Mechatronics
* Mechanical Engineering


 Whether you’re passionate about creating secure and robust systems, developing innovative electrical or mechanical solutions, or engage in complex problem solving, we offer varied roles to match your skills and interest.
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

**What You Will Be Part Of**
 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

 Does this sound like something you want to hear more about? Submit your application today!
   

  

 If you are interested in introductory and trainee programs, write a note about it in the application questionnaire. Selection and interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
Have you been coding for a few years and now want to use your superpowers to change how people manage their finances? Do you thrive in a modern tech environment where you can experiment, build, and create solutions that make a real impact? If so, it might be time to join
 **Lendo** 
 !🚀
   

  

**The team**
 You’ll become part of an open-minded, agile, and cross-functional team that loves to solve problems and innovate! At Lendo, everyone can have an impact. Our tech teams work closely with the business, directly contributing to continuously improving the tech and our product offerings. Through our products, we want to empower people to make smarter and more conscious financial decisions.
   

  

**A Look At What You Would Do**
* Use modern tech such as Kubernetes, Docker, PostgreSQL, GCP, CI/CD…
* Build, design, and optimise Go microservices
* Continuously create exciting new products and features, collaborating closely with colleagues
* Write tests at different levels to ensure quality and that your code really does what you want

* You’ll experiment, test, try, fail and learn all the time

title: Software Engineer - Roku (Brightscript)
description:
**Description**
**About the Team**
 We are passionate about technology and building fantastic software products. We are experts and leaders in the realm of video streaming. It’s no coincidence that some of our customers are giants like Netflix, Spotify, BBC, HBO and Deutsche Telekom, just to name a few. Our mission is to innovate continuously and to disrupt the industry by creating a scalable platform for building impactful video applications. Accedo One , our award-winning produc t is a testament to Accedo’s expertise and leadership worldwide.
   

  

 To continue to excel, we are growing our team with multiple openings! We’re looking for a Roku Engineer to join our team in Stockholm. (Did we say we have offices all over the world, including Stockholm, Budapest, London, New York, Toronto, Sydney, and Hong Kong, amongst others?). At Accedo you will be part of a diverse and multi-disciplined development team, gaining exposure to cutting edge technologies.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Competitive salary and benefits
* Premium pension plan
* Company life, health and injury insurance
* Yearly health allowance
* Yearly training budget - which can be spent on IT conferences or online trainings
* Nice, spacious downtown office in the hip neighborhood of Södermalm
* Flexible home office options.
* Opportunity to participate in Hackathons and a range of company events


**What You Will Do**
 Primarily software development of Roku/Brightscript applications. You will work on delivering the Roku application of our state-of-the art products.
   

  

* You will play a key role in designing, building and maintaining large-scale, high availability front-end applications and owning the related platform infrastructure (e.g AWS services, build pipelines, automated testing, etc).
* You will also be responsible for promoting a sound engineering culture through hands-on development, code reviews, contributing to the improvement of the application architecture and enhancing engineering processes
* This is the team you want to join! We care about software craftsmanship, constantly improving our work and ourselves while having fun doing it!


**Requirements**
**What We Are Looking For**
* Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or related discipline
* 3 - 5 years professional experience developing software applications
* Experience with Brightscript/Roku’s SceneGraph XML
* Experience integrating open source or 3rd party API’s and Libraries highly desirable
* Excellent problem solving skills and love for technical challenges
* Experience in Video and media based development projects (DRM, OVPs, Advertising, Analytics)
* Good command of English

title: QA Engineer
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
   

  

 As a
 *QA Engineer* 
 , you will play a vital role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our hardware and software products, collaborating across teams to deliver solutions that empower individuals with disabilities to connect with the world.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Provide third-tier product support with deep product knowledge for internal teams, partners, and customers.
* Track, manage, and resolve hardware and software product issues, driving continuous quality improvement.
* Conduct hardware and software deployment testing, including company and third-party software integrations.
* Develop, refine, and maintain QA test plans to uphold the highest product standards.
* Collaborate with Projects and Application Development teams to replicate customer issues and use cases.
* Implement and document best practices to meet design requirements and deliver high-quality solutions on schedule.
* Balance independent tasks with team coordination, fostering collaboration across departments.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
* 3+ years of experience as a Quality Assurance Engineer or in a related role.
* Proficiency in QA tools like TestRail and platforms such as iOS, Windows, Android, and web applications.
* Experience with Azure, AWS, Git, TeamCity, GitHub, and Jira.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills for collaboration across teams.
* A strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and understanding of QA methodologies.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: AI Training Specialist
description:
**Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?**
**We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.**
**About The Opportunity**
* Outlier is looking for talented coders to help train generative artificial intelligence models
* This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


**You may contribute your expertise by…**
* Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
* Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


**Examples Of Desirable Expertise**
* Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
* Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
* Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in Swedish
* Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


**Payment**
* Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
* Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.

title: Systemutvecklare Java
description:
Om rollen
   

  

**Vill du utvecklas i en miljö där innovation, gemenskap och samhällsnytta står i fokus?**
 Hos Sopra Steria får du arbeta med digitala lösningar som gör verklig skillnad – tillsammans med engagerade kollegor i ett företag som har prisats som
 *Sveriges bästa arbetsplats* 
 av Great Place to Work. Vi söker nu fler
 **Javautvecklare** 
 till våra agila team i Östersund!
   

  

 Som Javautvecklare hos oss blir du en viktig del av våra agila teamleveranser. Du arbetar nära både kollegor och kunder för att utveckla lösningar som kombinerar teknisk innovation med samhällsnytta. Våra projekt är ofta långsiktiga och inkluderar tekniklyft för kunder, främst inom offentlig sektor.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du att arbeta med modern teknik som
 **Java** 
 ,
 **Spring Boot** 
 ,
 **Kubernetes** 
 samt frontendramverk som
 **Angular** 
 ,
 **React** 
 eller
 **Vue** 
 . Vi värdesätter kunskapsdelning högt och har en stark gemenskap där du blir en aktiv del av vårt utvecklarcommunity. Läs mer här!
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av Java-utveckling.
* Är nyfiken på nya tekniker och drivs av att dela kunskap med andra.
* Trivs med att samarbeta nära kunder och kollegor.
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.


**Vad gör vårt Östersundskontor unikt?**
 Vårt kontor i Östersund är verkligen en plats för gemenskap och äventyr. Här är sällan en AW bara en AW – det kan lika gärna vara en topptur tillsammans med kollegorna. Hos oss har du möjlighet att leva med närhet till naturen varje dag, men samtidigt jobba med globala kunder. Vi har en stark sammanhållning och gemenskap och hittar på många roliga aktiviteter tillsammans. Idag är vi 25 konsulter och satsar för fullt mot nästa mål om att bli 50 kollegor på Östersundskontoret.
   

  

 På Sopra Steria erbjuder vi en arbetsplats som förenar trygghet och flexibilitet, med en prisbelönt företagskultur som sätter gemenskap och personlig utveckling i fokus. Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta i spännande projekt som verkligen gör skillnad i samhället, samtidigt som du blir en del av ett starkt team där du utvecklas tillsammans med kompetenta och hjälpsamma kollegor.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Låter detta som något för dig? Skicka in ditt CV redan idag via vår hemsida! Om du har frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att kontakta ansvarig rekryterare
 **Hanna Korell** 
 på
 **[email protected]** 
 .
   

  

 Vi arbetar med löpande urval, så vänta inte med din ansökan. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Ytterligare information
   

  

 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Development Engineer Test and Simulation
description:
**Join Our team at Scania: Development engineer at Geometry assurance team**
 Are you a skilled Engineer looking to make a difference in a dynamic and inclusive work environment? At Scania, we are now looking for a Development engineer to play a central role in assure and maintain the geometry of the Traton modular system during the entire development process. We give the best guidance and support design to develop component series with well-balanced performance steps to be able to offer tailor-made solutions to our customers to fulfill their needs. Together we keep the Traton modular system as open as possible, for a complete and optimized modularization. Develop, design and make improvement proposals.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 As a Geometry Assurer you will assure and maintain the geometry of the Traton modular system during the entire development process. This involves making sure that designs can be built and feedback any issues that hinder this process. The role includes analyzing models and structure created by design by using tools from Catia and inhouse programs. The aim is to identify any unintentional errors and support the design team by creating and maintaining complex environments, making it easier for designers to get it right from the start.
   

  

 The role operates at a complete vehicle level, including chassis, cab, and bus projects. This role requires a strong understanding of the modular toolbox and the ability to work across various component levels, ensuring that what is designed can be built and any hindrances are reported and made visible. The Geometry Assurer plays a crucial role in maintaining the integrity of the design and ensuring that the final product meets the required specifications.
   

  

**Profile Requirements**
* Engineer with a Bachelor's or Master's degree, or equivalent knowledge acquired through work experience in the relevant area.
* Experience in lean-agile mindset and work according to agile procedures
* Experience in 3D tools like for eg Catia, MS Office
* Proficient in English (spoken and written).
* 2 years product development experience is preferred.
* Familiarity with Scania's product description systems (TS/KS/TCR/VCR) is preferred.
* Merit if you have knowledge of AI (Artificial Intelligence) technologies and automation tools such as Power Platform application


 We believe that you are a positive and proactive person who takes initiative without letting prestige get in the way. You have an analytical mindset and you enjoy working in a big network of cross-functional teams. You communicate effectively, which is important for working with multiple development teams and departments
   

  

**Our Team**
 Join a diverse and inclusive team at Scania. We believe in the power of diverse perspectives to drive innovation. Our team embodies a strong sense of team spirit and is guided by core values of integrity, collaboration, and continuous improvement. Our group consists of 11 co-workers and together with them you will work in a learning and evolving environment where we as a team take on this challenge and help each other to succeed.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes. Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-03-05. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role. If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Åsa Ottergren, Manager, asa.ottergren@scania.com
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Radio Algorithm Developer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 At Ericsson, we are seeking for a passionate and forward-thinking senior Algorithm Developer to join our team to contribute to Ericsson radio downlink and uplink algorithm design.
   

  

 As a key player in Ericsson PEU Radio, you’ll contribute to the cutting-edge signal processing algorithms in different wireless standardization technologies. Your role will also encompass addressing the hardware characteristics and impairments that are pivotal to the evolution of the radio products.
   

  

 Mathematics, data analytics, digital design, understanding of air interface performance are some of the competencies in our team required to deliver world-class algorithms. Curiosity and interest in these different aspects with strength in one or more of the areas are crucial for you to excel in our team.
   

  

 We are looking for senior radio algorithm developers that will be part of our global team present in Europe, Asia and North America. At Ericsson, we offer a collaborative environment where you can grow, innovate, and make an impact. If you’re ready to take your career to the next level and contribute to groundbreaking projects, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

**What you will do:**
 In your role, you will work with a team to explore, design, simulate and implement the newest radio algorithms used in Ericsson radio products. Key responsibilities of the work are:
   

  

* Radio downlink and uplink algorithm systemization for new 3GPP standard and radio product requirement
* Explore, develop, simulate, optimize and implement the radio downlink and uplink signal processing algorithm
* Develop and implement radio uplink impairment handing algorithm, e.g. AGC, in cooperation with other teams
* Collaborate with ASIC and radio design team to implement the algorithm in the Ericsson ASIC and radio product
* Drive radio energy efficiency using innovative radio algorithms
* Leverage AI and other innovative way to improve radio algorithm design methodology
* Participate in 6G standardization and systemization
* Simulator programming and documentation for the algorithms designed


**The skills you bring:**
* MSc or PhD. in Wireless Communication, Signal Processing, Microwave, Mathematics or related majors
* Proficiency in the field of signal processing, telecommunication systems and radio technology
* Good communication skills in English
* Experience with Matlab/Simulink
* Innovative, adaptable, and collaborative


**Additional qualifications:**
* PhD in areas of signal processing
* Acquainted with wireless standards such as LTE, NR etc.
* Knowledge of C/C++/Python
* Experience with radio algorithm design
* Experience in areas of: RF System Design, ASIC/FPGA Design.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 762681
   

  

 ]]>

title: Javautvecklare IAM
description:
Välkommen till Svenska Spel, vi är techbolaget inom spelbranschen med hög teknisk ambition och tydlig målbild om var vi ska vara inom tre till fyra år. Moln- och IAM-transformationen är ett prioriterat initiativ där vi nu bygger nya förmågor.
   

  

 Nu behöver vi fler stjärnor som vill vara med och bidra! Vi söker dig som är en senior Javautvecklare och som kan ta vår IAM- och datasäkerhet till nya (moln)höjder! Och du - det spelar ingen roll var någonstans i Sverige du bor, hos oss gör vi jobbet där det passar bäst! ⭐
   

  

**Vad kommer du att göra?**
 Hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i arbetet med att utveckla Svenska Spels identitets- och behörighetshantering och etablera ändamålsenliga IAM-lösningar baserat på våra identifierade behov. Du kommer in med mångårig erfarenhet som utvecklare och med teknisk kompetens inom IAM-området. Med den kunskapen kan du identifiera och rekommendera passande lösningar som med tillitsramverk möter krav och mäter kvalitet på identitets- och behörighetsstyrning.
   

  

 Du blir vår expert av lösningar för kollegor i utvecklingsteamen men du kommer inte att vara ensam på jobbet. Du blir en del av ett team med nära kollegor i samma område och tillsammans i era expertisområden ansvarar ni för att hantera identitets- och behörighetshantering för kunder och partners i Svenska Spels spelekosystem och dess tjänster. Tjänster som kommunicerar med varandra i ett microservices ekosystem och administrerar åtkomster.
   

  

 Du och teamet bidrar även till att integrera nya alternativa autentiseringsmetoder samt konsumera befintliga med hjälp av moderna tekniska protokoll. Det handlar om att arbeta med lösningar som integrerar oAuth2 och OpenID Connect (OIDC), samt moderna teknologiinfrastrukturer (on-prem nu och full Cloud framåt) och plattformar som Kubernetes,IaC, CI/CD, ArgoCD, Github.
   

  

 Ja du hör ju, en central och rolig tjänst i framkant! Visste du förresten att vi har 4 miljoner kunder, ca 5000 partners och 500 microtjänster? 🤩
   

  

**Är du den som kommer göra det?**
 Vi behöver dig som kan arbeta med utveckling av IAM med ett starkt säkerhetsfokus. Du ska kunna identifiera och lösa säkerhetsproblem, både självständigt och genom effektiv kommunikation och samarbete. Du är en pålitlig lagspelare som gärna delar med dig av din expertis till kollegor och fungerar som en möjliggörare.
   

  

 Det är vad vi önskar, vad önskar du av nästa arbetsgivare? Vi erbjuder en dynamisk och utmanande arbetsmiljö och möjligheter att arbeta med spännande och innovativa projekt. Du blir en del av ett skickligt team där du bidrar till att vi har en stabil och säker IT-plattform, där bra blir bättre helt enkelt!
   

  

 Våra medarbetare är det viktigaste vi har. Oavsett var du befinner dig rent geografiskt kommer du få möjlighet att växa och utvecklas. Och vi gör det tillsammans. Är du nyfiken på våra förmåner? Då hittar du dem här.
   

  

**Om Tech på Svenska Spel**
 På Svenska Spel hanterar vi 10 000 000 transaktioner varje dag, året runt och på sex dagar har vi hanterat samma transaktionsvolym som den största pengaöverföringsappen gör på en månad. Varje dag utvecklar, driftar och supportar vi ett av världens mest avancerade spelsystem. Vi är ett techbolag som sysslar med spel och med det kommer ett ansvar, både för folks drömmar och spänning, men även för deras spelande. Det är också därför du kommer märka att vårt spelansvarsarbete genomsyrar hela företaget från första dagen du börjar jobba hos oss. Vi är modiga, nyfikna och vi strävar efter enkelhet i allt vi gör.
   

  

**Ansökan och kontaktuppgifter**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering på något av våra kontor i Solna, Visby eller hemifrån om du bor någon annanstans i Sverige. På Svenska Spel gör vi jobbet där det passar bäst.
   

  

 Vi jobbar löpande med urval och intervjuer så tveka inte på att skicka in din ansökan redan idag.
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Linus Ansarfwe, linus.ansarfwe@svenskaspel.se
   

  

 För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta Team Talent Acquisition, teamta@svenskaspel.se

title: Integratör SCADA till Fastighetsautomation Årsta
description:
**Integratör SCADA till Fastighetsautomation Årsta** 




  





**Granitor Electro är ett av Skandinaviens ledande elteknikföretag. När du börjar arbeta hos oss kommer du till ett väletablerat företag med stark familjekänsla - med gemenskap, sammanhållning och trivsel. Vi är stolta över att kunna erbjuda varierande arbetsuppgifter, trygghet och goda utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter för våra anställda.** 




  





 Inom segmentet Fastighetsautomation utvecklar vi hållbara och energieffektiva system för fastigheter som bidrar till ett mer energieffektivt samhälle. Vi hjälper våra kunder med helhetslösningar för deras fastigheter– från konstruktion och programmering till installation och driftsättning av styrstem som styr allt från inomhusklimat och ventilation till belysning, alltid med fokus på energieffektivisering och optimal drift. Hos oss erbjuder vi dig en möjlighet att kombinera teknik och problemlösning i nära samarbete med engagerade kollegor.
 



  





**Vill du arbeta med teknik i framkant och bidra till ett mer energieffektivt och hållbart samhälle? Är du riktigt bra på att förstå hur saker och ting hänger ihop?** 




  





 Vi söker en integratör som kommer att arbeta med SCADA system framförallt Zaphire. Om du vill utvecklas tillsammans med ett prestigelöst team med mycket teknisk kompetens och stark gruppkänsla ska du inte tveka att söka!
 



  





**Om jobbet** 




  





 Som SCADA-integratör arbetar du med att skapa bilder, övervakningsfunktioner och system i en virtuell miljö. Du kommer genom ett ritprogram att visualisera ventilations- och värmeanläggningar så att kunderna får en enkel och tydlig översikt på sina anläggningar. I tjänsten arbetar du i projektform och har ett nära samarbete med PLC-programmerare och tekniker. Det finns goda möjligheter att lära av mer seniora kollegor. Vår avdelning för fastighetsautomation i Stockholm. Tjänsten är i första hand placerad på vårt kontor i Årsta.
 



  





**Om dig** 




  





 Vi söker dig som har läst någon form av programmering på gymnasie-/högskolenivå eller har ett eget intresse av att t.ex. skapa webbsidor eller att programmera appar. Behärskar såväl engelska som svenska obehindrat i både tal och skrift. Det är meriterande om du har B-körkort samt grundläggande kunskaper i MS Excel.
 



  





 Vi tror att du kommer att trivas hos oss om gillar att jobba i team, har en god förmåga att självständigt strukturera dina delar, är noggrann och månar om dina kontakter, både internt och externt.
 



  





**Din anställning hos oss!** 




  





 När du börjar hos oss kommer du att få en bra introduktion som vi är stolta över. Förutom att du får branschens bästa kollegor så kommer du även få förmåner som på olika sätt bidrar till en lite bättre vardag. Vi erbjuder bland annat:
 



  




* Trevliga kollegor som vi arbetar professionellt och tillsammans med för att lösa våra uppdrag
* Tillgång till vår förmånsportal Benify med möjlighet till rabatter hos olika aktörer
* Bra arbetsmiljö och ett fritt arbete under ansvar med intressanta och varierande uppdrag
* Möjlighet till personlig utveckling, fortbildning och karriär
* Kollektivavtalade försäkringar med goda villkor för tjänstepension och även extra skydd vid sjukdom mm.
* En spännande miljö i stabilt och expansivt företag
* Friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet till sjukvårdsgruppförsäkring
* Möjlighet till förmånliga drivmedelsavtal
* På Granitor sätter vi våra medarbetare i centrum!



  





**Har vi väckt ditt intresse?** 
 Ansök redan nu!
 



  





*Granitor Electro är ett av Skandinaviens största lokala el- och teknikföretag . Vårt fokus ligger på entreprenad- och servicetjänster inom fastighet, industri och infrastruktur. Vi är en del av Granitor-gruppen, en svensk företagsgrupp som är verksam inom fastighetsutveckling och förvaltning, entreprenad, konsult och underhåll samt tillväxtinvesteringar i utvecklingsbolag. Granitor Electro hade 2023 en omsättning på 3900 MSEK Sverige.*

title: Uppdragsledare/Produktägare till Utredningssystem
description:
Arbetsplatsbeskrivning
   

  

 Är du redo för en större uppgift?
   

  

 Polismyndigheten är Sveriges största myndighet med ca 40 000 medarbetare över hela landet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att bidra till Polisens uppdrag att öka tryggheten och minska brottsligheten i samhället.
   

  

 IT-avdelningens främsta uppgift är att tillhandahålla IT-tjänster till hela Polismyndigheten. IT-avdelningen en viktig del av det brottsförebyggande och brottsbekämpande arbetet och IT är ett av de viktigaste verktygen för att effektivisera polisen och öka kvaliteten i polisarbetet. IT-avdelningen utvecklar och moderniserar polisens IT och myndigheten satsar mycket på att stärka avdelningen med ny specialistkompetens och den senaste teknologin till nytta för medborgarna och medarbetarna i den polisiära verksamheten.
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Rollen som uppdragsledare hos Polismyndigheten kan liknas med en produktägare där du tillsammans med utvecklingsteamet driver utvecklingen av förmågor i de produkter som ägs av teamet. Du kommer leda teamet genom att sätta upp lång- och kortsiktiga mål, följa upp leveranser och arbeta med att snabbt byta riktning om prioriteringen ändras. I rollen samverkar du med andra uppdragsledare när det gäller prioriteringar och planering.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill arbeta med användarnas intressen i fokus och leder utvecklingsarbetet för att säkerställa att våra produkter och förmågor utvecklas över tid. I rollen samarbetar du med specialister och andra kompetenser från olika delar av verksamheten och IT-avdelningen för att gemensamt nå uppsatta mål.
   

  

 Tillsammans med ditt team kommer du också att utveckla processer och arbetssätt som passar er och er arbetsdynamik. Vi arbetar enligt moderna agila principer, där utvecklingsteamen har stort mandat att påverka hur arbetet utförs.
   

  

 Som uppdragsledare kan dina arbetsdagar bland annat innebära att:
   

  

* Ansvara för att teamet levererar med hög kvalitet och i rätt tid.
* Bidra strategiskt i frågor kring produktens utveckling och framtida riktning.
* Delta aktivt i behovsdialogen med verksamheten tillsammans med kravanalytiker.
* Koordinera och samordna arbetet mellan olika grupper inom IT-avdelningen och övriga delar av organisationen.
* Stödja verksamheten genom att dela din kunskap, erbjuda utbildning och utveckla rutiner för användning av relevanta system inom ditt område.
* Leda workshops och möten för att driva uppdrag framåt och engagera teamet.


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:
   

  

* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom för tjänsten relevant område, alternativt annan förvärvad erfarenhet, som Polismyndigheten bedömer likvärdig.
* Några års arbetslivserfarenhet i närtid av att samordna och strukturera uppdrag inom relevanta områden, exempelvis som produktägare, projektledare eller motsvarande, som Polismyndigheten bedömer relevant
* God erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig på svenska, både i tal och skrift


 Det är meriterande om du även har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av arbete med Jira, Confluence eller liknande ärende- och dokumentationssystem
* God teknisk förståelse kring mjukvaruutveckling
* Erfarenhet av att samarbeta med och hantera intressenter på olika nivåer i organisationen
* Erfarenhet och förmåga att fatta beslut och prioritera baserat på data och analys


 Personliga egenskaper:
   

  

 Vi söker dig som trivs med att skapa struktur, motivera team och agera hands-on när det behövs. Du är proaktiv, pedagogisk, målinriktad och har en lösningsorienterad inställning till både verksamheten och dina kollegor.
   

  

 Du har lätt för att samarbeta och bygga förtroendefulla relationer både inom och utanför organisationen. Vi tror att du gillar att arbeta nära verksamheten och användarna för att hitta kreativa lösningar på utmaningar.
   

  

 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och din personliga lämplighet då arbetet innebär många kontakter inom myndigheten och internt på IT-avdelningen.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Hanna Bergquist, HR-konsult
   

  

 hanna.bergquist@polisen.se
   

  

 Vid frågor om uppdraget kontakta
   

  

 010-563 77 82
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare
   

  

 Sofia Ask, Polisförbundet
   

  

 010-563 87 10
   

  

 SACO
   

  

 saco-s.avdelningarna@polisen.se
   

  

 Karna Tillheden, SEKO
   

  

 010-56 166 27
   

  

 ST, Polisen
   

  

 st.region-stockholm@polisen.se
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Löpande urval samt arbetstest kan komma att förekomma under rekryteringsprocessens gång.
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Arbetstid: Heltid, förtroendearbetstid
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Funktion: Uppdragsledare IT
   

  

 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
   

  

 Vi använder e-rekrytering för att effektivisera och kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsarbetet. Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Polisens rekryteringsstöd Visma Recruit.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 Om du vill komplettera din ansökan vänder du dig till ansvarig HR-konsult.
   

  

 En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.
   

  

 Polismyndigheten är Sveriges största myndighet. Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som stimulerar till mångfald, kreativitet och personlig utveckling.
   

  

 Läs gärna om våra förmåner som anställd hos polisen på: polisen.se/erbjudande
   

  

 Vi bedriver vår verksamhet enligt vår värdegrund: engagemang, effektivitet och tillgänglighet. Som medarbetare inom polisen agerar du för likabehandling. Det är en förutsättning för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och för polisens legitimitet i samhället. Som företrädare för polisen respekterar du allas lika värde och skapar förtroende för polisen.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om polisen och vår verksamhet på www.polisen.se
   

 polisen.se
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi undanber oss samtal och mail från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Sök jobbet
   

  

 Ansökan sker via polisens rekryteringsverktyg
